KROCW.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KROGIE.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KROWIE.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KRPERF.description: Relative Permeability Data for Well Completions (Optional)
KRPERF.long description: *KRPERF specifies the relative permeability table set numbers and end points for individual well completions.

KRPRDET.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

KRPRGRID.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

KRRESET.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

KRSWITCH.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

KRTEMTAB.long description: Specify temperature dependence for saturation function endpoints.

KRTYPE.description: Rock Type Number for Rock-Fluid Data
KRTYPE.long description: Define rock type number for rock-fluid data, and assign rock type number to grid blocks.

KRTYPE_CTRGAS.long description: Specify rock-fluid sets to use to model countercurrent flow.

KRTYPE_CTROIL.long description: Specify rock-fluid sets to use to model countercurrent flow.

KRTYPE_CTRWAT.long description: Specify rock-fluid sets to use to model countercurrent flow.

KRTYPE_VERT.description: Rock Type Number for Rock-Fluid Data
KRTYPE_VERT.long description: Define rock type number for rock-fluid data, and assign rock type number to grid blocks.

KRWIE.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KRWIRO.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KRWRO.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

KVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the K Direction
KVAR.long description: *KVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the K direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

KVKEYCOMP.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

KVTABLE.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

KVTABLIM.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

LAYERCLUMP.long description: Define a control lump, which is a set of layers (perforations, completions) with a name and computed rate, cumulative, and stream ratio values. To each control lump there is also an associated setting value.

LAYER-CTRL.long description: Modify layer status or well indices for individual completions.

LAYERGRAD.long description: Specify pressure gradients between adjacent completions within a wellbore. This keyword is useful to model pumped-off producing wells.

LAYERIJK.description: Simplified Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERIJK.long description: *LAYERIJK allows a simplified specification of a deviated wellbore by overriding the *GEOMETRY direction for each well completion layer.

LAYERRLUMP.long description: Define a report lump which is a set of well layers, where stream rates, cumulatives and production rate ratios are calculated and on which triggers can be based. A report lump is more flexible than a control lump (*LAYERCLUMP).

LAYERXYZ.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LAYERXYZ-METHOD.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ-METHOD.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LEP-DIAMETER.long description: Use limited entry perforations (LEP) for specified injectors.

LEP-DISCHARGE-COEFF.long description: Use limited entry perforations (LEP) for specified injectors.

LEP-DISCHARGE-COEFF-CNST.long description: Use limited entry perforations (LEP) for specified injectors.

LEP-WELL.long description: Use limited entry perforations (LEP) for specified injectors.

LG-KEQ.long description: Input parameters to build the aqueous species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the equilibrium constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent reactions (optional).

LG-KEX.long description: Input parameters to build the sorbed species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the exchange equilibrium constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent exchange equilibrium reactions (optional).

LG-KSP.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

LIQLIQKV.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

LIQPHASE.long description: Specify the liquid phase(s) to which the subsequent liquid data is to be assigned.

LIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

LOG-TRAP-RATE-CONSTANT.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

LOG-TST-RATE-CONSTANT.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

MAGNIFYDI.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDJ.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDK.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MANIFOLD.description: Defining Group Production or Injection as Going Through a Manifold (Optional)
MANIFOLD.long description: Specify that group production or injection of a stream goes through a manifold, that is, the group’s wells have the same pressure at the upper end of the tubing.

MATRIX.long description: *MATRIX is used immediately after a grid property keyword to indicate that a matrix property is being input.

MAX_OS_FACTOR.description: Normal Variation in Variables per Timestep (Optional)
MAX_OS_FACTOR.long description: *NORM specifies target changes in the basic variables over a timestep. *MAX_OS_FACTOR allows the variable change to exceed *NORM without triggering timestep size cut. *FORCE_MAXCHK can be used to override the default strategy for maximum change check and timestep size cut.

MAXERROR.long description: *MAXERROR specifies the maximum number of error messages before the simulation terminates.

MAXLAYPRE.long description: *MAXLAYPRE controls the pre-elimination of wells before iterative matrix solution.

MAXPRES.long description: Over-ride default upper and lower limits for pressures and temperatures.

MAXSTEPS.long description: Specify the maximum allowed timestep number.

MAXTEMP.long description: Over-ride default upper and lower limits for pressures and temperatures.

MCCMODEL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCETHA.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCHARDF.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOCR.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

MCOMINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCONNG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MCPREHD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCRCSL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSIM.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSWINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MDICLU_PG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MDSPI_GAS.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPI_OIL.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPI_WAT.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPJ_GAS.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPJ_OIL.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPJ_WAT.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPK_GAS.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPK_OIL.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MDSPK_WAT.long description: Enter mechanical (convective) dispersivity for the desired phase.

MFRAC_GAS.long description: Specify initial mole or mass fractions of the fluid phases.

MFRAC_OIL.long description: Specify initial mole or mass fractions of the fluid phases.

MFRAC_WAT.long description: Specify initial mole or mass fractions of the fluid phases.

MINC.long description: *MINC indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the multiple-interacting-continua (MINC) approach.

MINPRES.long description: Over-ride default upper and lower limits for pressures and temperatures.

MIN-REACT-SURFACE-AREA.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

MINTEMP.long description: Over-ride default upper and lower limits for pressures and temperatures.

MOBCFAC.long description: Specify the mobility multiplier for components in the water phase.

MOD.long description: *MOD indicates the modification of a cell-based grid array.

MODEL.long description: Indicate number and name of each type of component in preparation for fluid data input.

MODELSHUT.long description: *MODELSHUT allows fluid equilibration in a shut-in well via crossflow between layers.

MOLDIFF_DEP.description: Temperature and Viscosity Dependence of Diffusion
MOLDIFF_DEP.long description: Specify temperature and viscosity dependence of molecular diffusion for the desired component and phase.

MONITOR.long description: Specify a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

MPLNE.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MRC-RESET.description: Resetting Well Operating Constraint after Value Change (Optional)
MRC-RESET.long description: Specify whether a well should be set to its Most Restrictive Constraint after a change in the value of an operating constraint via *OPERATE, *ALTER, or *TARGET.

MTVEL.long description: Specify the dependence of chemical reactions and nonequilibrium mass transfer on permeability or phase velocity.

MW-TRCR.long description: Define passive tracers and assign their associated components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest.

MXCNRPT.long description: Specifies maximum number of continue-repeats allowed in each timestep.

NB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NCOUPLING.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

NCUTS.long description: Control the number of timestep size cuts allowed in a timestep before the run aborts.

NE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NETGROSS.long description: *NETGROSS indicates input of an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NETPAY.long description: *NETPAY indicates input of an array of net pays which are to be converted internally to an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NEWTONCYC.long description: *NEWTONCYC is used to specify the maximum number of Newtonian cycles.

NFZ.long description: *FZ and *NFZ specify assignment of an input property to a type of fracture zone.

NFZG-ALIGN.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

NINCS.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NINEPOINT.long description: *NINEPOINT controls the nine-point spatial discretization option.

NINEPTH.long description: *NINEPOINT controls the nine-point spatial discretization option.

NITERGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NLINEAR.long description: Assign a nonlinear constitutive model for a type of rock.

NNODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOCOUPERM.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

NODE4.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE8.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE9.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEX.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEY.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEZ.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOLIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

NOLISTLIM.long description: Control the detailed echoing of input grid-array data.

NORM.description: Normal Variation in Variables per Timestep (Optional)
NORM.long description: *NORM specifies target changes in the basic variables over a timestep. *MAX_OS_FACTOR allows the variable change to exceed *NORM without triggering timestep size cut. *FORCE_MAXCHK can be used to override the default strategy for maximum change check and timestep size cut.

NORTH.long description: Specify the maximum number of orthogonalizations (GMRES steps) to be performed by the iterative solution method before resetting.

NORTHG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

NTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NTRCR.long description: Define passive tracers and assign their associated components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest.

NULL.long description: *NULL indicates the input of an array of null block indicators.

NULL-PERF.long description: *NULL-PERF specifies how perforations in inactive (null or pinched out) grid blocks are to be handled.

NUMERICAL.long description: *NUMERICAL identifies the beginning of all numerical methods control keywords.

NUMSET.long description: Define and assign multiple numerical sets.

NUMTYPE.long description: Define and assign multiple numerical sets.

NWHYFS.description: Set Number of Points for WHP Root Search (Optional)
NWHYFS.long description: *NWHYFS allows the user to set the number of points used to determine whether a value of the BHP exists which yields the target well head pressure (WHP). This number defaults to 9 and it is not anticipated that the user would normally alter this value. However in certain cases in which a well operating on an implicit WHP constraint suddenly shuts for no apparent reason, invoking *NWHYFS for the well with a value exceeding 9 (11 for example) may allow the well to continue. Larger values of this integer may cause run times to increase.

O2CONC.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

O2PP.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

OCRV.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with the values of interpolating parameter.

OILPHASE.long description: Specify the liquid phase(s) to which the subsequent liquid data is to be assigned.

OMEGA_PMAX.long description: Specify incomplete mixing for the water phase using Todd-Longstaff equations.

OMEGA_PW.long description: Specify incomplete mixing for the water phase using Todd-Longstaff equations.

ON-TIME.long description: *ON-TIME specifies the fraction of time during which a well or group operates.

OPEN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

OPERATE.long description: Define the well operating constraints and the remedial action to be taken when a constraint is violated.

OPERATE-HIST.description: Operating Constraints in History Matching Mode (Optional)
OPERATE-HIST.long description: *OPERATE-HIST indicates that well operating constraints defined by *OPERATE are under the special history-matching mode and the constraint values entered for surface phase rates serve as the observed flow rates.

ORTHOGG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

OUTBOARD.long description: Provide a generic data passing interface for any outboard (third-party) software to update a CMG simulator's recurrent data.

OUTPRN.long description: *OUTPRN identifies what information is written to the output print file at a frequency given by *WPRN. *PARTCLSIZE provides the properties required to print out in some optional units.

OUTSOLVR.long description: *OUTSOLVR controls printout of detailed results from the matrix solving packages.

OUTSRF.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

OUTUNIT.long description: *INUNIT specifies the input data units. *OUTUNIT specifies the output data units.

PARTCLSIZE.long description: *OUTPRN identifies what information is written to the output print file at a frequency given by *WPRN. *PARTCLSIZE provides the properties required to print out in some optional units.

PARTOL-TOL.long description: *CORNER-TOL controls the minimal spacing required to separate corner points. *CORNER-TOL  cptol *PARTOL-TOL  partol

PAUSE.long description: Pause simulator execution temporarily to allow another application to run.

PAYDEPTH.long description: Specify depth to the centre of the net pay for each grid block in the reservoir.

PBASE.long description: Define a reservoir pore volume dilation-recompaction model.

PBC.long description: Specify initial mole or mass fractions of the fluid phases.

PC_3RD_PHASE.long description: Specify third-phase correction for capillary pressure.

PCGEND.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

PCG-PCOND.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCG-SCALE.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCGWEND.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

PCON-MANIFOLD.long description: To better honor a group’s manifold or surface pressure constraint, translate it to a tubing-head pressure constraint that is assigned to all that group’s wells.

PCOW_CRV.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with the values of interpolating parameter.

PCRIT.long description: Assign component critical pressure, critical temperature and acentric factor.

PCWEND.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

PDD.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDD_DATA.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PDEGAA.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGAAG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PDEGAB.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PDILA.long description: Define a reservoir pore volume dilation-recompaction model.

PEAKANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PEAKCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PERF.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERF_FLX specifies completion locations, well indices or parameters for well index calculations for Flexible Wellbore.

PERF_FLX.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERF_FLX specifies completion locations, well indices or parameters for well index calculations for Flexible Wellbore.

PERF-MD.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERF_FLX specifies completion locations, well indices or parameters for well index calculations for Flexible Wellbore.

PERFSCAN.long description: Option to reduce the frequency of solver pointer generation.

PERFV.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERF_FLX specifies completion locations, well indices or parameters for well index calculations for Flexible Wellbore.

PERMCK.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMEXP.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMI.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMJ.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMK.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMODULUS.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

PERMSCALE.long description: Specify the dependence of chemical reactions and nonequilibrium mass transfer on permeability or phase velocity.

PERMSHALE.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMSLD.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMTAB.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMTABLOG.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMULI.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMULJ.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PERMULK.long description: Specify dependence of permeability on fluid porosity.

PFRAC.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PFRACF.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PGDILA.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the *DILATION option.

PGPACT.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the *DILATION option.

PGPDMAX.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the *DILATION option.

PGT_ADJUST.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PGT_GAS.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PGT_UPDATE.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PGT_WATER.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PHWELLBORE.long description: *PHWELLBORE specifies that pressure drop and heat loss will be calculated from the surface to the first perforation specified via *PERF card.

PINCHOUTARRAY.long description: *PINCHOUTARRAY defines pinch outs using an array input format.

PINCHOUT-TOL.long description: *PINCHOUT-TOL controls the minimal thickness required to initiate an automatic pinched out connection (see also *PINCHOUTARRAY).

PINCHVGAP.long description: Controls the vertical connectivity between blocks separated by pinched out blocks in a corner point grid.

PINJW.long description: Assign and override defaults of attributes of the injected stream.

PIVOT.long description: Specify the diagonal sub-matrix inversion pivot stabilization.

PIVOTG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PLNR_REFINE.long description: Create a local grid tailored toward a planar hydraulic fracture.

PLNRFRAC.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLNRFRAC_TEMPLATE.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLOADBC.long description: Specify external loads on any nodal points of a finite element.

PLOADBC3D.long description: Specify external load on any nodal points of a 3D finite element.

PLSTRAINY.long description: Specify that strains will be calculated by a series of planes normal to the Y (J) direction.

PNPROSL.description: Number of PARASOL Classes for GMRES (Optional)
PNPROSL.long description: Choose the number and scaling of GMRES vector operation classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) used in the scaling and GMRES iteration.

PNTHRDS.long description: Specify the number of parallel processing threads to use in the simulation.

POISSONMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

POISSRATIO.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

POISSRATIOIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

PORFORM.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the formation compressibility. *CPOR signals the input of formation compressibility. *CTPOR signals the input of formation thermal expansion. *CPORPD signals the input of pressure-dependent formation compressibility. *PORINTERP specifies the interpretation of input porosity. *PORFORM specifies the form of p and T variation of porosity. *VOLCONST specifies the volume constraint type.

PORFT.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

PORINTERP.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the formation compressibility. *CPOR signals the input of formation compressibility. *CTPOR signals the input of formation thermal expansion. *CPORPD signals the input of pressure-dependent formation compressibility. *PORINTERP specifies the interpretation of input porosity. *PORFORM specifies the form of p and T variation of porosity. *VOLCONST specifies the volume constraint type.

PORMAX.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the formation compressibility. *CPOR signals the input of formation compressibility. *CTPOR signals the input of formation thermal expansion. *CPORPD signals the input of pressure-dependent formation compressibility. *PORINTERP specifies the interpretation of input porosity. *PORFORM specifies the form of p and T variation of porosity. *VOLCONST specifies the volume constraint type.

POROSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PORRATMAX.long description: Define a reservoir pore volume dilation-recompaction model.

PORVOL.long description: Specify grid cell porosity indirectly via pore volume.

PPACT.long description: Define a reservoir pore volume dilation-recompaction model.

PPATTERN.long description: Specify the basic partitioning of the reservoir into non-connected regions and separators that makes possible the parallelization of the linear solution.

PPATTERNG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PPLASTIC.long description: Define a reservoir compaction-rebounding model with elastic-plastic deformations via constant compressibility and thermal expansion coefficient.

PR_IN_SHUT.long description: Specify conditions for switching between injection, injection - production soak, production and production - injection shut-in cycles for a Cyclic steam stimulation.

PRECAB.long description: Use *PRECC and *PRECAB to specify the convergence tolerance for the linear equation solver.

PRECABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PRECC.long description: Use *PRECC and *PRECAB to specify the convergence tolerance for the linear equation solver.

PRECCG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PREFRAC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

PRES.long description: Specify initial reservoir pressures and temperatures.

PRES-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
PRES-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

PRESCBC.long description: Prescribe displacement-type boundary conditions on nodal points of a finite element.

PRESCBC3D.long description: Prescribed displacement-type boundary conditions on a nodal point of a 3D finite element.

PRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PRINT_REF.long description: *PRNTORIEN overrides the default grid printout orientation. *PRINT_REF defeats the printing of refined grid printout.

PRINTGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

PRIOR-FORM.long description: *PRIOR-FORM defines the priority formulae and numerical control parameters for the priority ranking apportionment method or the internal guide rate method set by *APPOR-METHOD *PRIOR / *INGUIDE to meet group targets. It is aimed to produce a desired stream while minimizing the production of other/nuisance streams. It can also be used to meet an injection target by which only the most "injectable" wells operate.

PRNTORIEN.long description: *PRNTORIEN overrides the default grid printout orientation. *PRINT_REF defeats the printing of refined grid printout.

PROD_C_SWT.long description: Specify conditions for switching between injection, injection - production soak, production and production - injection shut-in cycles for a Cyclic steam stimulation.

PRODUCER.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer or injector).

PRPOR.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the formation compressibility. *CPOR signals the input of formation compressibility. *CTPOR signals the input of formation thermal expansion. *CPORPD signals the input of pressure-dependent formation compressibility. *PORINTERP specifies the interpretation of input porosity. *PORFORM specifies the form of p and T variation of porosity. *VOLCONST specifies the volume constraint type.

PRS-ITERMAX.long description: *PRS-ITERMAX specifies the maximum number of ILU pressure solve iterations to be performed per full linear solver iteration (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAA.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAB.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PRECC.description: Convergence Precision for ILU Pressure Solver (Optional)
PRS-PRECC.long description: *PRS-PRECC specifies the convergence tolerance for the ILU pressure solve (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRSR.long description: Specify reference conditions for fluid properties and surface conditions.

PSURF.long description: Specify reference conditions for fluid properties and surface conditions.

PTHRESH-FAULT.long description: Specify the threshold pressure for flow cross a fault plane.

PTHRESHI.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PTHRESHJ.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PTHRESHK.long description: Define the potential gradients threshold and the derivatives for restraining fluid flows on interblock boundaries.

PTRANSI.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSIJ-.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSIJ+.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSIK-.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSIK+.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSJ.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTRANSK.long description: Assign pressure-dependent transmissibility multiplier parameters and locations.

PTUBE1.long description: *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 specifies a table of tubing-head (or outlet) pressure data tables for a production or injection well (or manifold group). The tabulated variable is the bottom-hole (or inlet) pressure, with tubing-head (or outlet) pressure and several independent variables such as surface rates or rate ratios. *PTUBE1 can also be used to input the well-head temperature table.

PTUBE-FIXFRAC.long description: Specify globally the hydraulic table lookup method for calculating the tubing-head pressure of producers.

PTYPE.long description: Define multiple PVT property sets and assign them to grid cell regions.

PVCUTFR.long description: *PVCUTFR controls the level at which a fracture cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTOFF.long description: *PVCUTOFF controls the level at which a cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG-FR.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG-FR.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVT_DEPARTURE.long description: Use the Lee-Kesler departure method to calculate enthalpy for oil and gas phases.

PVTOSCMAX.description: Maximum Number of Phase Switches per Timestep (Optional)
PVTOSCMAX.long description: *PVTOSCMAX is used to force the maximum number of phase switches (e.g. water component in gas and water phase) per timestep when a phase is appearing or disappearing in a grid block.

PVTSET.long description: Define multiple PVT property sets and assign them to grid cell regions.

QUAL.long description: Assign and override defaults of attributes of the injected stream.

QUALWL.long description: *QUALWL specifies injection steam quality for a list of wells.

RAMPCTRL.long description: Enables the automatic adjustment of steam and solvent co-injection rates in order to maintain the well bottom-hole pressure.

RANGE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

RANGECHECK.long description: *RANGECHECK controls the data range check feature.

RCONBK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONBT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONFT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONLF.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONRT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONTP.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

REACTIVE-SURFACE-AREA.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

REFINE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

REGIONMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers between specified regions.

RENTH.long description: Assign thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RENTH_GCH.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

REPLACE.long description: Open or close a previously defined Flexible Wellbore.

REPORTING-GROUP.long description: *REPORTING-GROUP allows the definition of a group with arbitrary well membership and weighting factors, for reporting purposes only.

RESDATE.long description: Specify the starting timestep, time or date.

RESDUCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

RESTART.long description: Specify the starting timestep, time or date.

RESTART_SR2.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

RESTIME.long description: Specify the starting timestep, time or date.

REWIND.long description: *WRST and *REWIND control the frequency of writing and rewinding restart records in the output restart file.

RG.long description: *RG is used to assign values of an array to refined grid blocks.

RIGIDNULL.long description: Assign fixed boundary to nodes around a null block.

RIGIDTOP.long description: Constrain vertical movement on the cap rock of a reservoir.

RM-LAYERCLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a control lump.

RM-LAYERRLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a report lump.

ROCK_IN_FRAC.long description: Globally modify fracture definition and properties in fracture blocks.

ROCKFLUID.long description: *ROCKFLUID indicates the start of the rock-fluid data.

ROCKJOINT.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

ROCKTYPE.long description: Define and assign multiple rock property types.

RORDER.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RPHASE.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RPLTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RPT.description: Rock Type Number for Rock-Fluid Data
RPT.long description: Define rock type number for rock-fluid data, and assign rock type number to grid blocks.

RPT_INTRP.long description: Specify interpolation between two rock types of rock-fluid data.

RPWTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RRFT.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

RRFTG.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

RRFTO.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

RRFTW.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

RTEMLOWR.long description: Assign thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RTEMUPR.long description: Assign thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RTYPE.description: Rock Type Number for Rock-Fluid Data
RTYPE.long description: Define rock type number for rock-fluid data, and assign rock type number to grid blocks.

RUN.long description: *RUN identifies the beginning of all Well and Recurrent Data section keywords.

RXCMPFAC.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RXCRITCON.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

RXEQBAK.long description: Specify chemical reactions that deviate from equilibrium.

RXEQBASE.long description: Specify chemical reactions that deviate from equilibrium.

RXEQFOR.long description: Specify chemical reactions that deviate from equilibrium.

RXORDUSE.long description: Assign non-thermal chemical reaction and nonequilibrium mass transfer data.

SA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SAT_ADJUST.long description: Ensure a non-zero liquid phase saturation.

SBETA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SBG.description: Assign Data to Structured Block Groups
SBG.long description: *SBG assigns values or tasks to a group of blocks defined by *SBLOCKGROUP.

SCONNECT.long description: *SCONNECT allows the definition of flow connections between blocks that would not otherwise be generated by the simulator. Also, *SCONNECT allows existing flow connections to be overridden.

SCWIPV.long description: Specify the mobility multiplier for components in the water phase.

SD_HCMULT.long description: Specify inter-subdomain multiplier for heat conduction.

SD_REINF.long description: Modify capillary continuity for inter-Subdomain interblock connections.

SDBIOTSCF.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDCOHES.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDEGREE.long description: Specify the maximum degree of fill terms used in the linear solver’s factorization.

SDEGREEG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SDELASTMOD.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDFRICANG.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDILANG.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDPOISSON.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDSCL.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SDTHEXPCF.long description: Assign geomechanical properties for a STARS solid component.

SECTOR.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize output of regional reservoir activity.

SECTORARRAY.long description: Specify reporting sector using a grid-array format.

SECTORNAMES.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize regional reservoir activity, via sector number and grid array.

SETHA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SETPI.long description: Overwrite a well’s phase productivity/injectivity, or multiply it by a factor.

SG.long description: Specify initial saturations in reservoir, or override vertical equilibrium saturations.

SGAMMA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SGCON.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SGLIM.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

SGR.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SHAPE.long description: Specify which shape factor formulation to use in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SHAPE-HC.long description: *SHAPE-HC specifies the type of shape factor used in calculating heat conduction between matrix and fracture in a naturally fractured block.

SHEAR_FAC.long description: Convert fluid Darcy velocities to report equivalent porous media shear rates.

SHEARMOD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

SHEARMODIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARTAB.long description: Specify shear effects on fluid viscosity using tabular input data for shear-component viscosity of the last component specified by *VSMIXCOMP.

SHEARTHCKT.long description: Specify component-viscosity shear thinning and thickening effects for the last component specified by *VSMIXCOMP.

SHEARTHICK.long description: Specify component-viscosity shear thinning and thickening effects for the last component specified by *VSMIXCOMP.

SHEARTHIN.long description: Specify component-viscosity shear thinning and thickening effects for the last component specified by *VSMIXCOMP.

SHIFT.long description: Specify shift values for numerical derivatives.

SHPERMAX.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHPERMRES.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHUTIN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

SHUT-WELL.long description: Choose treatment of shut-in Flexible Wellbore or Tubing.

SIGMAG_TAB.long description: Define pressure dependence of gas-oil interfacial tension for J Function option.

SIGMAMF.description: Direct Input of Shape Factor and Transfer Permeability Arrays (Optional)
SIGMAMF.long description: Keywords *SIGMAMF and *KAVMF allow direct input of the block shape factor and average transfer permeability arrays, respectively, for each grid block to be used in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SIP_DATA.long description: Keyword to indicate that grid-array data is stored in binary or simulation input (SIP) compressed form.

SITERPG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SKAPA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKAPA2.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKIN-TUNER.long description: *SKIN-TUNER calculates and applies a separate well index multiplier to wells so that the user-specified bottom-hole pressure and surface rate will match under the current reservoir and wellbore conditions.

SKVTABLE.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

SKVTABLIM.long description: Assign K values in table form. Liquid-liquid K values must be assigned this way.

SLCON.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SLD_KIN.long description: Specify kinetic model used for solid species. Specify if solid species is: 1) in equilibrium with aqueous and ion exchange species, 2) in partial equilibrium with a rate-dependent equilibrium defined by transitional state theory, or 3) in equilibrium with flowing and stationary precipitates defined by a rate-dependent trapping process.

SLT.long description: Define the liquid-gas relative permeability table.

SM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SMALL-RATES.long description: Over-ride the default cut-off for small well rates.

SN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SNG.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SO.long description: Specify initial saturations in reservoir, or override vertical equilibrium saturations.

SOIRG.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SOIRW.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SOLID_CP.long description: Assign properties of components in the solid/adsorbed/trapped phase.

SOLID_DEN.long description: Assign properties of components in the solid/adsorbed/trapped phase.

SOLIDMIN.long description: Specify nonequilibrium blockage by captured solid (non-fluid) components.

SOLVER.long description: Choose which linear equation solver to use: AIMSOL or PARASOL.

SOLVERG.long description: Specify the matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SORDER.long description: Specify the ordering of equations in the ILU factorization.

SORDERG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SORG.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SORW.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SPATM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SPECGRAV.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis.

SRFASCII.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

SRFORMAT.long description: Specify the file format for passing simulation results to CMG viewing software.

SRFTNG.long description: Use Leverett J Functions to represent capillary effects.

SRFTNW.long description: Use Leverett J Functions to represent capillary effects.

SSMODEL.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STEN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STOICH_AQ.long description: Input parameters to build the aqueous species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the equilibrium constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent reactions (optional).

STOICH_SLD.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

STOICH_SRB.long description: Input parameters to build the sorbed species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the exchange equilibrium constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent exchange equilibrium reactions (optional).

STOP.long description: Control start, stop, well change and printout times.

STOPROD.long description: Assign reaction data that is mandatory when reactions are used.

STOREAC.long description: Assign reaction data that is mandatory when reactions are used.

STP2WL-PARAM.long description: Modify the *WCUTBACK parameters for a producer operating on a *STEAMTRAP2 constraint.

STRESI.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS_RETURN.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

STRESS3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSGRAD.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSGRAD3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSH.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSHIJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHIK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHJK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

SUBDOMAIN.long description: *SUBDOMAIN indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the subdomain method.

SUPER-SATURATION-INDEX.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

SURFLASH.long description: Specify reference conditions for fluid properties and surface conditions.

SW.long description: Specify initial saturations in reservoir, or override vertical equilibrium saturations.

SWCON.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SWCONM.long description: Specify the mobility multiplier for components in the water phase.

SWCRIT.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SWINIT.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWINIT_ADJMOB.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_ADJMOB.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWINIT_CONTROL.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_CONTROL.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWINIT_CPADJST.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_CPADJST.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWINIT_FRAC.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_FRAC.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWINIT_NOCRIT.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_NOCRIT.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation to override the values generated by a vertical equilibrium option while maintaining no-flow condition by adjusting capillary pressure. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for capillary pressure adjustment. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB controls the capillary pressure adjustment in water immobile region. *SWINIT_FRAC controls the capillary pressure adjustment in fracture blocks.

SWIPV.long description: Assign rock (permeability) dependence of adsorption data for component/phase indicated via *ADSCOMP.

SWIRG.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SWR.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SWRG.long description: Overwrite saturation endpoints, relative permeability endpoints and capillary pressure endpoints from the tables. Activate the three-point scaling and define how the saturation endpoints are applied.

SWT.long description: Define the water-oil relative permeability table.

TARGET.long description: *TARGET allows modification of any previously specified well constraint value or the specification of a new constraint type and value for well(s).

TCRIT.long description: Assign component critical pressure, critical temperature and acentric factor.

TDMAX.long description: Assign limits of pore volume and transmissibility changes due to volumetric dilation which includes the shear dilation component.

TDMIN.long description: Assign limits of pore volume and transmissibility changes due to volumetric dilation which includes the shear dilation component.

TEMLIM.long description: Specify data and printout for automatic rock-fluid switching.

TEMP.long description: Specify initial reservoir pressures and temperatures.

TEMP-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
TEMP-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

TEMR.long description: Specify reference conditions for fluid properties and surface conditions.

TFORM.long description: Indicate formulation options of numerical model.

THCONANTAB.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONG.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONGTAB.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONMIX.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONO.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONR.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONR_SHL.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONS.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONTAB.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THCONW.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THEXPCOEF.long description: Specify the thermal expansion coefficient for a rock type due to the thermal effect.

THEXPCOEFI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

THTYPE.long description: Define and assign multiple rock property types.

THTYPE_FLX.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

THTYPE_SAM.long description: Specify thermal conductivities of rock, solid and fluid phases.

TIME.long description: Control start, stop, well change and printout times.

TINJW.long description: Assign and override defaults of attributes of the injected stream.

TITLE1.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TITLE2.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TITLE3.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TMPSET.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
TMPSET.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

TORTIKE_VG.long description: Override the internal gas phase viscosity with a composition-dependent, and possibly pressure-dependent, calculation.

TORTU.long description: Enter effective molecular diffusion coefficients for the desired component and phase.

TRANLI.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLJ.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLK.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANSD.long description: *TRANSD enables vertical inter-block matrix-fracture flow in *DUALPERM model, or vertical inter-block matrix-matrix flow in *SUBDOMAIN model, and indicates input of an array of transmissibility multipliers to be applied on these connections.

TRANSF.long description: Adjusts transmissibilities on a fault basis.

TRANSI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSIJ-.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIJ+.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIK-.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIK+.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSLATE.description: Changing the Keywords by Using Translate Rules (Optional)
TRANSLATE.long description: *TRANSLATE changes or translates your own favorite keyword into a CMG simulator recognizable keyword.

TRANSMF.long description: *TRANSMF specifies transmissibility multiplier for fluid flow between matrix and fracture.

TRANSMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers.

TRANVI.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVJ.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVK.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVMOD.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRCR-AQUIFER.long description: Define initial tracer concentration in reservoir grid and aquifers.

TRCR-ASSOC.long description: Define passive tracers and assign their associated components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest.

TRCR-CFL.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls for solving the tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit method. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine the timestep size for the explicit method.

TRCR-INJCONC.long description: Specifies the concentration of a tracer in an injection well.

TRCRNAME.long description: Define passive tracers and assign their associated components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest.

TRCR-SOLVE.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls for solving the tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit method. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine the timestep size for the explicit method.

TREF_GCH.long description: Initiate geochemistry option for simulating aqueous reactions. Specify the number of elemental components and total number of fluid and solid species participating in the aqueous reactions. Indicate if precipitation and ion exchange is present and the total number of sorbed species. Also, indicate the geo-elements and their location in the STARS component list. Enter the reference temperature for geochemical reactions.

TRGLOBALC.long description: Define initial tracer concentration in reservoir grid and aquifers.

TRGVAR.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRGVARS.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRIGGER.description: Allow for a Set of Keywords to be Processed When a Specified Condition (Trigger) is Satisfied (Optional)
TRIGGER.long description: Specify certain actions which are implemented when one or more specific conditions are satisfied during the simulation.

TST-DAMP.long description: Input parameters to build the solid species reaction stoichiometry matrix. Input the logarithms of the solubility product constants for each reaction. Input the enthalpy change for temperature dependent precipitation/dissolution reactions (optional). Input rate parameters for transitional state theory and equilibrium trapping solid kinetics. Input solid precipitation/dissolution reaction enthalpy.

TSURF.long description: Specify reference conditions for fluid properties and surface conditions.

TUNING_TOOLS.long description: Specify options which can speed-up simulations of very nonlinear problems such as steam injection in a fractured reservoir.

TWELLBORE.long description: *TWELLBORE specifies that wellbore temperature calculations will be done for a producer with the assigned method. It is used primarily in iso-thermal models.

UBA.long description: Specify address for any block in the grid.

UHTR.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTR.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAI-.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAI-.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAI+.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAI+.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAJ-.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAJ-.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAJ+.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAJ+.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAK-.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAK-.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UHTRAREAK+.description: Constant and Convective Heat Transfer Model
UHTRAREAK+.long description: Assign data for constant and convective heat transfer models.

UNLOADSTR.long description: Assign total stress to be unloaded at the well boundary.

UNRELAX.long description: *UNRELAX and *VARI_URF control the updating of primary variables for Newton iterations.

UPWIND.long description: Use the Multi-Dimensional Upwind method to reduce grid orientation effects.
