URBCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URECOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN1.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN2.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

USHEARST.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

USTRESCUR.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

UTSTRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

VAL-SRB.long description: Specify charge and names of sorbed species participating in the chemical reactions. Indicate the valence number difference for each species pair participating in exchange reactions with the reservoir clay. Input the ion-exchange capacity for the rock clays.

VAMOD.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VARI_URF.long description: *UNRELAX and *VARI_URF control the updating of primary variables for Newton iterations.

VATYPE.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VISCTYPE.long description: Define and assign multiple viscosity property types.

VISFLOWR.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISINIT.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPARA.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPOWER.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSCHEME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSTEP.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISTIME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VOLCONST.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the formation compressibility. *CPOR signals the input of formation compressibility. *CTPOR signals the input of formation thermal expansion. *CPORPD signals the input of pressure-dependent formation compressibility. *PORINTERP specifies the interpretation of input porosity. *PORFORM specifies the form of p and T variation of porosity. *VOLCONST specifies the volume constraint type.

VOLMOD.long description: *VOLMOD indicates input of an array of bulk volume modifiers.

VOLSHF.long description: Enable electrical heating and specify electrical property sets.

VOLTOL.long description: Enable electrical heating and specify electrical property sets.

VRI_GROUP.description: Injection Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
VRI_GROUP.long description: Specify the injection group from which gas/water/voidage injection rates will be taken to calculate a production recycling or voidage replacement target for a given group or groups. The actual recycling or voidage replacement target is specified using keyword *GCONP.

VSMIXCOMP.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule for liquid viscosities. *VSMIXGROUP allows the grouping of components with similar viscosity characteristics for accurate representation of mixture viscosity.

VSMIXENDP.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule for liquid viscosities. *VSMIXGROUP allows the grouping of components with similar viscosity characteristics for accurate representation of mixture viscosity.

VSMIXFUNC.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule for liquid viscosities. *VSMIXGROUP allows the grouping of components with similar viscosity characteristics for accurate representation of mixture viscosity.

VSMIXGROUP.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule for liquid viscosities. *VSMIXGROUP allows the grouping of components with similar viscosity characteristics for accurate representation of mixture viscosity.

VSSALTCMP.long description: Specify salinity component affecting the viscosity of the nonlinear mixing component and the effective parameters.

VSTYPE.long description: Define and assign multiple viscosity property types.

WATPENTH.long description: Over-ride defaults for fluid heat capacities.

WATPHASE.long description: Specify the liquid phase(s) to which the subsequent liquid data is to be assigned.

WBRANCH.long description: *WBRANCH defines multi-lateral well branches using trajectory points.

WBROTATE.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBROTATE.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WBSHIFT.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBSHIFT.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WCRV.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with the values of interpolating parameter.

WCURRCN.long description: Force a well to run on its current operating constraint without checking for constraint violation and possible switching.

WELGEO.long description: Specify geometric parameters for internal well index calculation of listed wells. *WELGEO overrides temporarily the global defaults specified by keyword *GEOMETRY.

WELLALQ.long description: Specify an artificial lift quantity (ALQ) value to be used with the tubing-head pressure hydraulics table *PTUBE1.

WELLINIT.description: Set Frequency of Initialization of Bottom-Hole Pressure (Optional)
WELLINIT.long description: *WELLINIT specifies the frequency of reinitializing the bottom hole pressure of a well running on rate, drawdown, or implicitly imposed well head pressure constraints.

WELLIST.long description: *WELLIST creates and modifies well lists for use by keywords that require a list of wells.

WELLSEP.long description: *WELSEP specifies the separators through which the produced fluids are assigned surface stream compositions, molar rates, and volumetric rates.

WELLSHEAR.long description: Enable shear effects in non-Newtonian radial in-flow model.

WELSEP-ICPRT.long description: *WELSEP-ICPRT controls the printing of separator stage compositions to the output file for the production wells.

WIRANGE.long description: *WIRANGE specifies the range of the constant geometric part of the well indices (WI) and takes proper actions if the well indices are out of the range.

WLISTOPEN.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTOPEN.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WLISTSHUT.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTSHUT.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WMKCOMP.description: Make-up Composition for Group Gas or Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKCOMP.long description: *GMKCOMP or *WMKCOMP is used to specify the composition of gas/water injected as part of a group gas/water recycling target to supplement the recycled fluid.

WMKMAXR.description: Maximum Water Make-up Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKMAXR.long description: Specify the maximum surface rate of make-up water injected as part of a group water recycling target to supplement the recycled water.

WMKUPTO.description: Water Make-up Target for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKUPTO.long description: Specify a total group water injection rate for each listed well group. The variable recycled water will be supplemented by make-up water to meet each group’s target, subject to other well constraints.

WMONITOR.description: Append Monitored Constraints to Listed Wells (Optional)
WMONITOR.long description: Append a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

WOC_PC.long description: Specify capillary pressures at the water-oil and gas-oil contacts.

WOC_SW.long description: Specify initial saturations in reservoir, or override vertical equilibrium saturations.

WPLYFAC.long description: Specify the viscosity adjustment factor for polymer/water mixtures in wells.

WPRN.long description: *WPRN controls the frequency of writing to the output print file information flagged by *OUTPRN.

WPRODGROUP.description: Water Producing Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
WPRODGROUP.long description: Specify the group from which water production rate (recycling) or total production rate (voidage replacement) will be taken, with compositions, to calculate a production-dependent water injection target specified for another group.

WRADIUS.long description: Assign well radius where boundary conditions are to be applied for the axisymmetric radial grid. The desired model can be either the plasticity model or plasticity with well boundary unloading.

WRECYMASK.description: Recycled Component Mask for Group Gas or Water Recycling (Optional)
WRECYMASK.long description: *GRECYMASK or *WRECYMASK is used to specify component reduction factors for group re-injection of produced gas/water remaining after the gas/water treatment.

WRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WRECYMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which water is re-injected under a group recycling target.

WRST.long description: *WRST and *REWIND control the frequency of writing and rewinding restart records in the output restart file.

WSRF.long description: Control the frequency of dumping information flagged by *OUTSRF to the Simulation Results files.

WTINCR.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

WTMULT.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

XCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
XCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

XDR.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

XFLOW-MODEL.long description: *XFLOW-MODEL is used to identify the method used to model well backflow and crossflow in a specified set of wells.

YCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
YCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

YLDSTRESS.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

YOUNGMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

ZCORN.description: Corner Point Depths for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
ZCORN.long description: *ZCORN signals input of an array of corner point depths for corner point grids.

3PTSCAL_KRG.long description: Enable multi-point scaling for saturation endpoints of rock-fluid curves.

3PTSCAL_KROG.long description: Enable multi-point scaling for saturation endpoints of rock-fluid curves.

3PTSCAL_KROW.long description: Enable multi-point scaling for saturation endpoints of rock-fluid curves.

3PTSCAL_KRW.long description: Enable multi-point scaling for saturation endpoints of rock-fluid curves.

3PTSCALING.long description: Enable multi-point scaling for saturation endpoints of rock-fluid curves.

AC.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

ACT-DEFAULT.long description: Set global default remedial action on violation of well operating constraints.

ACTIVATION-ENERGY.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
ACTIVATION-ENERGY.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

ACTIVCOEF.long description: These keywords are used in the aqueous phase model option in GHG. Other aqueous phase model options are described in Aqueous Phase Properties.

ACTIVCOEF-SOL.long description: These keywords are used in the aqueous phase model option in GHG. Other aqueous phase model options are described in Aqueous Phase Properties.

ACTIVITY-MODEL.long description: These keywords are used in the aqueous phase model option in GHG. Other aqueous phase model options are described in Aqueous Phase Properties.

ADACSTC.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Aqueous Phase – Langmuir Adsorption Input (Optional)
ADACSTC.long description: These array keywords control the modeling of the adsorption of component from the aqueous phase onto the reservoir rock. ARRAYS: *ADACSTC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   Bi *ADAMAXC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   ωi,max

ADAMAXC.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Aqueous Phase – Langmuir Adsorption Input (Optional)
ADAMAXC.long description: These array keywords control the modeling of the adsorption of component from the aqueous phase onto the reservoir rock. ARRAYS: *ADACSTC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   Bi *ADAMAXC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   ωi,max

ADGCSTC.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Gas Phase – Langmuir Adsorption Input (Optional)
ADGCSTC.long description: These array keywords control the modelling of the adsorption of component from the gas phase onto the reservoir rock. ARRAYS: *ADGCSTC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   Bi *ADGMAXC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   ωi,max

ADGMAXC.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Gas Phase – Langmuir Adsorption Input (Optional)
ADGMAXC.long description: These array keywords control the modelling of the adsorption of component from the gas phase onto the reservoir rock. ARRAYS: *ADGCSTC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   Bi *ADGMAXC  ' comp_name '  Array qualifier   ωi,max

ADRT.long description: These array keywords control residual adsorption level, accessible pore volume, and residual resistance factor for an adsorbing component from the aqueous phase.

ADS_WATERZONE.description: Gas Adsorption for Water Filled Blocks (Optional)
ADS_WATERZONE.long description: *ADS_WATERZONE determines whether the grid block gas saturation is to be used in the equation calculating the amount of a particular gaseous species adsorbed onto reservoir rock at a particular pressure and for a given gas composition. Adsorption is modeled using equations based on the multi component Langmuir model.

ADSCST.long description: *ADSCST, *WSLMAX and *RFMAX control the modelling of the adsorption of the solid asphaltene phase, which is entrained in the oil phase, onto the reservoir rock. *SOLIDMODEL must have been used to invoke the asphaltene model.

ADSORBTMAX.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Gas Phase – Tabular Adsorption Data Entry (Optional)
ADSORBTMAX.long description: These keywords are provided to enable adsorption data to be entered as a table for each adsorbing component. This data is typically obtained via laboratory measurements with core samples. In GEM this data is used to predict multicomponent adsorption using a mixing rule. The mixing rule is based on the extended multicomponent Langmuir model. *ROCKDEN must appear as described in *ADGCSTC and *ADGMAXC.

ADSORBTMAXA.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Aqueous Phase – Tabular Adsorption Data Entry (Optional)
ADSORBTMAXA.long description: These keywords are provided to enable adsorption data to be entered as a table for each adsorbing component from the aqueous phase. This data is typically obtained via laboratory measurements with core samples. In GEM this data is used to predict multicomponent adsorption using a mixing rule. The mixing rule is based on the extended multicomponent Langmuir model. Keyword *ROCKDEN must appear as described separately.

ADSTAB.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Gas Phase – Tabular Adsorption Data Entry (Optional)
ADSTAB.long description: These keywords are provided to enable adsorption data to be entered as a table for each adsorbing component. This data is typically obtained via laboratory measurements with core samples. In GEM this data is used to predict multicomponent adsorption using a mixing rule. The mixing rule is based on the extended multicomponent Langmuir model. *ROCKDEN must appear as described in *ADGCSTC and *ADGMAXC.

ADSTABA.description: Multicomponent Adsorption from the Aqueous Phase – Tabular Adsorption Data Entry (Optional)
ADSTABA.long description: These keywords are provided to enable adsorption data to be entered as a table for each adsorbing component from the aqueous phase. This data is typically obtained via laboratory measurements with core samples. In GEM this data is used to predict multicomponent adsorption using a mixing rule. The mixing rule is based on the extended multicomponent Langmuir model. Keyword *ROCKDEN must appear as described separately.

ADTSC.long description: *ADTSC enables or disables adaptive time stepping control option.

AI_ALIGN.long description: Enable or disable storage alignment for the adaptive implicit option.

AIMSET.description: Setting Grid Blocks to Implicit or Explicit (Optional)
AIMSET.long description: *AIMSET assigns implicit or explicit formulations to grid blocks.

AIMWELL.description: Setting Well Blocks and Neighbours to Implicit (Optional)
AIMWELL.long description: *AIMWELL is used to set blocks near wells to an implicit formulation.

ALL.description: Values that Vary for Most or All Grid Blocks
ALL.long description: *ALL is used to indicate that values vary in most or all the grid blocks. The number of values expected is the number of grid blocks in the grid, including all null or zero-porosity blocks.

ALLELEM.description: Assigning Grid Properties to All Elements
ALLELEM.long description: Assign data to all elements of grid blocks.

ALPHAKRG.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
ALPHAKRG.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

ALTER.description: Alter Primary Well Operating Constraint Value (Optional)
ALTER.long description: *ALTER allows modification of only the primary operating constraint value specified wells. The primary operating constraint is the FIRST constraint entered for the well using the *OPERATE keyword.

ALTER-HIST.description: Alter Observed Flow Rates for History-Matching (Optional)
ALTER-HIST.long description: *ALTER-HIST allows modification of the observed flow rates for wells running in the special history-matching mode.

AMG-COARSEN.long description: *AMG-COARSEN selects the aggressiveness of the coarsening process used during the AMG setup phase for solver *PARASOL under *COMBINATIVE mode.

AMG-EPS.long description: *AMG-EPS is the residual threshold stopping criterion used by AMG.

AMG-ITERMAX.long description: *AMG-ITERMAX specifies the maximum number of AMG cycles to be performed per solver iteration.

AMG-KRYLOV.long description: *AMG-KRYLOV specifies the accelerator (Krylov method) of multiple AMG cycles.

AMG-SETUP-FREQ.long description: *AMG-SETUP-FREQ selects the frequency of a full setup of AMG for solver *PARASOL under *COMBINATIVE mode.

AMG-SMOOTHER.long description: *AMG-SMOOTHER defines the number and type of smoothing sweeps used for AMG.

ANION-ANION-CATION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

ANION-ANION-CATION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

ANION-ANION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

ANION-ANION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

APPOR-METHOD.description: Apportionment Method for Meeting Group Targets (Optional)
APPOR-METHOD.long description: Specify the apportionment method that distributes the production or injection rates among contributing wells or groups to meet group targets defined by *GCONP or *GCONI.

AQCOMP.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQFILL.long description: These keywords are used in the aqueous phase model option in GHG. Other aqueous phase model options are described in Aqueous Phase Properties.

AQFLUX.description: Aquifer Boundary Flux or Aquifer Boundary Pressure (Conditional)
AQFLUX.long description: Define aquifer boundary flux or aquifer boundary pressure vs. time in table form.

AQFUNC.long description: *AQFUNC indicates input of a dimensionless pressure influence function as a table.

AQFUNC-EXT.long description: Specify the dimensionless time at which the analytical extrapolation starts for the internal pressure influence function.

AQGEOM.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQIONS-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

AQLEAK.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQMETHOD.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPINIT.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPRES.description: Aquifer Boundary Flux or Aquifer Boundary Pressure (Conditional)
AQPRES.long description: Define aquifer boundary flux or aquifer boundary pressure vs. time in table form.

AQPROP.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPROP-FET.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQUEOUS-DENSITY.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

AQUEOUS-VISCOSITY.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

AQUIFER.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQVISC.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AR.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
AR.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

AREALPINCH-TOL.long description: *AREALPINCH-TOL controls the minimal block size in I and J directions required to initiate an automatic areal pinched-out connection.

ARG.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
ARG.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

ARW.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
ARW.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

ASGMIN.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
ASGMIN.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

ASWMIN.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
ASWMIN.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

AUTO_KMP_AFFINITY.long description: Use internal GEM feature to set the KMP Affinity automatically for windows and linux_x64 platforms under certain conditions.

AUTODRILL.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

AVISC-AQUEOUS.description: Aqueous Phase Viscosity with Polymer Components (Conditional)
AVISC-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of components in the aqueous phase.

AVISC-H2O.description: Viscosity of Water Component (H2O) in Aqueous Phase (Conditional)
AVISC-H2O.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of the pure water component (H2O) in the aqueous phase.

BBTENSH.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

BCDOMAIN.long description: Specify pressure boundary between geomechanics and non-geomechanics grid domains.

BCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

BEGIN_DFN.long description: *BEGIN_DFN allows the input of discrete fracture network data to be modelled explicitly in reservoir simulation.

BG.description: Initial Reservoir Fluid Formation Volume Factors (Optional)
BG.long description: *BO input initial oil formation volume factor. *BG input initial gas formation volume factor. *RS input initial solution gas-oil ratio.

BHPDEFAULT.long description: Assign default bottom-hole pressure constraint values for wells.

BHPDEPTH.description: User-Specified Reference Depth for Well BHP (Optional)
BHPDEPTH.long description: Specify a well’s reference depth (location of bottom hole pressure) that is different from the depth of the well’s reference layer. See also *BHPGRAD.

BHPGRAD.description: User-Specified Pressure Gradient For Reference Depth for Well BHP (Optional)
BHPGRAD.long description: Specify a pressure gradient to compute the pressure difference between a well’s reference completion and its reference depth. See also *BHPDEPTH.

BHPHEADINIT.description: Simultaneous BHP and Well Head Iteration (Optional)
BHPHEADINIT.long description: *BHPHEADINIT specifies that certain wells are to have the bottom-hole pressure set to meet the well's rate or WHP target and simultaneously have the wellbore pressure differences between completions (heads) computed iteratively to achieve consistency between completion pressures and the computed heads. See also keyword *HEADITER. The frequency with which this iteration is performed is determined by the keyword *WELLINIT.

BIN.long description: This keyword specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components.

BINARY_DATA.long description: Keyword to indicate that grid-array data is stored in binary or simulation input (SIP) compressed form.

BINS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
BINS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

BIN-TDEP-CO2.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

BIN-TDEP-H2S.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

BIOTSCOEF.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

BIOTSCOEFI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BIOTSCOEFJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BIOTSCOEFK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BKRGCL.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKRGRL.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKROCRW.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKROCW.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKROGCG.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKROGCRG.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKRW3P.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKRWIRO.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKRWRO.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BKRWROI.long description: These keywords specify the end point values of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BLOCKDFL.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

BLOCKS.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

BO.description: Initial Reservoir Fluid Formation Volume Factors (Optional)
BO.long description: *BO input initial oil formation volume factor. *BG input initial gas formation volume factor. *RS input initial solution gas-oil ratio.

BSGCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSGCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSIZE.long description: Specify the method for calculation of corner-point grid block size.

BSLCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSOIRG.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSOIRW.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSOIRW3P.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSORG.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSORW.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSWCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSWCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BSWCRIT3P.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

BVISC-AQUEOUS.description: Aqueous Phase Viscosity with Polymer Components (Conditional)
BVISC-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of components in the aqueous phase.

BVISC-H2O.description: Viscosity of Water Component (H2O) in Aqueous Phase (Conditional)
BVISC-H2O.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of the pure water component (H2O) in the aqueous phase.

CACHE_ALIGN.long description: *CACHE_ALIGN enables or disables cache alignment for parallel processing runs.

CALIB_POR.long description: Improve accuracy of porosity coupling option *GCOUPLING 2.

CASEID.long description: *CASEID is used to identify specific case runs. It is also used in the Simulation Results File to identify data curves for plots.

CATION-ANION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CATION-ANION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CATION-CATION-ANION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CATION-CATION-ANION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CATION-CATION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CATION-CATION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

CCPOR.long description: *CCPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility value that will be used in a *CROCKTYPE region of the reservoir defined on the *CTYPE card. *CPRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the corresponding rock compressibility under the keyword *CCPOR. These keywords are equivalent to *CPOR and *PRPOR but can be defined in different regions of the reservoir.

CEC-CALC.long description: This keyword signals use of a porosity based correlation to calculate cation exchange capacity (CEC) for each grid-block.

CEC-IEX.description: Cation Exchange Capacity for Each Grid Block (Optional)
CEC-IEX.long description: This keyword signals input of cation-exchange-capacity (CEC) for each grid-block.

CER-REDUCTION.long description: *CER-REDUCTION is used to turn the constraint equation residual reduction method ON or OFF. This method allows the constraint (non-flash) equations to be solved to a specified convergence tolerance by using an inner iteration method.

CHARGE-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords are used to define the aqueous components.

CHECKONLY.long description: *CHECKONLY indicates that the entire data set, including the well data is to be checked for format errors, but the time-stepping will not be done.

CHECKRB.long description: Choose when to abandon using Red-Black Ordering for a PARASOL class (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

CHEM-EQUIL-SET.description: GHG Option – Setting of Initial Mineral Equilibrium Reaction Rates and Aqueous Molalities
CHEM-EQUIL-SET.long description: These keywords are used to set initial equilibrium reaction rates and aqueous molalities in GHG models.

CIRREVERS.long description: This keyword indicates the behavior of a rock type to be irreversible.

CKNJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CKSJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CKSPACING.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CLUMPSETTING.long description: Assign a control setting or flow restriction parameter to the named control lumps. The flow restriction parameter is used as a multiplication factor in adjusting the value of the well index for all the layers belonging to a given control lump.

CO2-AQU-FACT.description: GHG Option – Factors for CO2 Inventory (Optional)
CO2-AQU-FACT.long description: These keywords are used to input factors for the CO2 inventory calculations in aqueous and mineral components.

CO2-MNR-FACT.description: GHG Option – Factors for CO2 Inventory (Optional)
CO2-MNR-FACT.long description: These keywords are used to input factors for the CO2 inventory calculations in aqueous and mineral components.

COAL-DIF-COMP.long description: Either of these keywords activates the multicomponent coal bed features in GEM, and also specifies the matrix (coal) to fracture (cleat) diffusion process in a coal bed. These keywords should be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) modelling and Enhanced Coal Bed Methane (ECBM) modelling.

COAL-DIF-TIME.long description: Either of these keywords activates the multicomponent coal bed features in GEM, and also specifies the matrix (coal) to fracture (cleat) diffusion process in a coal bed. These keywords should be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) modelling and Enhanced Coal Bed Methane (ECBM) modelling.

COAL-SHRINKAGE-MODEL.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

COHESEXPNT.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

COHESHARD.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

COHESION.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

COHESIONMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

COMB-DRS.long description: *COMB-DRS selects the dynamic row-sum preconditioner for the solver *PARASOL in *COMBINATIVE mode.

COMBINATIVE.long description: *COMBINATIVE selects combinative 2-stage preconditioning for parallel solver *PARASOL. (In order to use this option, a special licensing feature must be active).

COMMENT.long description: *COMMENT changes the two character sequence that denotes the beginning of a comment.

COMPNAME.long description: *COMPNAME identifies the component of the reservoir fluid.

COMPNAME-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords are used to define the aqueous components.

COMPNAME-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

COMPNAME-MINERAL.long description: These keywords are used to define the mineral components.

COMPNAME-POLYMER.long description: This keyword identifies aqueous components in the model that are to be treated as polymer.

COMPNAME-SAL.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

COMPNAME-SCX.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

COMPNAME-SCX-MASTER.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

COMPNAME-SURFACTANT.long description: This keyword identifies aqueous components in the model that are to be treated as surfactant.

CON.long description: *CON indicates that a constant value is entered for all array elements. The value may be entered on the same line or the next line.

CONTACT_DEPTH_DEF0.long description: Entry of keyword *CONTACT_DEPTH_DEF0 indicates the selection of a specific definition of the gas-oil and water oil contact that existed in earlier versions of GEM. The GOC/WOC is defined by the user specified contact depth and the corresponding capillary pressures at the contacts. The latter are defaulted internally by GEM.

CONVERGE.long description: *CONVERGE is used to specify the convergence criterion for Newton's Method when solving the non-linear conservation equations in the simulator.

CONVERT-TO-CORNER-POINT.description: Convert Cartesian Grid to Corner Point (Optional)
CONVERT-TO-CORNER-POINT.long description: Internally convert a Cartesian grid type to corner point type.

CONV-RESONLY.long description: *CONVERGE is used to specify the convergence criterion for Newton's Method when solving the non-linear conservation equations in the simulator.

COORD.description: Line-Based Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
COORD.long description: *COORD signals input of an array of "x"- and "y"- coordinate corner point location information for corner point grids.

CORNERS.description: Complete Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
CORNERS.long description: *CORNERS signals input of a complete array of corner point locations for corner point grids.

CORNER-TOL.long description: *CORNER-TOL controls the minimal spacing required to separate corner points. *CORNER-TOL  cptol *PARTOL-TOL  partol

COVB-STRESS.description: Overburden Table and Effective Overburden Pressure (Optional)
COVB-STRESS.long description: *COVBTAB defines the rock overburden pressure as a function of depth, and switches the definition of pressure columns in the compaction / dilation tables. *COVB-STRESS directs the first column in compaction / dilation tables to be interpreted as entries of effective overburden pressures.

COVBTAB.description: Overburden Table and Effective Overburden Pressure (Optional)
COVBTAB.long description: *COVBTAB defines the rock overburden pressure as a function of depth, and switches the definition of pressure columns in the compaction / dilation tables. *COVB-STRESS directs the first column in compaction / dilation tables to be interpreted as entries of effective overburden pressures.

CPOR.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility determination. *CPOR signals the input of rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility, *CPOR.

CP-ROCK.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define the thermal rock properties.

CPRPOR.long description: *CCPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility value that will be used in a *CROCKTYPE region of the reservoir defined on the *CTYPE card. *CPRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the corresponding rock compressibility under the keyword *CCPOR. These keywords are equivalent to *CPOR and *PRPOR but can be defined in different regions of the reservoir.

CRAKSET.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CRAKTYPE.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CRDAMP.description: GHG Option – Chemical Reaction Damping Factor
CRDAMP.long description: These keywords are used for chemical reactions where equilibrium is desired to be achieved in a rate based manner.

CRDAMP-ALL.description: GHG Option – Chemical Reaction Damping Factor
CRDAMP-ALL.long description: These keywords are used for chemical reactions where equilibrium is desired to be achieved in a rate based manner.

CRIT.description: Critical Property Correlations for User Components (Conditional)
CRIT.long description: *CRIT identifies the correlation to be used to calculate the critical properties of user components that have not been entered.

CRITDELD.long description: *CRITDELD is used to specify a threshold density difference between gas and liquid densities that is used to determine if the flash calculation should be skipped. This is intended to reduce the number of flash calculations done in the critical region, where the gas and liquid densities are very similar.

CRL_WELLS.long description: *CRL_WELLS indicates that the listed wells identified by well_list will be considered for cap rock leakage if the requisite criteria are met.

CRNCON_24N.description: Use 24N Representation for Corner Point Grid (Conditional)
CRNCON_24N.long description: *CRNCON_24N signals a request for treating corner point grid into a 24N system internally instead of the default node-based representation.

CROCK.description: Rock Compressibility for Each Rock Type (Optional)
CROCK.long description: *CROCK specifies the rock compressibility for the rock type specified by *RPT.

CROCKTAB.long description: *CROCKTAB defines the main compaction path (mandatory). *CROCKTABH defines the hysteresis path(s). *CROCKTABW defines the water induced compaction dependency.

CROCKTABC.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s).

CROCKTABD.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s).

CROCKTABE.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s).

CROCKTABH.long description: *CROCKTAB defines the main compaction path (mandatory). *CROCKTABH defines the hysteresis path(s). *CROCKTABW defines the water induced compaction dependency.

CROCKTABR.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s).

CROCKTABU.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s).

CROCKTABW.long description: *CROCKTAB defines the main compaction path (mandatory). *CROCKTABH defines the hysteresis path(s). *CROCKTABW defines the water induced compaction dependency.

CROCKTYPE.long description: This keyword is used when more than a single rock type is assigned in different regions of a reservoir or when a table of porosity and permeability multipliers vs. pressure is required.

CRTSEMILOG.description: Semi-Logarithmic Treatment of Rock Compaction-Dilation Tables (Optional)
CRTSEMILOG.long description: The *CRTSEMILOG keyword directs pre-processing of compaction-dilation tables semi-logarithmically in all of the *CROCKTYPE's present in the data file.

CRVWGT.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

CTYPE.long description: *CTYPE assigns compressibility/compaction/dilation rock types to reservoir grid blocks.

CUBIC-ROOT-SELECTION.long description: This keyword provides the user the option of selecting the compressibility root of the EOS when there are three real roots.

CVFANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

CW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

CYCLPROD.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer, recycling producer or injector).

CYCPRT_END.description: Select Cycling Group Cycle Part to Start and End Cycling Group Control (Optional)
CYCPRT_END.long description: Select the cycle starting part and the cycle ending part.

CYCPRT_START.description: Select Cycling Group Cycle Part to Start and End Cycling Group Control (Optional)
CYCPRT_START.long description: Select the cycle starting part and the cycle ending part.

DAMP-PCOW-TROIL.long description: These keywords signal entry of the oil-water capillary pressure hysteresis parameters. *EPSPC Denotes the entry of epspc. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-water capillary pressure. *DAMP-PCOW-TROIL Allows linear reduction of Pcow values when Soh approach towards Sorw so as to make a "damped" Pcow hysteresis cycle.

DATE.long description: *DATE indicates that the well change will occur at a specified date.

DATUMDEPTH.long description: *DATUMDEPTH specifies the datum depth. It is used for printout of datum pressure, pressure corrected to datum.

DBL-WBLOCK-COAL.long description: *LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL and the older *FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL select the type of coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusion modelling to be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Extended CBM (ECBM) modelling. *NO-WBLOCK-COAL, *UNI-WBLOCK-COAL and *DBL-WBLOCK-COAL control water blocking functions for coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusive flows.

DCPOR.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility determination. *CPOR signals the input of rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility, *CPOR.

DEBUG.long description: Identify what debug information is written to the output file.

DENSTR-KEY.description: Specification of Non-EOS Stream Density Calculations (Optional)
DENSTR-KEY.long description: *DENSTR-KEY and *DENSTR-MIX introduce tables and component density sets respectively which allow the computation of the mass density of surface streams of separators without reference to a set of EOS parameters. These keywords allow entry of the tables and component mass density sets which are referred to under the *STREAM-DEN subkeyword of the *SEPARATOR and the *WELSEP keywords.

DENSTR-MIX.description: Specification of Non-EOS Stream Density Calculations (Optional)
DENSTR-MIX.long description: *DENSTR-KEY and *DENSTR-MIX introduce tables and component density sets respectively which allow the computation of the mass density of surface streams of separators without reference to a set of EOS parameters. These keywords allow entry of the tables and component mass density sets which are referred to under the *STREAM-DEN subkeyword of the *SEPARATOR and the *WELSEP keywords.

DENW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

DENWS.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

DEPLETION.description: Depletion Option in Rock Compaction-DILATION Model (Optional)
DEPLETION.long description: The *DEPLETION option makes the input reference porosity (*POR) the actual input porosity and makes the porosity a function of pressure depletion rather than pressure. The *DEPLETION keyword in the data set indicates that all *CROCKTYPE's use the Depletion option.

DEPTH.long description: *DEPTH indicates input of a reservoir depth for a single grid block.

DEPTH-TOP.long description: *DEPTH-TOP indicates input of depths to the top of each grid block in the reservoir.

DER-CHEM-EQUIL.long description: These keywords are used to define derivative types and mole fraction cut-off for the geochemical reactions.

DERIVATIVEMETHOD.description: Method for Evaluating Entries of the Jacobian Matrix (Optional)
DERIVATIVEMETHOD.long description: *DERIVATIVEMETHOD is functionally a numerical methods keyword but is so closely tied in its use to the *FLASH-METHOD keyword that it is included in the Fluid Model section. If *FLASH-METHOD *OUTER is specified or defaulted, the user can choose to have the derivatives of the residuals of the flow equations (which are entries in the Jacobian matrix) evaluated either analytically or numerically using this keyword. If *FLASH-METHOD *INNER has been specified, the derivatives of the flow residuals are always evaluated numerically.

DER-REACT-RATE.long description: These keywords are used to define derivative types and mole fraction cut-off for the geochemical reactions.

DER-SCX.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

DF-IMPLICIT.long description: *DF-IMPLICIT sets all discrete-fracture blocks to implicit.

DFRICANGLE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

DFSCUTOFF.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for DFSEG (Optional)
DFSCUTOFF.long description: *DFSCUTOFF controls the level at which a discrete fracture segment (DFSEG)’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

DGOC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil, and Water-Gas Contacts (Conditional)
DGOC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DI.long description: *DI assigns grid block sizes in the I direction. For radial grid type, this is in the radial direction.

DIARY.long description: *DIARY specifies the type of timestep information printed to the screen and to the output file during a simulation. *DIARY2 has the same functionality as *DIARY and can be used additionally to create a secondary log file.

DIARY2.long description: *DIARY specifies the type of timestep information printed to the screen and to the output file during a simulation. *DIARY2 has the same functionality as *DIARY and can be used additionally to create a secondary log file.

DIFCOR-AQU.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFCOR-GAS.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFCOR-OIL.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFFC-AQU.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFFC-GAS.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFFC-OIL.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

DIFFUSION.long description: *DIFFUSION activates the gas diffusion option for fractured reservoirs and introduces the input of the necessary parameters for this option.

DIFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DILANGLE.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

DILFACTOR.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

DIM.long description: Specify a value for a parameter controlling GEM's memory estimation for the simulation.

DIM_DEPTH_TABLE.long description: *DIM_DEPTH_TABLE specifies how many points to use when creating a properties vs. depth table during *VERTICAL *DEPTH_AVE initialization where the depth table is generated to provide the profiles of pressure, phase densities and capillary pressures, etc. versus depth. FORMAT: *DIM_DEPTH_TABLE  (*MIN_DSIZE  step_size)  (*MD_SEG  step_num)

DIP.long description: *DIP specifies the input of dip angles.

DISPERARRAY-ISO.long description: These keywords specify the dispersivities for the calculation of longitudinal and transverse velocity-dependent dispersion effects for all fluid phases.

DISPERARRAY-LNG.long description: These keywords specify the dispersivities for the calculation of longitudinal and transverse velocity-dependent dispersion effects for all fluid phases.

DISPERARRAY-TRN.long description: These keywords specify the dispersivities for the calculation of longitudinal and transverse velocity-dependent dispersion effects for all fluid phases.

DISPLACTOL.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

DISTORTED-BLOCK.long description: *DISTORTED-BLOCK specifies the action when block geometry is invalid.

DJ.long description: *DJ assigns grid block sizes in the J direction. For radial grid type this is in the angular direction.

DJFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DK.long description: *DK assigns grid block sizes in the K direction. For radial grid type this is in the axial direction.

DKFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DLOADBC.long description: Specify distributed loads along an edge of a finite element.

DLOADBC2D.long description: Specify distributed loads along an edge of a finite element.

DLOADBC3D.long description: Specify distributed load on a surface of a 3D finite element.

DLOADIJK.long description: Specify distributed load on a surface of a 3D finite element.

DPLANES.long description: Choose Jacobian building, property calculations, variable updates, residual calculations, and certain other non-solver tasks to be done in parallel. (In order to use *DPLANES, the parallel computing licensing feature must be active).

DRCTABLE.long description: Stress-dependent dilation-recompaction table lookup is used to determine permeability multipliers or transmissibility multipliers.

DRILLALTP.description: Alternate Phase for Ranking Wells on Auto Drill (Optional)
DRILLALTP.long description: *DRILLALTP is used to specify an alternate phase for ranking (prioritizing) production wells which are designated as autodrill wells and either *IPP, *IPPQT, *IPPDRNINP or *IPPDRNINPQT method is selected as a means of ranking wells and assigning priority.

DRILLMXW.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLMXW.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRILLQ.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLQ.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRILLQTALTP.description: Rate Cutoff Thresholds for Auto Drill (Optional)
DRILLQTALTP.long description: *DRILLQTREF and *DRILLQTALTP indicate input of rate threshold cutoff's for automatic drilling of wells (wells with status *AUTODRILL). If the volumetric flow rate of the phase is below the cutoff value then that well will not be drilled (opened).

DRILLQTREFP.description: Rate Cutoff Thresholds for Auto Drill (Optional)
DRILLQTREFP.long description: *DRILLQTREF and *DRILLQTALTP indicate input of rate threshold cutoff's for automatic drilling of wells (wells with status *AUTODRILL). If the volumetric flow rate of the phase is below the cutoff value then that well will not be drilled (opened).

DRILLT.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLT.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRNRADW.description: Drainage Radius of Wells for IPPDRINP Based Autodrill Algorithm (Optional)
DRNRADW.long description: *DRNRADW allows the user to enter a drainage radius for a production well or group of production wells. The drainage radius defines a reservoir volume with the well at the centre. A number of grid blocks will be either fully within the drainage radius or in the case that the drainage radius intersects a grid block, partially within the drainage radius. The drainage radius therefore allows the determination of a grid block list and subsequently in place amount of each phase, oil, gas and water at reservoir and surface conditions.

DTMAX.long description: *DTMAX identifies the maximum timestep size. *DTMIN identifies the minimum timestep size.

DTMIN.long description: *DTMAX identifies the maximum timestep size. *DTMIN identifies the minimum timestep size.

DTOP.description: Depth to the Tops of Grid Blocks (Conditional)
DTOP.long description: *DTOP specifies depth to the centre of the top face of each grid block in the top layer of the grid.

DTRAPN.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolation parameters.

DTRAPW.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolation parameters.

DTWELL.long description: *DTWELL identifies the first timestep size to be used immediately after the current well change.

DUALPERM.long description: *DUALPERM enables the dual permeability option (dual porosity augmented with inter-block matrix flow).

DUALPOR.long description: *DUALPOR indicates the use of the dual porosity option.

DWGC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil, and Water-Gas Contacts (Conditional)
DWGC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DWOC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil, and Water-Gas Contacts (Conditional)
DWOC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DYNAGRID.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-IGN-DIR.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-TINT.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-TSINT.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-WLN-A.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-WLN-V.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

ECOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

ELASTMOD.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

ELASTMODI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

ELASTMODJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

ELASTMODK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

END_TRIGGER.description: Allow for a Set of Keywords to be Processed When a Specified Condition (Trigger) is Satisfied (Optional)
END_TRIGGER.long description: Specify certain actions which are implemented when one or more specific conditions are satisfied during the simulation.

END-GRID.long description: *END-GRID flags the beginning of the data that defines the other reservoir properties.

ENTHALPY-AQUEOUS.long description: This keyword provides the user the option of calculating enthalpy of saline brine using Dittman (1977) correlation.

ENTHALPY-MIXING.long description: This keyword provides the user the option of using ideal mixing or non-ideal mixing for EOS enthalpy calculations that are applicable to the gas or oil phases.

ENTHCOEF.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option.

EOSSET.long description: *EOSSET signals the input of a new set of EOS component properties.

EOSTYPE.long description: *EOSTYPE indicates the start of input of equation of state set assignments. An equation of state set number is assigned to each grid block (see *EOSSET above).

EPSCUTOFF.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

EPSPC.long description: These keywords signal entry of the oil-water capillary pressure hysteresis parameters. *EPSPC Denotes the entry of epspc. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-water capillary pressure. *DAMP-PCOW-TROIL Allows linear reduction of Pcow values when Soh approach towards Sorw so as to make a "damped" Pcow hysteresis cycle.

EPSPCG.long description: This keyword signal entry of the oil-gas capillary pressure hysteresis parameter.

EQUALSI.description: J and K Direction Data from I Direction
EQUALSI.long description: *EQUALSI indicates that values in the J and K directions are the same as those in the I direction, or that the values given for the I direction may be modified by division, multiplication, etc.

EQUILIBRATE.long description: *MODELSHUT allows fluid equilibration in a shut-in well via crossflow between layers.

EQUIL-REACT-RATE.description: GHG Option – Setting of Initial Mineral Equilibrium Reaction Rates and Aqueous Molalities
EQUIL-REACT-RATE.long description: These keywords are used to set initial equilibrium reaction rates and aqueous molalities in GHG models.

EXPN1.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

EXPN2.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

EXPPM.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

FAULT.long description: *FAULT indicates the input of designations for grid blocks whose flow connections are to take into account their exact position in the reservoir with respect to their lateral neighbours. Each *FAULT keyword is expected to describe a group of grid blocks that together form a geological fault block.

FAULTARRAY.long description: *FAULTARRAY signals the input of an array of binary flags which controls whether individual block faces are connected using standard connections or fault connections.

FAULTPROP.long description: Define keywords to identify faults and assign properties for fault re-activation modeling.

FGMRES.long description: *FGMRES selects the flexible variant of the Generalized Minimum Residual method (GMRES) acceleration for *PARASOL.

FI_ALIGN.long description: *FI_ALIGN is used to enable or disable fully implicit alignment.

FILENAMES.long description: Specify names for input and output files.

FLASH\u2013METHOD.long description: *FLASH-METHOD specifies whether the thermodynamic equations should be solved at the same iteration level as the flow equations (*FLASH-METHOD *OUTER) or should be solved to convergence in every Newtonian iteration in a flash subroutine (*FLASH-METHOD *INNER). It has been found that using *FLASH-METHOD *OUTER can lead to significant savings in CPU time. *QNSS-TO-NR specifies whether after a certain point flash convergence method will switch from Quasi-Newton-Successive-Substitution (QNSS) to Newton-Raphson (NR) to achieve an efficient convergence. *FLASH-METHOD-OGW turns on a special three phase flash technique that can be used when aqueous phase solubility is being modeled. When the keywords *SOLUBILITY or *HENRY-CORR-XXX are used for solubility modelling, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW (equivalent to *OGW-FLASH *NO_H2OVAP) is turned on automatically. If the keywords *HENRYC- *REFPH- *VINFINITY appear without the *SOLUBILITY keyword, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW is not turned on automatically.

FLASH\u2013METHOD\u2013OGW.long description: *FLASH-METHOD specifies whether the thermodynamic equations should be solved at the same iteration level as the flow equations (*FLASH-METHOD *OUTER) or should be solved to convergence in every Newtonian iteration in a flash subroutine (*FLASH-METHOD *INNER). It has been found that using *FLASH-METHOD *OUTER can lead to significant savings in CPU time. *QNSS-TO-NR specifies whether after a certain point flash convergence method will switch from Quasi-Newton-Successive-Substitution (QNSS) to Newton-Raphson (NR) to achieve an efficient convergence. *FLASH-METHOD-OGW turns on a special three phase flash technique that can be used when aqueous phase solubility is being modeled. When the keywords *SOLUBILITY or *HENRY-CORR-XXX are used for solubility modelling, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW (equivalent to *OGW-FLASH *NO_H2OVAP) is turned on automatically. If the keywords *HENRYC- *REFPH- *VINFINITY appear without the *SOLUBILITY keyword, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW is not turned on automatically.

FLUX_ISECTOR.long description: Specify flux sectors via sector number and grid array.

FLUX_SECTORNAMES.long description: Specify flux sectors via sector number and grid array.

FLXB-ACTIVE.long description: Specify the active flux boundaries for the reduced run.

FLXB-DEF.long description: Specify flux boundaries via flux boundary names, numbers and assign to grid array.

FLXB-IN.long description: *FLXB-OUT specifies the name of flux boundary output file in the full-field run. *FLXB-IN specifies the name of flux boundary input file in the reduced run.

FLXB-NAMES.long description: Specify flux boundaries via flux boundary names, numbers and assign to grid array.

FLXB-OUT.long description: *FLXB-OUT specifies the name of flux boundary output file in the full-field run. *FLXB-IN specifies the name of flux boundary input file in the reduced run.

FLXB-TYPE.long description: Specify boundary condition type for the flux boundary file generated by the full-field run.

FMCOMP.long description: Designate a component, a surfactant in aqueous phase, whose composition will be used in dimensionless foam parameter calculations for *FOAM-MODEL *MULTREL.

FMKRW.description: Factor for Foam Water Relative Permeability (Optional)
FMKRW.long description: Define a factor to be used for altering the water-relative permeability of a rock-type, when empirical foam calculations with *FOAM-MODEL *MULTREL are in effect.

FOAM-MODEL.long description: Define the type of foam model to be used for relative permeability alterations.

FORCETOL.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

FRACANGLE.long description: Specify direction of fracture when the fracture permeability option *GPERMBB is used.

FRACTURE.long description: *FRACTURE is used immediately after a grid property keyword in a dual porosity system to indicate that a fracture property is being input.
