FRANGSOFT.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

FRATIO.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL.long description: *LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL and the older *FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL select the type of coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusion modelling to be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Extended CBM (ECBM) modelling. *NO-WBLOCK-COAL, *UNI-WBLOCK-COAL and *DBL-WBLOCK-COAL control water blocking functions for coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusive flows.

FREQUENCY-FACTOR.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
FREQUENCY-FACTOR.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

FRICANGLE.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

FRICANGMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

FRICANGMN.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FRICANGMX.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FRICHARDEN.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

FYOUNGAF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FZ.long description: *FZ and *NFZ specify assignment of an input property to a type of fracture zone.

GAMMA.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GAPPOR.long description: Specify the method of apportioning a group target among contributing wells or subgroups. Currently *AUTODRILL is the only method supported.

GASWATKV.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
GASWATKV.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

GASZONE.description: Specification of Method for Computing Oil Saturations in Gas Zone
GASZONE.long description: *GASZONE specifies whether a residual oil saturation is to be set initially in the uppermost part of the reservoir when the difference in the oil and gas phase pressures exceed the largest tabulated oil-gas capillary pressure. This keyword is applicable only when the *DEPTH_AVE sub-option of *VERTICAL is in effect.

GAUSSPNT.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

GBCPFACT.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GBCUFACT.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GCAPD.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPLOC.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMAT.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMOD.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMODEL.long description: Using cap model for an elasto-plastic constitutive model.

GCAPR.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPTEN.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPW.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCINCRMT.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCIOFF.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCIOFF.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCION.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCION.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCON-AQUIFER.long description: Include total aquifer influx in group controls for maintaining field or sector pressure.

GCONCYCLE.description: Allow Group Cycling to be Turned On/Off (Optional)
GCONCYCLE.long description: Turn on or off group cycling control specified earlier with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONCYCLE_END.description: Allow a Cycling Group to be Defined (Optional)
GCONCYCLE_END.long description: Specify data for EOR/IOR processes which rely on alternating production and/or injection cycles. Generally multiple cycles are required and each cycle consists of a number of well-defined parts. Examples include water alternating gas injection (WAG) and cyclic steam injection. A number of criteria are available to control the duration of each cycle part.

GCONCYCLE_START.description: Allow a Cycling Group to be Defined (Optional)
GCONCYCLE_START.long description: Specify data for EOR/IOR processes which rely on alternating production and/or injection cycles. Generally multiple cycles are required and each cycle consists of a number of well-defined parts. Examples include water alternating gas injection (WAG) and cyclic steam injection. A number of criteria are available to control the duration of each cycle part.

GCONCYCR_END.description: Allow Cycling Group Data to be Revised (Optional)
GCONCYCR_END.long description: Revise data specified earlier in the simulation with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONCYCR_START.description: Allow Cycling Group Data to be Revised (Optional)
GCONCYCR_START.long description: Revise data specified earlier in the simulation with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONI.long description: *GCONI is used to specify group injection controls.

GCONIINCR.description: Group Injection Constraint Multipliers or Increments (Optional)
GCONIINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group injection target.

GCONIMULT.description: Group Injection Constraint Multipliers or Increments (Optional)
GCONIMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group injection target.

GCONM.long description: Specify monitored group production constraints that can trigger closing of wells and individual completion layers. Production targets are met by using one of the available apportionment methods specified by *APPOR-METHOD.

GCONP.long description: *GCONP is used to specify group production controls.

GCONPINCR.description: Group Production Constraint Multiplier or Increment (Optional)
GCONPINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group production target.

GCONPMULT.description: Group Production Constraint Multiplier or Increment (Optional)
GCONPMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group production target.

GCOORD.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GCORNERS.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GCOUPLING.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

GCPOFF.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCPOFF.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCPON.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCPON.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCRITICAL.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GCRV.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

GCUPDATE.long description: Specify at what frequency or times that coupling updates are done.

GDI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GDJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GDK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GELEVATB.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GELEVATT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GENPLAST.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

GEODEPTH.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GEODOMAIN.long description: Specify grid domains in which geomechanics calculations are performed.

GEOEXTD.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEOGRID.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GEOMETRY.long description: *GEOMETRY specifies well geometric characteristics used for calculating well index internally.

GEOPOSTINPUT.description: Data Source from Prior Simulator Response for Geo-Post-Processing (Optional)
GEOPOSTINPUT.long description: Choose data source of prior simulator response, between GEM’s SR2 and RST files for a geo-post-processing (GEOPOSTPRO) run.

GEOPOSTPRO.description: Geomechanics Post Processing of Prior Simulator Response (Optional)
GEOPOSTPRO.long description: Specify that one-way geomechanics calculation will be carried out using prior simulator response.

GEORBLOCK.long description: Specify the reference block for stress gradient option.

GEXDI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXDJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXDK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMAXI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMAXJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMAXK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXPONENTN.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GFUELFRAC.description: Fuel Consumption Fraction for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GFUELFRAC.long description: Specify a maximum fraction of a group’s surface gas production available for consumption as fuel, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GFUELMASK.description: Fuel Component Mask for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GFUELMASK.long description: *GFUELMASK is used to specify component reduction factors for group fuel consumption, which reduces the amount of produced gas from a group available for reinjection by the same or another group. Gas recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword.

GFUELMAXR.description: Maximum Fuel Consumption Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GFUELMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which the surface gas produced by a group is made available for consumption as fuel, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GJRC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GKRIGING.long description: Enable Kriging method for calculating unknown initial stresses when only few sampling points are avaiable.

GLCONTROL.long description: Specify gas lift controls for a given set of production wells.

GLIFT.long description: Specify lift gas rate for production wells, or specify the method by which the lift gas rate is calculated.

GLOADBC.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis.

GLOADBC3D.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis in 3D.

GLOPT.long description: Specify an option to optimize oil production by automatic allocation of lift gas.

GMCREEP.long description: Assign a creep constitutive model for a type of rock. Creep is defined as the time-dependent strain that happens in a material at constant stress.

GMKCOMP.description: Make-up Gas Composition for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GMKCOMP.long description: *GMKCOMP is used to specify the composition of a gas injected as part of a group gas recycling target to supplement the recycled fluid. This information can also be specified in a somewhat less straightforward way using the *RECYCLE *RATE subkeywords of *GCONI when *RECYCLE *GAS is specified. The two methods of entering the make-up composition can over-write each other. Gas recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword. The numbers entered under *GMKCOMP have no effect unless a group gas recycling injection target is currently in force.

GMKMAXR.description: Maximum Make-up Gas Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GMKMAXR.long description: Specify the maximum surface rate of make-up gas injected as part of a group gas recycling target to supplement the recycled fluid.

GMKUPTO.description: Gas Make-up Target for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GMKUPTO.long description: Specify a target of surface gas injection rate for each listed well group. The variable recycled gas will be supplemented by make-up gas to meet each group’s target, subject to other well constraints.

GMONETONE.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GNULL.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GOC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
GOC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, the value of the water-oil capillary pressure at the oil-water contact and the value of the gas-water capillary pressure at the water-gas contact, respectively. These values are used in the *VERTICAL *DEPTH_AVE initialization options.

GOUTSRF.long description: Enable independent graphics file (SR2) for geomechanics.

GPATM.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GPERMAX.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMCOEF.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMES.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMLC.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEX.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEX_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEY.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEY_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEZ.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEZ_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTX.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTX_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTY.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTY_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTZ.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTZ_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMRES.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMTS.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMVL.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPHYDDEP.description: Manifold Depth for Calculating Pressure Difference Between Manifold and Surface (Optional)
GPHYDDEP.long description: Specify the manifold depth, which scales the pressure drop linearly relative to the depth specified with the hydraulics table indicated by keyword *GPTABLE.

GPOLY.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GPRODGROUP.description: Gas Producing Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
GPRODGROUP.long description: Specify the group from which gas production rates and composition will be taken to calculate a gas recycling injection target or a voidage replacement by gas target specified for another group or groups using the *GCONI keyword.

GPSCALING.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

GPTABLE.description: Specification of Hydraulics Tables for Calculating Pressure Difference Between Manifold and Surface (Optional)
GPTABLE.long description: Specify the group pressure table (defined by *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1) used to compute the pressure drop between manifold and surface.

GPTOLMUL.long description: Adjust pressure tolerance for computing porosity formulae given in keyword *GCOUPLING.

GRECYMASK.description: Recycled Gas Component Mask for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GRECYMASK.long description: *GRECYMASK is used to specify component reduction factors for group re-injection of produced gas remaining after fuel and sales requirements have been satisfied. Gas recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword. The *GRECYMASK keyword affects injection rates only if a group recycling injection target is currently in effect.

GRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GRECYMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which gas is re-injected under a group recycling target that was defined by keyword *GCONI.

GRGASTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GRID.long description: *GRID defines the type of fundamental (main) grid and marks the beginning of the reservoir description.

GRMPRSTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on effective mean stress or minimum principal effective stress.

GROCKTAB.long description: Stress-dependent dilation-recompaction table lookup is used to determine permeability multipliers or transmissibility multipliers.

GROILTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GROTATEI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROTATEJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROTATEK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROUP.long description: *GROUP is used to identify gathering centres, groups and platforms. This keyword is useful for building a tree structure of groups.

GROUPALQ.long description: Specify the ALQ quantity in interpolations in a hydraulics table entered using the *PTUBE1 table format.

GRPORTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on porosity.

GRPRESTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid pore pressure.

GRSTRESTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on effective mean stress or minimum principal effective stress.

GRTEMTAB.long description: Specify temperature dependence of geomechanical properties.

GRTHRDS.description: Number of Threads for Parallel Grid-Processing (Optional)
GRTHRDS.long description: Choose the number of threads to be used for parallel processing of grid-tasks.

GRWATAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GSALESFRAC.description: Sales Rate Fraction for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GSALESFRAC.long description: Specify a maximum fraction of the surface gas produced by a group (less the amount consumed as fuel) that is available for sale, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GSALESMASK.description: Sales Component Mask for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GSALESMASK.long description: *GSALESMASK is used to specify component reduction factors for group gas diverted for sales, which reduces the amount of produced gas from a group available for reinjection by the same or another group. Gas recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword.

GSALESMAXR.description: Maximum Sales Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GSALESMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which the surface gas produced by a group is made available for sales, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GTRANSLI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GTRANSLJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GTRANSLK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GUIDEI.description: Guide Rates for Groups or Wells
GUIDEI.long description: Specify guide rates to distribute the production or injection rates among groups or wells, to meet the production or injection target.

GUIDEP.description: Guide Rates for Groups or Wells
GUIDEP.long description: Specify guide rates to distribute the production or injection rates among groups or wells, to meet the production or injection target.

GULBULKMOD.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GULOGINT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GXCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GYCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GZCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

H2O_INCLUDED.long description: These keywords are used to model H2O vaporization.

HARDEN.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

HCFLAG.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

HEADITER.long description: *HEADITER specifies that certain wells are to have the wellbore pressure differences between completions (heads) computed iteratively at the beginning of a timestep to achieve consistency between completion pressures and the computed heads. See also the manual page for the related keyword *BHPHEADINIT.

HEAD-METHOD.long description: *HEAD-METHOD is used to identify the head method to be used.

HEATING_VALUES.long description: *HEATING_VALUES specifies the heating values (heat of combustion) for each component. The number of values and order should follow according to the component list entered with the *COMPNAME keyword. These numbers are used by GEM to calculate the separator gas stream heating value by simple mole fraction averaging.

HEAT-LOSS.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define heat loss to the surrounding rock.

HENRYC.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-CORR-C1.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-CORR-CO2.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-CORR-H2S.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-CORR-N2.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-MOD1-CO2.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HENRY-MOD1-H2S.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

HF_IN_NULL.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

HLPROP.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define heat loss to the surrounding rock.

HTUSE.long description: On a machine with hyper-threading turned on, use the hyper-threads during the simulation for runs using parallel processing.

HYDROFRAC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

HYS_MODEL.description: Gas Phase Relative Permeability Hysteresis Modelling (Optional)
HYS_MODEL.long description: Keyword *HYS_MODEL allows the user to select between available options for modeling relative permeability hysteresis for the non-wetting phase, gas. Keywords *ALPHAKRG and *AR  *ARG and *ARW allow the user to specify parameters of the three phase WAG hysteresis model for the gas phase.

HYS3P_GTDEP.description: Time Step Size Dependent Saturation Threshold Option in 3 Phase WAG Hysteresis (Optional)
HYS3P_GTDEP.long description: Select either the time step size dependent gas and/or water saturation thresholds for switching between imbibition to drainage or drainage to imbibition in the three phase WAG hysteresis model.

HYS3P_GTOL.description: Saturation Thresholds for Imbibition to Drainage or Drainage to Imbibition Reversal in 3P WAG (Optional)
HYS3P_GTOL.long description: *HYS3P_GTOL indicates that a value of the time step size dependent parameter used for determining drainage to imbibition or imbibition to drainage transition for hysteresis in the gas phase for the 3 phase WAG models is to be read for the given relative permeability table. *HYS3P_WTOL indicates that a value of the of the time step size dependent parameter for determining drainage to imbibition or imbibition to drainage transition for hysteresis in the water phase for the 3 phase WAG models is to be read for the given relative permeability table.

HYS3P_SECCRT.description: Imposition of Secondary Criteria for Imbibition to Drainage or Drainage to Imbibition Reversal in 3P WAG (Optional)
HYS3P_SECCRT.long description: *HYS3P_SECCRT can be used to turn on or off the use of secondary criteria in determining transition from imbibition to drainage or from drainage to imbibition for hysteresis in the gas phase for the 3 phase WAG models.

HYS3P_WTDEP.description: Time Step Size Dependent Saturation Threshold Option in 3 Phase WAG Hysteresis (Optional)
HYS3P_WTDEP.long description: Select either the time step size dependent gas and/or water saturation thresholds for switching between imbibition to drainage or drainage to imbibition in the three phase WAG hysteresis model.

HYS3P_WTOL.description: Saturation Thresholds for Imbibition to Drainage or Drainage to Imbibition Reversal in 3P WAG (Optional)
HYS3P_WTOL.long description: *HYS3P_GTOL indicates that a value of the time step size dependent parameter used for determining drainage to imbibition or imbibition to drainage transition for hysteresis in the gas phase for the 3 phase WAG models is to be read for the given relative permeability table. *HYS3P_WTOL indicates that a value of the of the time step size dependent parameter for determining drainage to imbibition or imbibition to drainage transition for hysteresis in the water phase for the 3 phase WAG models is to be read for the given relative permeability table.

HYSKRG.long description: These keywords signal entry of the hysteresis parameters.

HYSKRGM.long description: These keywords signal entry of the miscible relative permeability hysteresis parameters.

HYSKROG.description: Oil Curve in Oil/Gas Table Hysteresis Parameter (Optional)
HYSKROG.long description: This keyword signals entry of the of oil curve in oil/gas (SGT/SLT) table hysteresis parameter.

HYSKROW.description: 2 Phase Oil-Water Table Relative Permeability, Oil Curve: Hysteresis Parameters (Optional)
HYSKROW.long description: This keyword assigns the hysteresis method of the oil curve (krow) and signals the entry of associated parameters.

HYSKROWM.long description: These keywords signal entry of the miscible relative permeability hysteresis parameters.

HYSKRW.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of water relative permeability in oil-water system or in gas-water reservoir and signal the entry of associated parameters. Keyword *SWT3 allows the user to enter the 'three-phase' water relative permeability curve. This curve as well as the two-phase flow curve entered with the keyword *SWT are utilized in modeling water phase relative permeability hysteresis for the three-phase Water-Alternating-Gas (WAG) model.

IFTMISPT.description: Interfacial Tension Effects on Relative Permeability (Optional)
IFTMISPT.long description: *SIGMA indicates that relative permeabilities and capillary pressures are dependent on interfacial tension; the parameters for calculating the dependence follow the keyword. Use of keyword *IFTMISPT ensures calculation of relative permeabilities and capillary pressures that change smoothly from two-phase to single-phase and vice versa, during miscibility transitions.

IFTTABLE.long description: Define interfacial tension between gas and aqueous phase for use in the empirical foam model or, Define interfacial tension between oil and aqueous phase for use in the non-foam model.

IJK.long description: *IJK assigns a constant value of a grid property within the region defined by the minimum and maximum block number in each of the three directions.

IJPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

IKPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

IMPLICIT-SHEAR.long description: This keyword directs the simulator to update the velocity of the aqueous phase in the inner (Newton) loop. The velocity is used for computing the effect of shear on polymer viscosity.

INACTIVE-WELL-SOLVE.long description: Choose work-saving method of solver pointer generation.

INCLUDE.long description: The *INCLUDE keyword indicates that reading of the primary input data set is suspended. Instead, a secondary file will be read.

INCOMP.long description: *INCOMP specifies the compositions of injected fluid.

INCOMPWL.long description: *INCOMPWL sets the composition of injected lift-gas for producers or injected fluid for hydrocarbon (solvent) injectors.

INHERIT-SOLID-OFF.long description: This keyword is used to disallow inheritance of solid model parameters from EOS set 1 to subsequent EOS sets.

INITFANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

INITIAL.long description: *INITIAL indicates the beginning of initial condition values.

INJECTOR.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer, recycling producer or injector).

INJECTOR-EOS.description: Standard Pressure, Temperature, and EOS Set (Optional)
INJECTOR-EOS.long description: *INJECTOR-P and *INJECTOR-T specify the standard pressure and temperature used internally in GEM for converting surface rates to molar rates for hydrocarbon injection wells through a single-phase EOS calculation.

INJECTOR-P.description: Standard Pressure, Temperature, and EOS Set (Optional)
INJECTOR-P.long description: *INJECTOR-P and *INJECTOR-T specify the standard pressure and temperature used internally in GEM for converting surface rates to molar rates for hydrocarbon injection wells through a single-phase EOS calculation.

INJECTOR-T.description: Standard Pressure, Temperature, and EOS Set (Optional)
INJECTOR-T.long description: *INJECTOR-P and *INJECTOR-T specify the standard pressure and temperature used internally in GEM for converting surface rates to molar rates for hydrocarbon injection wells through a single-phase EOS calculation.

INJ-SALIN.long description: *INJ-SALIN specifies the salinity of the injected water into the well in the range of (0 to 15) molal NaCl.

INJ-TEMP.long description: *INJ-TEMP specifies the bottom-hole temperature of injected fluid in the wells.

INT.long description: *INT indicates that the corresponding table entry should be filled by interpolation.

INTCOMP.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

INTCOMP_VAL.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolation parameters.

INTERP_ENDS.description: Interpolation of Relative Permeability and Capillary Pressure – Method 2 (Optional)
INTERP_ENDS.long description: Specify method-2 for interpolation of saturation functions as directed by keywords *KRINTRP.

INTERP_SCAL.description: Interpolation of Relative Permeability and Capillary Pressure – Method 1 (Optional)
INTERP_SCAL.long description: Specify method-1 for interpolation of saturation functions as directed by keyword *KRINTRP.

INTERRUPT.long description: *INTERRUPT indicates how GEM is to respond when the user interrupts the simulation run by simultaneously pressing the "CTRL_Shift" and "C" keys; that is, by entering CTRL-C.

INTLIN.long description: Define interfacial tension between gas and aqueous phase for use in the empirical foam model or, Define interfacial tension between oil and aqueous phase for use in the non-foam model.

INTLOG.long description: Define interfacial tension between gas and aqueous phase for use in the empirical foam model or, Define interfacial tension between oil and aqueous phase for use in the non-foam model.

INTPOWER.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

INVENTORY-CO2.long description: This keyword activates the CO2 inventory calculations and writing of the same to the main output file.

ION-SIZE-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords are used to define the aqueous components.

ISECTOR.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize regional reservoir activity, via sector number and grid array.

ITERCER.description: Iterations for Constraint Equation Residual Reduction (Optional)
ITERCER.long description: *ITERCER is used to specify the number of allowed iterations for constraint equation residual reduction (CER) using inner (Newton) iterations.

ITERMAX.long description: Specify the maximum allowed number of linear solver iterations.

ITERMAXG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

ITUBE1.long description: *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 specifies a table of tubing-head (or outlet) pressure data tables for a production or injection well (or manifold group). The tabulated variable is the bottom-hole (or inlet) pressure, with tubing-head (or outlet) pressure and several independent variables such as surface rates or rate ratios. *PTUBE1 can also be used to input the well-head temperature table.

ITYPE.long description: *ITYPE introduces an array of integers taking the values from 1 to nreg. This keyword is used to specify which initialization region given grids blocks or a set of grid blocks belong to. Any of the array-reading options may be used.

IVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the I Direction
IVAR.long description: *IVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the I direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

IWELLBORE.long description: *IWELLBORE specifies that surface to reservoir wellbore pressure drop will be computed for an injector, either from a tubing data model or a hydraulics table.

JACPAR.description: Parallel Jacobian and Residual Building based on Parasol Classes (Optional)
JACPAR.long description: Choose Jacobian building, property calculations, variable updates, residual calculations, and certain other non-solver tasks to be done in parallel. (In order to use *JACPAR, the parallel computing licensing feature must be active).

JDUMPG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

JFGIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFGIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JFGMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFGMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JFGMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFGMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JFUNC.long description: Replaces water-oil and/or oil-gas capillary pressures entered with Leverett J Functions.

JFW_SHIFT.description: Water-Oil Capillary Pressure (J Function) Shift for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFW_SHIFT.long description: These keywords specify the amount that the water-oil capillary pressure or water-oil J Function curve is shifted up or down. These keywords can be used to account for the effects of a tilted water-oil contact.

JFWIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFWIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JFWMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFWMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JFWMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFWMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

JKPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

JLOADBAL.description: Load-Balancing in Parallel Equation and Residual Building (Optional)
JLOADBAL.long description: Choose load-balancing option for the parallel equation and residual building using *DPLANES (-doms).

JLOAD-CHIMP.description: Load-Balancing in Parallel Equation and Residual Building (Optional)
JLOAD-CHIMP.long description: Choose load-balancing option for the parallel equation and residual building using *DPLANES (-doms).

JVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the J Direction
JVAR.long description: *JVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the J direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

KAVMF.description: Direct Input of Shape Factor and Transfer Permeability Arrays (Optional)
KAVMF.long description: Keywords *SIGMAMF and *KAVMF allow direct input of the block shape factor and average transfer permeability arrays, respectively, for each grid block to be used in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

KDIR.long description: *KDIR specifies the orientation of the grid’s K direction relative to gravity.

KEYCOMP.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KEYCOMP.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

KEYSALIN.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KEYSALIN.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

KILLOUGH_MOD_KRWCO.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of water relative permeability in oil-water system or in gas-water reservoir and signal the entry of associated parameters. Keyword *SWT3 allows the user to enter the 'three-phase' water relative permeability curve. This curve as well as the two-phase flow curve entered with the keyword *SWT are utilized in modeling water phase relative permeability hysteresis for the three-phase Water-Alternating-Gas (WAG) model.

KLINKENBERG.long description: *NONDARCY signals the use of the non-Darcy reservoir flow option. *KLINKENBERG indicates input of a reference pressure for a low-pressure correction to Darcy's law.

KRCBM.description: Flag to Use Alternate Relative Permeability Table Definition for Coal Bed Methane (Optional)
KRCBM.long description: *KRCBM indicates that the input relative permeability tables (*SWT, *SGT, *SLT) do not contain columns for relative permeability to oil.

KRGAS.description: Single Phase Gas Relative Permeability Flag (Optional)
KRGAS.long description: *KRGAS indicates that a single-phase gas relative permeability calculation flag follows.

KRINTRP.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolation parameters.

KROIL.long description: *KROIL introduces subkeywords which indicate how kro is evaluated. The options are Stone's first and second models, as modified by Aziz and Settari; the Segregated model; and the Linear Isoperm method. For Stone's models the krow and krog values may be looked up as functions either of Sw and Sg, respectively, or of 1 - So and 1 - Swr - So.

KRPERF.description: Relative Permeability Data for Well Completions (Optional)
KRPERF.long description: *KRPERF specifies the relative permeability table set numbers and end points for individual well completions.

KVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the K Direction
KVAR.long description: *KVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the K direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

KVKEYCOMP.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KVKEYCOMP.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

KVKEYSALIN.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KVKEYSALIN.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

KVTABLE.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KVTABLE.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

KVTABLIM.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
KVTABLIM.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL.long description: *LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL and the older *FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL select the type of coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusion modelling to be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Extended CBM (ECBM) modelling. *NO-WBLOCK-COAL, *UNI-WBLOCK-COAL and *DBL-WBLOCK-COAL control water blocking functions for coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusive flows.

LANGMULT.long description: *LANGMULT indicates input of multiplier fractions used to adjust the entered maximum Langmuir adsorption parameter values (see keyword *ADGMAXC and *ADSORBTMAX; *ADAMAXC and *ADSORBTMAXA) on a grid block by grid block basis.

LAYERCLUMP.long description: Define a control lump, which is a set of layers (perforations, completions) with a name and computed rate, cumulative, and stream ratio values. To each control lump there is also an associated setting value.

LAYER-CTRL.long description: Modify layer status or well indices for individual completions.

LAYERGRAD.long description: Specify pressure gradients between adjacent completions within a wellbore. This keyword is useful to model pumped-off producing wells.

LAYERIJK.description: Simplified Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERIJK.long description: *LAYERIJK allows a simplified specification of a deviated wellbore by overriding the *GEOMETRY direction for each well completion layer.

LAYERLUMP_ACTR.description: Selection of Instantaneous Versus Actual Rates (Optional)
LAYERLUMP_ACTR.long description: Select actual or on-time averaged rates and ratios based on the rates in all calculations involving lumps. The alternative (default) is to use instantaneous rates in layer lump calculations.

LAYERRLUMP.long description: Define a report lump which is a set of well layers, where stream rates, cumulatives and production rate ratios are calculated and on which triggers can be based. A report lump is more flexible than a control lump (*LAYERCLUMP).

LAYERXYZ.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LAYERXYZ-METHOD.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ-METHOD.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LBPRINT.description: Load Balancing Status Printing for Non-Solver Tasks (Optional)
LBPRINT.long description: *LBPRINT controls the printing of load-balancing status for parallel runs for non-solver tasks, like Jacobian building, variable updates, convergence checking, etc.

LCSPRINT.description: Level and Class Structure Printing for Parallel Linear Solver (Optional)
LCSPRINT.long description: *LCSPRINT controls the printing of level and class structure for parallel linear solver, PARASOL.

LIB-SHIF.description: Volume Shift Option for Program Components (Optional)
LIB-SHIF.long description: This keyword provides the user the option of applying volume shift for program (library) components.

LIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

LOG-CHEM-EQUIL-COEFS.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
LOG-CHEM-EQUIL-COEFS.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

LOG-CHEM-EQUIL-CONST.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
LOG-CHEM-EQUIL-CONST.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

LOG-SCOEFF-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

LOG-TST-RATE-CONSTANT.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
LOG-TST-RATE-CONSTANT.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

LOG-TST-RATE-CONSTANT-ACTIV.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
LOG-TST-RATE-CONSTANT-ACTIV.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

MAGNIFYDI.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDJ.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDK.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MANIFOLD.description: Defining Group Production or Injection as Going Through a Manifold (Optional)
MANIFOLD.long description: Specify that group production or injection of a stream goes through a manifold, that is, the group’s wells have the same pressure at the upper end of the tubing.

MASSDENSITY-MINERAL.long description: These keywords are used to define the mineral components.

MATRIX.long description: *MATRIX is used immediately after a grid property keyword to indicate that a matrix property is being input.

MAXCHANGE.description: Normal Variation in Variables Per Timestep (Optional)
MAXCHANGE.long description: *NORM identifies the typical changes in the basic variables over a timestep. The timestep size is reduced, if the maximum change in pressure or saturation is greater than that specified by *MAXCHANGE.

MAXCLK.description: Maximum CPU Seconds, Maximum Elapsed Seconds (Optional)
MAXCLK.long description: *MAXCPU is used to specify the maximum CPU seconds for the simulation run. *MAXCLK is used to specify the maximum elapsed seconds for the simulation run.

MAXCPU.description: Maximum CPU Seconds, Maximum Elapsed Seconds (Optional)
MAXCPU.long description: *MAXCPU is used to specify the maximum CPU seconds for the simulation run. *MAXCLK is used to specify the maximum elapsed seconds for the simulation run.

MAXDATE.description: Maximum Timesteps, Simulation Termination Time and Date (Optional)
MAXDATE.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MAXERROR.long description: *MAXERROR specifies the maximum number of error messages before the simulation terminates.

MAXSTEPS.description: Maximum Timesteps, Simulation Termination Time and Date (Optional)
MAXSTEPS.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MAXTIME.description: Maximum Timesteps, Simulation Termination Time and Date (Optional)
MAXTIME.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MCCMODEL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCETHA.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCHARDF.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOCR.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

MCOMINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCONNG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MCPREHD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCRCSL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSIM.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSWINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MDICLU_PG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MINC.long description: *MINC indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the multiple-interacting-continua (MINC) approach.

MINERAL-ERA.long description: Use an internally created annihilation matrix that includes mineral components for computing the material balance error of the reduced components.

MIN-REACT-SURFACE-AREA.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
MIN-REACT-SURFACE-AREA.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

MIXINGRULE.description: Parameters for Computing Viscosity of Hydrocarbon Fluids (Optional)
MIXINGRULE.long description: Keywords to introduce the input of parameters used to compute the hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISCOSITY specifies the component viscosities to be used in a direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon viscosities. *MIXINGRULE specifies the exponent to be used in the direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISVC specifies the component pseudo-critical volumes used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *MIXVC specifies the exponent used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *VISCOEFF specifies the coefficients for the Jossi, Stiel and Thodos correlation, or for the Pedersen or Modified Pedersen correlations.

MIXVC.description: Parameters for Computing Viscosity of Hydrocarbon Fluids (Optional)
MIXVC.long description: Keywords to introduce the input of parameters used to compute the hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISCOSITY specifies the component viscosities to be used in a direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon viscosities. *MIXINGRULE specifies the exponent to be used in the direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISVC specifies the component pseudo-critical volumes used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *MIXVC specifies the exponent used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *VISCOEFF specifies the coefficients for the Jossi, Stiel and Thodos correlation, or for the Pedersen or Modified Pedersen correlations.

MOD.long description: *MOD indicates the modification of a cell-based grid array.

MODEL.long description: *MODEL signals the input of the fluid component model to use for the simulation.

MODELSHUT.long description: *MODELSHUT allows fluid equilibration in a shut-in well via crossflow between layers.

MOLALITY-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords indicate input of initial aqueous or mineral concentrations in the model. In addition to the usual data for initial conditions, the following information is required.

MOLALITY-AQUEOUS-PRIMARY.long description: These keywords indicate input of initial aqueous or mineral concentrations in the model. In addition to the usual data for initial conditions, the following information is required.

MOLALITY-GASAQU.long description: These keywords indicate input of initial aqueous or mineral concentrations in the model. In addition to the usual data for initial conditions, the following information is required.

MONITOR.long description: Specify a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

MPLNE.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MRC-RESET.description: Resetting Well Operating Constraint after Value Change (Optional)
MRC-RESET.long description: Specify whether a well should be set to its Most Restrictive Constraint after a change in the value of an operating constraint via *OPERATE, *ALTER, or *TARGET.

MRDAMP.description: GHG Option –Damping Factor for Reactions other than Chemical
MRDAMP.long description: These keywords are used for damping rate reactions (other than chemical).

MRDAMP-ALL.description: GHG Option –Damping Factor for Reactions other than Chemical
MRDAMP-ALL.long description: These keywords are used for damping rate reactions (other than chemical).

MW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

MW-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords are used to define the aqueous components.

MW-MINERAL.long description: These keywords are used to define the mineral components.

MW-TRCR.long description: These keywords are used to define passive tracers and assign their associate components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest in a simulation.

MXCNRPT.long description: Specifies maximum number of continue-repeats allowed in each timestep.

NB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NC.long description: *NC specifies the number of primary hydrocarbon components in the fluid. Note that even though GEM always models an aqueous phase which consists primarily of a water component, this water component is not to be counted here unless *H2O_INCLUDED is specified (see *H2O_INCLUDED).

NC-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords are used to define the aqueous components.

NCHECK-CEQ.description: Maximum Newton Cycles for Constraint Equation Residual Checking (Optional)
NCHECK-CEQ.long description: *NCHECK-CEQ is used to specify the maximum number of allowable Newtonian iterations for constraint equation residual checking.

NC-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

NC-MINERAL.long description: These keywords are used to define the mineral components.

NCOUPLING.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

NC-SCX.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

NDARCYCOR.long description: Allows the input of block by block correction factors for the non-Darcy β factor calculated as described in the background section for the *NONDARCY keyword.

NE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NETGROSS.long description: *NETGROSS indicates input of an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NETPAY.long description: *NETPAY indicates input of an array of net pays which are to be converted internally to an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NEUTRAL-ION-COEF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

NEUTRAL-ION-COEF-TEMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Pitzer coefficients between ion-pairs and -triplets.

NEWTONCYC.long description: *NEWTONCYC is used to specify the maximum number of allowable Newtonian iterations.

NFZ.long description: *FZ and *NFZ specify assignment of an input property to a type of fracture zone.

NFZG-ALIGN.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

NINCS.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NINEPOINT.long description: *NINEPOINT controls the nine-point spatial discretization option.

NITERGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NLINEAR.long description: Assign a nonlinear constitutive model for a type of rock.

NNODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOCOUPERM.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

NODE4.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE8.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE9.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEX.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEY.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEZ.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOINTERMF.long description: *NOINTERMF indicates that the inter-block matrix-fracture connection will not be established when a fracture block is null but its collocated matrix block is non-null in a dual-continua model.

NOLIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

NOLISTLIM.description: Controlling Data File Listing Using NOLISTLIM (Optional)
NOLISTLIM.long description: *NOLISTLIM specifies that the default 20 lines of keyword echoing under the *LIST keyword be extended so that all values of the keyword are echoed regardless of the number of lines required to do so. This can create large files if used, but allows the user to view all of the data.

NONDARCY.long description: *NONDARCY signals the use of the non-Darcy reservoir flow option. *KLINKENBERG indicates input of a reference pressure for a low-pressure correction to Darcy's law.

NORM.description: Normal Variation in Variables Per Timestep (Optional)
NORM.long description: *NORM identifies the typical changes in the basic variables over a timestep. The timestep size is reduced, if the maximum change in pressure or saturation is greater than that specified by *MAXCHANGE.

NORTH.long description: Specify the maximum number of orthogonalizations (GMRES steps) to be performed by the iterative solution method before resetting.

NORTHG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

NO-WBLOCK-COAL.long description: *LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL and the older *FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL select the type of coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusion modelling to be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Extended CBM (ECBM) modelling. *NO-WBLOCK-COAL, *UNI-WBLOCK-COAL and *DBL-WBLOCK-COAL control water blocking functions for coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusive flows.

NREGIONS.long description: *NREGIONS introduces the integer nreg which specifies the number of initialization regions into which the reservoir has been divided.

NTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NTRCR.long description: These keywords are used to define passive tracers and assign their associate components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest in a simulation.

NULL.long description: *NULL indicates the input of an array of null block indicators.

NULL-PERF.long description: *NULL-PERF specifies how perforations in inactive (null or pinched out) grid blocks are to be handled.

NUMERICAL.long description: *NUMERICAL identifies the beginning of all numerical methods control keywords.

NWHYFS.description: Set Number of Points for WHP Root Search (Optional)
NWHYFS.long description: *NWHYFS allows the user to set the number of points used to determine whether a value of the BHP exists which yields the target well head pressure (WHP). This number defaults to 9 and it is not anticipated that the user would normally alter this value. However in certain cases in which a well operating on an implicit WHP constraint suddenly shuts for no apparent reason, invoking *NWHYFS for the well with a value exceeding 9 (11 for example) may allow the well to continue. Larger values of this integer may cause run times to increase.

OCRV.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

OGW_FLASH.long description: These keywords are used to model H2O vaporization.

OILTRAP.long description: *OILTRAP assigns the oil-trapping relationship that is used to determine the residual oil saturation of imbibition from the historical-maximum-attained oil saturation.

OILWATKV.description: K Value Tables for Aqueous Phase Solubility (Optional)
OILWATKV.long description: These keywords assign K-value tables for gas-water and oil-water equilibria and activate the calculation of solubility and water vaporization using K-value flash.

OMEGA.long description: These keywords are used to specify the equation of state omega-A and omega-B parameters. *OMEGA identifies directly the equation of state omega-A parameter (dimensionless) *OMEGB identifies directly the equation of state omega-B parameter (dimensionless)

OMEGAS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
OMEGAS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

OMEGB.long description: These keywords are used to specify the equation of state omega-A and omega-B parameters. *OMEGA identifies directly the equation of state omega-A parameter (dimensionless) *OMEGB identifies directly the equation of state omega-B parameter (dimensionless)

OMEGBS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
OMEGBS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

ON-TIME.long description: *ON-TIME specifies the fraction of time during which a well or group operates.

OPEN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

OPENMP_SCHEDULE.long description: Set the schedule of worksharing loops and the chunk size. Use *OPENMP_SCHEDULE if you want to set the schedule type separately from the OMP_SHEDULE environment variable

OPERATE.long description: Define the well operating constraints and the remedial action to be taken when a constraint is violated.

OPERATE-HIST.description: Operating Constraints in History Matching Mode (Optional)
OPERATE-HIST.long description: *OPERATE-HIST indicates that well operating constraints defined by *OPERATE are under the special history-matching mode and the constraint values entered for surface phase rates serve as the observed flow rates.

ORTHOGG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

OUTBOARD.long description: Provide a generic data passing interface for any outboard (third-party) software to update a CMG simulator's recurrent data.

OUTPRN.description: Items in the Output Print File (Optional)
OUTPRN.long description: *OUTPRN identifies what information is written to the output print file.

OUTREACT.long description: *OUTREACT directs echoing-out of geochemistry reactions and output of equilibrium-rate-annihilation matrix.

OUTSRF.long description: *OUTSRF identifies whatinformation is written to the Simulation Results file.

PALMAN_ARC_COAL.description: Selection of Model Accounting for Coal Fracture Porosity and Absolute Permeability Changes (Optional)
PALMAN_ARC_COAL.long description: *PALMAN_CMG_COAL, *PALMAN_CMG2_COAL and *PALMAN_ARC_COAL select between the versions of the modified Palmer Mansoori models which account for changes in fracture (cleat) porosity and permeability with pore pressure and/or adsorption / desorption. These models are often needed for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Enhanced CBM (ECBM) simulation.

PALMAN_CMG_COAL.description: Selection of Model Accounting for Coal Fracture Porosity and Absolute Permeability Changes (Optional)
PALMAN_CMG_COAL.long description: *PALMAN_CMG_COAL, *PALMAN_CMG2_COAL and *PALMAN_ARC_COAL select between the versions of the modified Palmer Mansoori models which account for changes in fracture (cleat) porosity and permeability with pore pressure and/or adsorption / desorption. These models are often needed for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Enhanced CBM (ECBM) simulation.

PALMAN_CMG2_COAL.description: Selection of Model Accounting for Coal Fracture Porosity and Absolute Permeability Changes (Optional)
PALMAN_CMG2_COAL.long description: *PALMAN_CMG_COAL, *PALMAN_CMG2_COAL and *PALMAN_ARC_COAL select between the versions of the modified Palmer Mansoori models which account for changes in fracture (cleat) porosity and permeability with pore pressure and/or adsorption / desorption. These models are often needed for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Enhanced CBM (ECBM) simulation.

PARTOL-TOL.long description: *CORNER-TOL controls the minimal spacing required to separate corner points. *CORNER-TOL  cptol *PARTOL-TOL  partol

PAYDEPTH.long description: Specify depth to the centre of the net pay for each grid block in the reservoir.

PCGIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PCGMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PCGMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PCG-PCOND.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCG-SCALE.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCHOR.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

PCON-MANIFOLD.long description: To better honor a group’s manifold or surface pressure constraint, translate it to a tubing-head pressure constraint that is assigned to all that group’s wells.

PCOW_SHIFT.description: Water-Oil Capillary Pressure (J Function) Shift for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCOW_SHIFT.long description: These keywords specify the amount that the water-oil capillary pressure or water-oil J Function curve is shifted up or down. These keywords can be used to account for the effects of a tilted water-oil contact.

PCOWI_SCALE.long description: Specify saturation scaling method for reading the boundary imbibition curve in capillary pressure hysteresis. It affects the couverture of formed scanning curves.

PCRIT.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

PCRITS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
PCRITS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

PCSCALE_2PT.long description: This keyword activates two-end-point capillary pressure scaling for both oil-water and oil-gas capillary pressure.

PCWIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PCWMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PCWMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure or J function of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block are scaled based on these endpoints.

PDD.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDD_DATA.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PDEGAA.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGAAG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
