PDEGAB.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PEAKANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PEAKCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PERF.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERF-MD.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERFV.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERMI.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMJ.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMK.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMODULUS.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

PGTHRDS.description: Number of Threads for Parallel Geomechanics-Processing (Optional)
PGTHRDS.long description: Choose the number of threads to be used for parallel processing of geomechanics-tasks.

PHASEID.long description: *PHASEID specifies one of several methods for identifying single phase reservoir fluids as oils or gases when they are found in grid blocks during a simulation. *REFDEN specifies a reference mass density for the determination of the identity (oil or gas) of single phase reservoir fluids found during a simulation.

PINCHOUTARRAY.long description: *PINCHOUTARRAY defines pinch outs using an array input format.

PINCHOUT-TOL.long description: *PINCHOUT-TOL controls the minimal thickness required to initiate an automatic pinched out connection (see also *PINCHOUTARRAY).

PINCHVGAP.long description: Controls the vertical connectivity between blocks separated by pinched out blocks in a corner point grid.

PITZER-STRICT.description: GHG Option – Pitzer Default Behavior Control (Optional)
PITZER-STRICT.long description: This keyword changes the default behavior of Pitzer Coefficient input. It changes related warning messages to error messages when required Pitzer Coefficients have not been input and are also not found in the internal Pitzer coefficient data-base of GEM.

PIVOT.long description: Specify the diagonal sub-matrix inversion pivot stabilization.

PIVOTG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PLANT-TABLE.long description: *PLANT-TABLE introduces a table of distribution fractions which determine the amounts and compositions of the fluid outputs of a gas plant used in determining initial volumes of fluids at surface conditions in place in the reservoir. A plant table in general consists of several sub-tables, with each sub-table containing distribution fractions for a different value of a key-component mole fraction. The plant is assumed to have three output streams, namely liquid, vapor, and middle. If fewer streams are wanted, the user should enter zeros as distribution fractions for the unwanted output for all components.

PLNR_REFINE.long description: Create a local grid tailored toward a planar hydraulic fracture.

PLNRFRAC.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLNRFRAC_TEMPLATE.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLOADBC.long description: Specify external loads on any nodal points of a finite element.

PLOADBC3D.long description: Specify external load on any nodal points of a 3D finite element.

PLSTRAINY.long description: Specify that strains will be calculated by a series of planes normal to the Y (J) direction.

PNPROSL.description: Number of PARASOL Classes for GMRES (Optional)
PNPROSL.long description: Choose the number and scaling of GMRES vector operation classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) used in the scaling and GMRES iteration.

PNTHRDS.long description: Specify the number of parallel processing threads to use in the simulation.

POISSONMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

POISSR.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

POISSRATIO.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

POISSRATIOIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

POISSRPZ.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

POISSRZP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

POLY-DEGR.long description: Enable or disable polymer computations for viscosity and degradation.

POLY-DEGR-EACT.long description: Specify frequency factor and activation energy for the degradation of a polymer.

POLY-DEGR-FREQFAC.long description: Specify frequency factor and activation energy for the degradation of a polymer.

POLY-VISC-SAL.long description: Enable or disable polymer computations for viscosity and degradation.

POLY-VISC-SHEAR.long description: Enable or disable polymer computations for viscosity and degradation.

PORFT.long description: These array keywords control residual adsorption level, accessible pore volume, and residual resistance factor for an adsorbing component from the aqueous phase.

POROSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PORVOL.long description: Specify grid cell porosity indirectly via pore volume.

PPATTERN.long description: Specify the basic partitioning of the reservoir into non-connected regions and separators that makes possible the parallelization of the linear solution.

PPATTERNG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PRECABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PRECC.long description: Use *PRECC to specify the convergence tolerance for the linear equation solver.

PRECCG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PREFCONC.long description: This keyword specifies the reference concentration for a polymer component in the aqueous phase.

PREFRAC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

PRES.long description: All of these keywords are required for the *USER_INPUT initialization method. *PRES indicates the input of reservoir pressures (kPa | psi). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction). *ZGLOBALC indicates input of initial grid block global composition on a component-by-component basis. *ZGLOBAL indicates input of initial grid block global composition. The entered numbers will be normalized to sum to unity internally. *ZGLOBALC is preferred. *ZGLOBAL or *ZGLOBALC may also be used with *BLOCK_CENTER as well as *DEPTH_AVE initializations.

PRES-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
PRES-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

PRESCBC.long description: Prescribe displacement-type boundary conditions on nodal points of a finite element.

PRESCBC3D.long description: Prescribed displacement-type boundary conditions on a nodal point of a 3D finite element.

PRESLN.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

PRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PRINTGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

PRIOR-FORM.long description: *PRIOR-FORM defines the priority formulae and numerical control parameters for the priority ranking apportionment method or the internal guide rate method set by *APPOR-METHOD *PRIOR / *INGUIDE to meet group targets. It is aimed to produce a desired stream while minimizing the production of other/nuisance streams. It can also be used to meet an injection target by which only the most "injectable" wells operate.

PRODUCER.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer, recycling producer or injector).

PRPOR.long description: *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility determination. *CPOR signals the input of rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility, *CPOR.

PRS-ITERMAX.long description: *PRS-ITERMAX specifies the maximum number of ILU pressure solve iterations to be performed per full linear solver iteration (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAA.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAB.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PRECC.description: Convergence Precision for ILU Pressure Solver (Optional)
PRS-PRECC.long description: *PRS-PRECC specifies the convergence tolerance for the ILU pressure solve (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PSAT.long description: *PSAT specifies a two-phase saturation pressure that can be used to save flash calculation work in some situations.

PTHRESH-FAULT.long description: Introduces threshold pressures for flow across an interface of two adjacent initialization regions (*PTHRESH-IREGN); or across a fault plane (*PTHRESH-FAULT).

PTHRESH-IREGN.long description: Introduces threshold pressures for flow across an interface of two adjacent initialization regions (*PTHRESH-IREGN); or across a fault plane (*PTHRESH-FAULT).

PTUBE1.long description: *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 specifies a table of tubing-head (or outlet) pressure data tables for a production or injection well (or manifold group). The tabulated variable is the bottom-hole (or inlet) pressure, with tubing-head (or outlet) pressure and several independent variables such as surface rates or rate ratios. *PTUBE1 can also be used to input the well-head temperature table.

PTUBE-FIXFRAC.long description: Specify globally the hydraulic table lookup method for calculating the tubing-head pressure of producers.

PVC3.long description: *PVC3 specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs (components both having 1's set using *HCFLAG).

PVC3S.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
PVC3S.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

PVCUTFR.long description: *PVCUTFR controls the level at which a fracture cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTOFF.long description: *PVCUTOFF controls the level at which a cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG-FR.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG-FR.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PWELLBORE.long description: *PWELLBORE specifies that reservoir-to-surface pressure drops will be calculated for the indicated producing wells.

QNSS-TO-NR.long description: *FLASH-METHOD specifies whether the thermodynamic equations should be solved at the same iteration level as the flow equations (*FLASH-METHOD *OUTER) or should be solved to convergence in every Newtonian iteration in a flash subroutine (*FLASH-METHOD *INNER). It has been found that using *FLASH-METHOD *OUTER can lead to significant savings in CPU time. *QNSS-TO-NR specifies whether after a certain point flash convergence method will switch from Quasi-Newton-Successive-Substitution (QNSS) to Newton-Raphson (NR) to achieve an efficient convergence. *FLASH-METHOD-OGW turns on a special three phase flash technique that can be used when aqueous phase solubility is being modeled. When the keywords *SOLUBILITY or *HENRY-CORR-XXX are used for solubility modelling, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW (equivalent to *OGW-FLASH *NO_H2OVAP) is turned on automatically. If the keywords *HENRYC- *REFPH- *VINFINITY appear without the *SOLUBILITY keyword, *FLASH-METHOD-OGW is not turned on automatically.

RANGE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

RANGECHECK.long description: *RANGECHECK controls the data range check feature.

RCONBK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONBT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONFT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONLF.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONRT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONTP.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

REACTION-CHEM.long description: These keywords are used to define the geochemical reactions.

REACTION-EQUIL-MNR.long description: These keywords are used to define the geochemical reactions.

REACTION-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

REACTION-ORDER.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
REACTION-ORDER.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

REACTION-RATE.long description: These keywords are used to define the geochemical reactions.

REACTION-RATE-ARN.long description: These keywords are used to define the geochemical reactions.

REACTION-RATE-TST.long description: These keywords are used to define the geochemical reactions.

REACTION-SCX.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

REACTIVE-SURFACE-AREA.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
REACTIVE-SURFACE-AREA.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

RECYCLE_GEM.long description: *RECYCLE_GEM indicates the entering of data for the non- group controlled gas recycling option. If group control is used (i.e. if the keywords *GCONI or *GCONP appear anywhere in the data set) then this keyword cannot be used and recycling scenarios must be modelled using the *GCONI keyword.

REFCURR.long description: The *REFCURR option updates the reference porosity, pressure or permeability / transmissibility to the current values when the rock compaction is defined recurrently.

REFDEN.long description: *PHASEID specifies one of several methods for identifying single phase reservoir fluids as oils or gases when they are found in grid blocks during a simulation. *REFDEN specifies a reference mass density for the determination of the identity (oil or gas) of single phase reservoir fluids found during a simulation.

REFDEPTH.long description: *REFDEPTH indicates input of reference depth. *REFPRES indicates input of reference pressure.

REFINE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

REFPH.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

REFPRES.long description: *REFDEPTH indicates input of reference depth. *REFPRES indicates input of reference pressure.

REFPW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

REF-TEMP-RATE-CONST.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
REF-TEMP-RATE-CONST.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

REGIONMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers between specified regions.

REPORTING-GROUP.long description: *REPORTING-GROUP allows the definition of a group with arbitrary well membership and weighting factors, for reporting purposes only.

RESDATE.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restarted run.

RESDUCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

RESISTIVITY.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

RESTART.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restarted run.

RESTIME.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restarted run.

RESULTFILE.long description: *RESULTFILE identifies in what format the graphical display files are to be written – the older SRF system, the RESULTS-displayable Simulation Results (IRS/MRF) system, or both. The older SRF system is seldom used and this keyword is becoming obsolete.

REWIND.long description: *WRST controls the frequency of writing restart records to the output restart file. *REWIND controls the rewinding of the restart file just before writing a new restart record.

RF_EXPONENT.long description: Specify computation of phase resistance factor caused by change in fluid porosity including due to solid deposition and/or mineral precipitation or dissolution.

RFAULT.long description: Define keywords to identify faults and assign properties for fault re-activation modeling.

RFAULTBLK.long description: Define keywords to identify faults and assign properties for fault re-activation modeling.

RFCALC.long description: Specify computation of phase resistance factor caused by change in fluid porosity including due to solid deposition and/or mineral precipitation or dissolution.

RFMAX.long description: *ADSCST, *WSLMAX and *RFMAX control the modelling of the adsorption of the solid asphaltene phase, which is entrained in the oil phase, onto the reservoir rock. *SOLIDMODEL must have been used to invoke the asphaltene model.

RG.long description: *RG is used to assign values of an array to refined grid blocks.

RHOW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

RHOWS.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

RIGIDNULL.long description: Assign fixed boundary to nodes around a null block.

RIGIDTOP.long description: Constrain vertical movement on the cap rock of a reservoir.

RM-LAYERCLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a control lump.

RM-LAYERRLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a report lump.

ROCKDEN.long description: Specify value of rock-density for each gridblock used in calculation of adsorption of component from the gas, aqueous, or solid asphaltene phase onto the reservoir rock.

ROCKFLUID.long description: *ROCKFLUID indicates the start of the rock-fluid data.

ROCKJOINT.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

RPLTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RPT.long description: *RPT indicates that this set of relative permeability curves will be defined by table entries.

RPWTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RRFT.long description: These array keywords control residual adsorption level, accessible pore volume, and residual resistance factor for an adsorbing component from the aqueous phase.

RS.description: Initial Reservoir Fluid Formation Volume Factors (Optional)
RS.long description: *BO input initial oil formation volume factor. *BG input initial gas formation volume factor. *RS input initial solution gas-oil ratio.

RTYPE.long description: *RTYPE indicates the start of input of rock types. A relative permeability curve set_number is assigned to each grid block (see *RPT).

RUN.long description: *RUN identifies the beginning of all well and recurrent data keywords.

SA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SALINITY.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

SALINITY-CALC.long description: These keywords are used in the aqueous phase model option in GHG. Other aqueous phase model options are described in Aqueous Phase Properties.

SALINR.long description: These keywords indicate input of initial aqueous or mineral concentrations in the model. In addition to the usual data for initial conditions, the following information is required.

SATWCUTOFF.long description: These keywords are used to model H2O vaporization.

SBETA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SBG.description: Assign Data to Structured Block Groups
SBG.long description: *SBG assigns values or tasks to a group of blocks defined by *SBLOCKGROUP.

SCALING-STARS.long description: *SCALING-STARS implies the selection of end point scaling approach first implemented in STARS.

SCOEFF-IEX.long description: These keywords are used to define ion-exchange related input.

SCONNECT.long description: *SCONNECT allows the definition of flow connections between blocks that would not otherwise be generated by the simulator. Also, *SCONNECT allows existing flow connections to be overridden.

SCX-AREA.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SCX-CAPACITY.description: Surface Complexation Capacity for Each Grid Block (Optional)
SCX-CAPACITY.long description: This keyword signals the input of surface capacity for each block, for each site required for surface complexation reactions.

SCX-COMP-VALENCE.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SCXDAMP.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SCXDAMP-ALL.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SCX-K-VALUE.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SCX-LOGK-VALUE.long description: These keywords are used to define the surface complexation reactions.

SD_REINF.long description: *SD_REINF works with *TRANSD to modify the Inter-Subdomain connection (defined by *TRANSD > 0.0) to represent reinfiltration.

SDEGREE.long description: Specify the maximum degree of fill terms used in the linear solver’s factorization.

SDEGREEG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SECTOR.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize output of regional reservoir activity.

SECTORARRAY.long description: Specify reporting sector using a grid-array format.

SECTORNAMES.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize regional reservoir activity, via sector number and grid array.

SEEKPARENT.description: Seek Parent Chain of Prior Simulator Response for Geo-Post Processing (Optional)
SEEKPARENT.long description: Keyword *SEEKPARENT allows user to enable or disable looking for parent files that generated the existing prior simulator response output (IRF/MRF or SR3 or RST) for geo-post-processing. This keyword is used only for geo-post-processing (*GEOPOSTPRO) runs.

SEPARATOR.long description: *SEPARATOR specifies the separator conditions through which the initial fluid-in-place is calculated.

SETHA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SETPI.long description: Overwrite a well’s phase productivity/injectivity, or multiply it by a factor.

SG.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

SGAMMA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SGT.long description: *SLT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on liquid saturation. *SGT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on gas saturation.

SHAPE.long description: Specify which shape factor formulation to use in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SHEAR_FAC.long description: Convert fluid Darcy velocities to equivalent porous media shear rates.

SHEAREFFEC.long description: Specify viscosity dependence option for shear dependent effects on viscosity of aqueous polymer solutions.

SHEARMOD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

SHEARMODIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARTAB.description: Shear Effects on Polymer Viscosity – Tabular input (Conditional)
SHEARTAB.long description: This keyword defines the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer component in the aqueous phase in a tabular format.

SHEARTHCKT.long description: These keywords define the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer in the aqueous phase.

SHEARTHICK.long description: These keywords define the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer in the aqueous phase.

SHEARTHIN.long description: These keywords define the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer in the aqueous phase.

SHPERMAX.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHPERMRES.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHUTIN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

SIGMA.description: Interfacial Tension Effects on Relative Permeability (Optional)
SIGMA.long description: *SIGMA indicates that relative permeabilities and capillary pressures are dependent on interfacial tension; the parameters for calculating the dependence follow the keyword. Use of keyword *IFTMISPT ensures calculation of relative permeabilities and capillary pressures that change smoothly from two-phase to single-phase and vice versa, during miscibility transitions.

SIGMAMF.description: Direct Input of Shape Factor and Transfer Permeability Arrays (Optional)
SIGMAMF.long description: Keywords *SIGMAMF and *KAVMF allow direct input of the block shape factor and average transfer permeability arrays, respectively, for each grid block to be used in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SIMMSG.long description: *SIMMSG controls the destination for output of Simulator (SIM) messages during time stepping.

SIP_DATA.long description: Keyword to indicate that grid-array data is stored in binary or simulation input (SIP) compressed form.

SITERPG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SKAPA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKAPA2.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKIN-TUNER.long description: *SKIN-TUNER calculates and applies a separate well index multiplier to wells so that the user-specified bottom-hole pressure and surface rate will match under the current reservoir and wellbore conditions.

SLT.long description: *SLT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on liquid saturation. *SGT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on gas saturation.

SM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SNG.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SOLID_ALPHA.long description: These keywords control the deposition of flocculated solid particles. The conversion of precipitated to flocculated asphaltene particles is controlled with the *SOLID-CONV-RATE keyword.

SOLID_BETA.long description: These keywords control the deposition of flocculated solid particles. The conversion of precipitated to flocculated asphaltene particles is controlled with the *SOLID-CONV-RATE keyword.

SOLID_CRITVEL.long description: These keywords control the deposition of flocculated solid particles. The conversion of precipitated to flocculated asphaltene particles is controlled with the *SOLID-CONV-RATE keyword.

SOLID_GAMMA.long description: These keywords control the deposition of flocculated solid particles. The conversion of precipitated to flocculated asphaltene particles is controlled with the *SOLID-CONV-RATE keyword.

SOLID_SIGMA.long description: These keywords control the deposition of flocculated solid particles. The conversion of precipitated to flocculated asphaltene particles is controlled with the *SOLID-CONV-RATE keyword.

SOLID_TREF.long description: These keywords allow the user to enter parameters related to the asphaltene precipitation model. These parameters may all be generated using WinProp and automatically exported with the GEM fluid model.

SOLID-CONV-RATE.long description: This keyword allows the user to enter forward and reverse rates for the conversion of precipitated asphaltene to flocculated asphaltene. This conversion may be made reversible, fully irreversible or partially irreversible. Asphaltene "flocs" may deposit in the porous media as described in the section on the "Asphaltene Deposition Model".

SOLIDMODEL.long description: These keywords allow the user to enter parameters related to the asphaltene precipitation model. These parameters may all be generated using WinProp and automatically exported with the GEM fluid model.

SOLIDTHERMAL.long description: These keywords allow the user to enter parameters related to the asphaltene precipitation model. These parameters may all be generated using WinProp and automatically exported with the GEM fluid model.

SOLUBILITY.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

SOLUBILITY-MODEL.long description: This keyword indicates which solubility model is to be used for all or for the specific components defined by a list of component names.

SOLVER.long description: Choose which linear equation solver to use: AIMSOL or PARASOL. (In order to use PARASOL, the parallel computing licensing feature must be active).

SOLVERG.long description: Specify the matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SOMGAS.description: Residual Oil Saturation Calculation for STONE1 Relative Permeability Model (Optional)
SOMGAS.long description: Keywords *SOMWAT, *SOMGAS, *SOMGASI, *SOMWATI allow the user to enter a table of residual oil saturation as a function of water/gas saturation to be used in the *STONE1 three phase oil relative permeability model.

SOMGASI.description: Residual Oil Saturation Calculation for STONE1 Relative Permeability Model (Optional)
SOMGASI.long description: Keywords *SOMWAT, *SOMGAS, *SOMGASI, *SOMWATI allow the user to enter a table of residual oil saturation as a function of water/gas saturation to be used in the *STONE1 three phase oil relative permeability model.

SOMWAT.description: Residual Oil Saturation Calculation for STONE1 Relative Permeability Model (Optional)
SOMWAT.long description: Keywords *SOMWAT, *SOMGAS, *SOMGASI, *SOMWATI allow the user to enter a table of residual oil saturation as a function of water/gas saturation to be used in the *STONE1 three phase oil relative permeability model.

SOMWATI.description: Residual Oil Saturation Calculation for STONE1 Relative Permeability Model (Optional)
SOMWATI.long description: Keywords *SOMWAT, *SOMGAS, *SOMGASI, *SOMWATI allow the user to enter a table of residual oil saturation as a function of water/gas saturation to be used in the *STONE1 three phase oil relative permeability model.

SORDER.long description: Specify the ordering of equations in the ILU factorization.

SORDERG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SORM.long description: *SORM indicates that a trapped oil saturation is to be read for each grid block.

SORMAX.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block. The table curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock-Fluid Data.

SPATM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SPECGRAV.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis.

SPEC-REACT-SURFACE-AREA.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
SPEC-REACT-SURFACE-AREA.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

SR2ASCII.description: Selection of Additional Plain Text SR2 Main File (Optional)
SR2ASCII.long description: *SR2ASCII indicates that if graphical display files are being written in the Simulation Results format (under *RESULTFILE, or *SRFORMAT), an ASCII copy of the binary Main Results File (.mrf) or SR3 (.sr3) will also be produced, with the extension .asc.

SR2PREC.description: Floating-Point Precision for Writing Output to SR2 Main Files (Optional)
SR2PREC.long description: *SR2PREC indicates input of the floating-point precision to which the output to graphical display files is to be written.

SRFORMAT.long description: Specify the file format for passing simulation results to CMG viewing software.

SRFTNG.long description: Replaces water-oil and/or oil-gas capillary pressures entered with Leverett J Functions.

SRFTNW.long description: Replaces water-oil and/or oil-gas capillary pressures entered with Leverett J Functions.

SSMODEL.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STEN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STRESI.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS_RETURN.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

STRESS3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSGRAD.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSGRAD3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSH.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSHIJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHIK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHJK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

STRINF.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

SUBDOMAIN.long description: *SUBDOMAIN indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the subdomain method.

SUMMARY.description: Well, Aquifer and Sector Summary Tables (Optional)
SUMMARY.long description: *SUMMARY controls the printing of summary tables for individual wells and the summary tables for the *OUTSRF *WELL variables.

SUPER-SATURATION-INDEX.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
SUPER-SATURATION-INDEX.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

SW.long description: All of these keywords are required for the *USER_INPUT initialization method. *PRES indicates the input of reservoir pressures (kPa | psi). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction). *ZGLOBALC indicates input of initial grid block global composition on a component-by-component basis. *ZGLOBAL indicates input of initial grid block global composition. The entered numbers will be normalized to sum to unity internally. *ZGLOBALC is preferred. *ZGLOBAL or *ZGLOBALC may also be used with *BLOCK_CENTER as well as *DEPTH_AVE initializations.

SWINIT.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWINIT_ADJMOB.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_ADJMOB.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWINIT_CONTROL.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_CONTROL.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWINIT_CPADJST.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_CPADJST.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWINIT_FRAC.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_FRAC.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWINIT_NOCRIT.description: Initial Water Saturation with Capillary Pressure Adjustments (Conditional)
SWINIT_NOCRIT.long description: *SWINIT and the associated keywords specify the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL saturation provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for grid blocks where the water phase is initially (after gravity capillary equilibrium calculations) immobile and remains immobile after application of user defined water saturation via *SWINIT array *SWINIT_FRAC provides a choice whether or not to scale/shift oil water capillary pressure for fracture grid blocks in dual porosity or dual permeability systems.

SWNEQ.description: Non Equilibrium Water and Oil Saturation Used with Gravity-Capillary Equilibrium Initialization (Conditional)
SWNEQ.long description: *SWNEQ indicates input of non-equilibrium initial water saturation override to be used with gravity-capillary equilibrium initialization.

SWOC.long description: *SWOC indicates input of water saturation below the water-oil contact. For models with *USER_INPUT, *SWOC is used to internally modify *SW input values such that *SW values are less than or equal to *SWOC.

SWR-H2OVAP.long description: These keywords are used to model H2O vaporization.

SWT.long description: *SWT indicates the start of the water-oil relative permeability table. The lines entered after *SWT are interpreted as rows of the table until a keyword is encountered.

SWT3.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of water relative permeability in oil-water system or in gas-water reservoir and signal the entry of associated parameters. Keyword *SWT3 allows the user to enter the 'three-phase' water relative permeability curve. This curve as well as the two-phase flow curve entered with the keyword *SWT are utilized in modeling water phase relative permeability hysteresis for the three-phase Water-Alternating-Gas (WAG) model.

SWTI.long description: *SWTI indicates the start of the water-oil imbibition relative permeability table.

TARGET.long description: *TARGET allows modification of any previously specified well constraint value or the specification of a new constraint type and value for well(s).

TB.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

TCMULT.long description: *TCMULT indicates input of a critical temperature multiplier used with the single phase identification method *PHASEID *TCMIX and with single hydrocarbon phase relative permeability interpolation controlled by *TRLIMS.

TCRIT.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

TCRITS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
TCRITS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

TDEPCR.long description: The *TDEPCR keyword indicates that the compaction/dilation tables under the *CROCKTYPE it is specified are temperature dependent.

TEMP-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
TEMP-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

TEMPER.long description: This keyword is used to specify the initial reservoir temperature at any block.

THCONR0.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define the thermal rock properties.

THERMAL.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option.

THEXPCOEF.long description: Specify the thermal expansion coefficient for a rock type due to the thermal effect.

THEXPCOEFI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

TIME.long description: *TIME indicates that the well change will occur at a specified time.

TITLE2.long description: *TITLE2 is used for project identification. It is used in addition to *TITLE1 to provide a second line for project identification.

TITLE3.long description: *TITLE3 is used for project identification. It is used in addition to *TITLE1 and *TITLE2 to provide a third line for project identification.

TKRGCL.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRGCL.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKRGRL.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRGRL.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKROCRW.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKROCRW.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKROCW.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKROCW.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKROGCG.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKROGCG.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKROGCRG.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKROGCRG.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKRW3P.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRW3P.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKRWIRO.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRWIRO.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKRWRO.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRWRO.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TKRWROI.description: Table Based Scaling: Maximum Relative Permeability Values (Optional)
TKRWROI.long description: These keywords specify the vertical end point values of the relative permeability curves for each relative permeability table. The entered curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) curves are scaled based on these end points. Use of any of these keywords forces GEM to use the new endpoint scaling; see Notes on Rock Fluid.

TORNOPS2DIFF.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

TORNOPSDIFF.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

TORPSDIFF.long description: *DIFCOR-OIL, *DIFCOR-GAS, and *DIFCOR-AQU select a correlation type for the molecular diffusion option in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *DIFFC-OIL, *DIFFC-GAS and *DIFFC-AQU define coefficients that specify molecular diffusion rates in oil, gas, and aqueous phase respectively. *RESISTIVITY defines a resistivity factor for use with the molecular diffusion option. *TORPSDIFF, *TORNOPSDIFF and *TORNOPS2DIFF select different options controlling the tortuosity model.

TRACE-COMP.long description: These keywords manage the creation of a trace component either externally or internally. *TRACE-COMP indicates a trace component that is entered in the *COMPNAME list by the user. *TRACE-COMP keyword defines a trace component that prevents the fluid phase (gas or oil) from completely disappearing in the water zone when gas solubility is activated. *TRACE-INTERNAL-OFF keyword disables the creation of an internal trace component.

TRACE-INTERNAL-OFF.long description: These keywords manage the creation of a trace component either externally or internally. *TRACE-COMP indicates a trace component that is entered in the *COMPNAME list by the user. *TRACE-COMP keyword defines a trace component that prevents the fluid phase (gas or oil) from completely disappearing in the water zone when gas solubility is activated. *TRACE-INTERNAL-OFF keyword disables the creation of an internal trace component.

TRANLI.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLJ.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLK.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANSD.long description: *TRANSD enables vertical inter-block matrix-fracture flow in *DUALPERM model, or vertical inter-block matrix-matrix flow in *SUBDOMAIN model, and indicates input of an array of transmissibility multipliers to be applied on these connections.

TRANSF.long description: Adjusts transmissibilities on a fault basis.

TRANSFER.long description: *TRANSFER indicates the type of matrix-fracture model for treating different phases in dual-porosity or dual-permeability reservoirs.

TRANSI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSIJ-.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIJ+.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIK-.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSIK+.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the diagonal grid directions (*NINEPOINT only).

TRANSJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSLATE.description: Changing the Keywords by Using Translate Rules (Optional)
TRANSLATE.long description: *TRANSLATE changes or translates your own favorite keyword into a CMG simulator recognizable keyword.

TRANSMF.long description: *TRANSMF specifies transmissibility multiplier for fluid flow between matrix and fracture.

TRANSMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers.

TRANVI.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVJ.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVK.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVMOD.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRCR-AQUIFER.long description: These keywords are used to define initial tracer concentration in gridblocks or within aquifers.

TRCR-ASSOC.long description: These keywords are used to define passive tracers and assign their associate components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest in a simulation.

TRCR-CFL.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls to solve tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit scheme. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine time-step size for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations. *TRCR-DTMIN and *TRCR-DTMAX specify the minimum and maximum sub time-step size, respectively, for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations.

TRCR-DTMAX.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls to solve tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit scheme. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine time-step size for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations. *TRCR-DTMIN and *TRCR-DTMAX specify the minimum and maximum sub time-step size, respectively, for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations.

TRCR-DTMIN.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls to solve tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit scheme. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine time-step size for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations. *TRCR-DTMIN and *TRCR-DTMAX specify the minimum and maximum sub time-step size, respectively, for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations.

TRCR-INJCONC.long description: *TRCR-INJCONC specifies the concentration of a tracer in an injection well.

TRCRNAME.long description: These keywords are used to define passive tracers and assign their associate components that are used to track the movement of the components of interest in a simulation.

TRCR-SOLVE.long description: These keywords specify simulation controls to solve tracer equations. *TRCR-SOLVE identifies whether the tracer equation system is solved by implicit or explicit scheme. *TRCR-CFL selects the formulation of the Courant-Friedrichs-Lewy (CFL) condition to determine time-step size for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations. *TRCR-DTMIN and *TRCR-DTMAX specify the minimum and maximum sub time-step size, respectively, for the explicit scheme for solution of the tracer equations.

TREFVS.long description: *VSHIFT specifies the volume shifts to be applied to the equation of state molar volumes. *VSHIF1 and *TREFVS indicate that a linear temperature-dependent volume shift model will be applied.

TRGLOBALC.long description: These keywords are used to define initial tracer concentration in gridblocks or within aquifers.

TRGVAR.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRGVARS.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRIGGER.description: Allow for a Set of Keywords to be Processed When a Specified Condition (Trigger) is Satisfied (Optional)
TRIGGER.long description: Specify certain actions which are implemented when one or more specific conditions are satisfied during the simulation.

TRLIMS.long description: Use of *TRLIMS indicates that reduced temperature limits will be used together with the pseudo-critical temperature of a single hydrocarbon phase to generate a relative permeability interpolating function. This function is used to calculate a water-hydrocarbon relative permeability by interpolating between the water-oil and gas-liquid relative permeability curves.

TSGCON.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSGCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSGCRIT.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSGCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSLCON.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSLCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSOIRG.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSOIRG.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSOIRW.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSOIRW.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSOIRW3P.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSOIRW3P.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSORG.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSORG.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSORW.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSORW.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TST-ACTIVITY-POWER.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
TST-ACTIVITY-POWER.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

TST-PARAM1.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
TST-PARAM1.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

TST-PARAM2.description: GHG Option - Reaction Equilibrium and Rate Parameters
TST-PARAM2.long description: These keywords are used to define the parameters used for the aqueous phase chemical equilibrium reactions and the mineral dissolution and precipitation reactions.

TSWCON.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSWCON.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSWCRIT.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSWCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TSWCRIT3P.description: Table Based Scaling: Saturation Endpoints for Relative Permeability (Optional)
TSWCRIT3P.long description: These keywords specify the end points of the relative permeability curve of each relative permeability table. The entered relative permeability curves (via keywords *SWT/*SGT) are scaled (overridden) based on these end points.

TWELLBORE.long description: *TWELLBORE specifies that wellbore temperature calculations will be done for a producer with the assigned method.

TWOPTFLUX.long description: *TWOPTFLUX activates a numerical dispersion control option.

UBA.long description: Specify address for any block in the grid.

UNI-WBLOCK-COAL.long description: *LANG-DIFFUSION-COAL and the older *FREE-DIFFUSION-COAL select the type of coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusion modelling to be used for Coal Bed Methane (CBM) and Extended CBM (ECBM) modelling. *NO-WBLOCK-COAL, *UNI-WBLOCK-COAL and *DBL-WBLOCK-COAL control water blocking functions for coal-cleat (matrix-fracture) diffusive flows.

UNLOADSTR.long description: Assign total stress to be unloaded at the well boundary.

URBCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URECOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN1.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN2.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

USER_INPUT.description: Vertical Equilibrium or User Input Selection (Required)
USER_INPUT.long description: *VERTICAL and *USER_INPUT control the type of reservoir initialization calculation.

USHEARST.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

USTRESCUR.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

UTSTRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

VAMOD.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VATYPE.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VCRIT.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

VELCAPN.description: Potential Gradient in Calculation of Capillary Number (Optional)
VELCAPN.long description: *VELCAPN indicates a choice of potential gradient in capillary number calculation.

VELDEPRP.long description: *VELDEPRP indicates that relative permeability is dependent on phase velocity and interfacial tension; the parameters for calculating the dependence follow the keyword. This option is designed to model gas condensate systems where the reduction in relative permeability due to condensate dropout is mitigated by low interfacial tension and/or the high fluid velocities, especially in the near well region. The dependence of the relative permeability on the capillary number (CN) has been validated through experimental measurements.

VERTICAL.description: Vertical Equilibrium or User Input Selection (Required)
