VERTICAL.long description: *VERTICAL and *USER_INPUT control the type of reservoir initialization calculation.

VINFINITY.long description: These keywords define the solubility of components in the aqueous phase.

VISCOEFF.description: Parameters for Computing Viscosity of Hydrocarbon Fluids (Optional)
VISCOEFF.long description: Keywords to introduce the input of parameters used to compute the hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISCOSITY specifies the component viscosities to be used in a direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon viscosities. *MIXINGRULE specifies the exponent to be used in the direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISVC specifies the component pseudo-critical volumes used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *MIXVC specifies the exponent used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *VISCOEFF specifies the coefficients for the Jossi, Stiel and Thodos correlation, or for the Pedersen or Modified Pedersen correlations.

VISCOR.long description: Keyword to specify how the hydrocarbon phase viscosities are to be computed.

VISCOSITY.description: Parameters for Computing Viscosity of Hydrocarbon Fluids (Optional)
VISCOSITY.long description: Keywords to introduce the input of parameters used to compute the hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISCOSITY specifies the component viscosities to be used in a direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon viscosities. *MIXINGRULE specifies the exponent to be used in the direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISVC specifies the component pseudo-critical volumes used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *MIXVC specifies the exponent used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *VISCOEFF specifies the coefficients for the Jossi, Stiel and Thodos correlation, or for the Pedersen or Modified Pedersen correlations.

VISCTABLE-AQUEOUS.description: Aqueous Phase Viscosity with Polymer Components (Conditional)
VISCTABLE-AQUEOUS.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of components in the aqueous phase.

VISCTABLE-H2O.description: Viscosity of Water Component (H2O) in Aqueous Phase (Conditional)
VISCTABLE-H2O.long description: These keywords define the viscosity of the pure water component (H2O) in the aqueous phase.

VISFLOWR.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISINIT.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPARA.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPOWER.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSCHEME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSTEP.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISTIME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISVC.description: Parameters for Computing Viscosity of Hydrocarbon Fluids (Optional)
VISVC.long description: Keywords to introduce the input of parameters used to compute the hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISCOSITY specifies the component viscosities to be used in a direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon viscosities. *MIXINGRULE specifies the exponent to be used in the direct mixing-rule evaluation of hydrocarbon phase viscosities. *VISVC specifies the component pseudo-critical volumes used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *MIXVC specifies the exponent used to compute the mixture critical volume for use in the Jossi, Stiel, and Thodos formula. *VISCOEFF specifies the coefficients for the Jossi, Stiel and Thodos correlation, or for the Pedersen or Modified Pedersen correlations.

VISW.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the aqueous phase, and the models used for property calculations.

VOLMOD.long description: *VOLMOD indicates input of an array of bulk volume modifiers.

VOLUMEFRACTION-MINERAL.long description: These keywords indicate input of initial aqueous or mineral concentrations in the model. In addition to the usual data for initial conditions, the following information is required.

VRI_GROUP.description: Injection Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
VRI_GROUP.long description: Specify the injection group from which gas/water/voidage injection rates will be taken to calculate a production recycling or voidage replacement target for a given group or groups. The actual recycling or voidage replacement target is specified using keyword *GCONP.

VSHIF1.long description: *VSHIFT specifies the volume shifts to be applied to the equation of state molar volumes. *VSHIF1 and *TREFVS indicate that a linear temperature-dependent volume shift model will be applied.

VSHIFT.long description: *VSHIFT specifies the volume shifts to be applied to the equation of state molar volumes. *VSHIF1 and *TREFVS indicate that a linear temperature-dependent volume shift model will be applied.

VSHIFTS.description: Equation of State Parameters at Surface Conditions (Optional)
VSHIFTS.long description: These keywords specify equation of state (EOS) parameters for fluid properties calculations at separator and surface conditions. Use of these keywords is no longer recommended. Use *EOSSET instead. *BINS specifies the interaction coefficient parameters for the user components in the second set. *PVC3S specifies the parameter used to calculate the interaction coefficients between hydrocarbon-hydrocarbon component pairs in the second set. *PCRITS specifies critical pressure [atm] in the second set. *OMEGAS identifies the EOS omega-A parameters in the second set. *OMEGBS identifies the EOS omega-B parameters in the second set. *TCRITS specifies the critical temperature [deg K] in the second set. *VSHIFTS specifies the volume shifts in the second set.

VSMIXENDP.description: Nonlinear Mixing Rule for Aqueous Phase Viscosity in Presence of Polymer Components
VSMIXENDP.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule to compute aqueous phase viscosity with the *NONLIN1 sub-keyword of *AQUEOUS-VISCOSITY *POLYMER keyword.

VSMIXFUNC.description: Nonlinear Mixing Rule for Aqueous Phase Viscosity in Presence of Polymer Components
VSMIXFUNC.long description: Specify nonlinear mixing rule to compute aqueous phase viscosity with the *NONLIN1 sub-keyword of *AQUEOUS-VISCOSITY *POLYMER keyword.

VSSALTCMP.description: Effect of Salinity on Polymer Viscosity (Conditional)
VSSALTCMP.long description: This keyword defines the effect of salinity on the viscosity of polymer in the aqueous phase.

WBRANCH.long description: *WBRANCH defines multi-lateral well branches using trajectory points.

WBROTATE.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBROTATE.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WBSHIFT.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBSHIFT.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WCRV.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

WCURRCN.long description: Force a well to run on its current operating constraint without checking for constraint violation and possible switching.

WEL_OPN_MLT.long description: These keywords signal the input of parameters that will be used for modelling cap rock fluid leakage using wells. These parameter values are associated with a particular compaction/dilation rock type assigned by a preceding *CROCKTYPE keyword, and this rock type is associated with a particular cap rock region through the assignment of the rock type number to the desired cells via the *CTYPE keyword. To enable this feature, production wells also have to be defined in the chosen cap rock cells using standard well definitions. Additionally, these wells must be declared as cap rock leakage wells using keyword *CRL_WELLS in the Well and Recurrent Data section. The parameters discussed here can be used to enable a pressure-dependent well productivity multiplier that allows fluid leakage (via well production) once a sufficiently large pressure drop (between the cap rock cell and the well's BHP) has existed.

WEL_OPN_MMN.long description: These keywords signal the input of parameters that will be used for modelling cap rock fluid leakage using wells. These parameter values are associated with a particular compaction/dilation rock type assigned by a preceding *CROCKTYPE keyword, and this rock type is associated with a particular cap rock region through the assignment of the rock type number to the desired cells via the *CTYPE keyword. To enable this feature, production wells also have to be defined in the chosen cap rock cells using standard well definitions. Additionally, these wells must be declared as cap rock leakage wells using keyword *CRL_WELLS in the Well and Recurrent Data section. The parameters discussed here can be used to enable a pressure-dependent well productivity multiplier that allows fluid leakage (via well production) once a sufficiently large pressure drop (between the cap rock cell and the well's BHP) has existed.

WEL_OPN_MMX.long description: These keywords signal the input of parameters that will be used for modelling cap rock fluid leakage using wells. These parameter values are associated with a particular compaction/dilation rock type assigned by a preceding *CROCKTYPE keyword, and this rock type is associated with a particular cap rock region through the assignment of the rock type number to the desired cells via the *CTYPE keyword. To enable this feature, production wells also have to be defined in the chosen cap rock cells using standard well definitions. Additionally, these wells must be declared as cap rock leakage wells using keyword *CRL_WELLS in the Well and Recurrent Data section. The parameters discussed here can be used to enable a pressure-dependent well productivity multiplier that allows fluid leakage (via well production) once a sufficiently large pressure drop (between the cap rock cell and the well's BHP) has existed.

WEL_OPN_THR.long description: These keywords signal the input of parameters that will be used for modelling cap rock fluid leakage using wells. These parameter values are associated with a particular compaction/dilation rock type assigned by a preceding *CROCKTYPE keyword, and this rock type is associated with a particular cap rock region through the assignment of the rock type number to the desired cells via the *CTYPE keyword. To enable this feature, production wells also have to be defined in the chosen cap rock cells using standard well definitions. Additionally, these wells must be declared as cap rock leakage wells using keyword *CRL_WELLS in the Well and Recurrent Data section. The parameters discussed here can be used to enable a pressure-dependent well productivity multiplier that allows fluid leakage (via well production) once a sufficiently large pressure drop (between the cap rock cell and the well's BHP) has existed.

WELGEO.long description: Specify geometric parameters for internal well index calculation of listed wells. *WELGEO overrides temporarily the global defaults specified by keyword *GEOMETRY.

WELLALQ.long description: Specify an artificial lift quantity (ALQ) value to be used with the tubing-head pressure hydraulics table *PTUBE1.

WELLINIT.description: Set Frequency of Initialization of Bottom-Hole Pressure (Optional)
WELLINIT.long description: *WELLINIT specifies the frequency of reinitializing the bottom hole pressure of a well running on rate, drawdown, or implicitly imposed well head pressure constraints.

WELLIST.long description: *WELLIST creates and modifies well lists for use by keywords that require a list of wells.

WELLSHEAR.long description: *WELLSHEAR invokes the application of well shear model for non-Newtonian polymer solution.

WELPRN.long description: *WELPRN is used to output supported custom well quantities to the GEM out file.

WELSEP.long description: *WELSEP specifies the separators through which the produced fluids are assigned surface stream compositions, molar rates, and volumetric rates.

WELSEP-ICPRT.long description: *WELSEP-ICPRT controls the printing of separator stage compositions to the output file for the production wells.

WGC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
WGC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, the value of the water-oil capillary pressure at the oil-water contact and the value of the gas-water capillary pressure at the water-gas contact, respectively. These values are used in the *VERTICAL *DEPTH_AVE initialization options.

WHPCRTB.description: Set Application Mode of Correlation for Well Head Pressure (Optional)
WHPCRTB.long description: *WHPCRTB allows the user to invoke a time-saving option in the application of a correlation to compute the WHP. In the integration of pressure up the wellbore, the derivatives dP/dz are usually computed by performing an equation of state flash and applying the correlation each time the derivative value is required. An alternative is to compute a table of dP/dz as a function of pressure and temperature before beginning the integration, and to compute values of dP/dz needed in the integration by interpolation in this table. This latter method can potentially shorten the computation significantly, especially if the simulation has many wells on implicit WHP control. The use of the correlation for computing WHP is fixed with the *PWELLBORE *MODEL or *IWELLBORE *MODEL keywords. The tabular method invoked with *WHPCRTB differs from the use of standard tubing head pressure tables (entered using the *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 keyword), in that these dP/dz tables are recomputed before each pressure integration up the wellbore. At each table calculation the true wellbore fluid composition and the true temperature and pressure range in the wellbore are used. The tables entered with *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1, on the other hand, are used for many different WHP calculations.

WIRANGE.long description: *WIRANGE specifies the range of the constant geometric part of the well indices (WI) and takes proper actions if the well indices are out of the range.

WLISTOPEN.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTOPEN.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WLISTSHUT.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTSHUT.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WMKMAXR.description: Maximum Water Make-up Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKMAXR.long description: Specify the maximum surface rate of make-up water injected as part of a group water recycling target to supplement the recycled water.

WMKUPTO.description: Water Make-up Target for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKUPTO.long description: Specify a total group water injection rate for each listed well group. The variable recycled water will be supplemented by make-up water to meet each group’s target, subject to other well constraints.

WMMSG.long description: *WMMSG controls the destination for output of Well Management (WM) messages for individual wells, groups, and other input- output messages generated from processing of recurrent section of the data file.

WMONITOR.description: Append Monitored Constraints to Listed Wells (Optional)
WMONITOR.long description: Append a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

WMTHRDS.description: Number of Threads for Parallel Well Management-Processing (Optional)
WMTHRDS.long description: Choose the number of threads to be used for parallel processing of Well-Management (WM) tasks.

WOC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
WOC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, the value of the water-oil capillary pressure at the oil-water contact and the value of the gas-water capillary pressure at the water-gas contact, respectively. These values are used in the *VERTICAL *DEPTH_AVE initialization options.

WORKOVER-DATA.description: Data for Workover Action for Wells (Optional)
WORKOVER-DATA.long description: *WORKOVER-DATA introduces the input of parameters which control the *WORKOVER action taken when a producing well violates a minimum rate monitored constraint which has *WORKOVER specified as the action to be taken in the event that the constraint is violated. The *WORKOVER action is specified using the *MONITOR keyword. The workover parameters which can be entered using *WORKOVER-DATA can also be entered after the *WORKOVER action subkeyword of the *MONITOR keyword; *WORKOVER-DATA is somewhat more convenient to use and is meant to supplant parameter entry after *WORKOVER, which however is still supported.

WPLYFAC.long description: Specify the viscosity adjustment factor for polymer/water mixtures in wells.

WPRN.long description: *WPRN controls the frequency of writing data to the output print files.

WPRODGROUP.description: Water Producing Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
WPRODGROUP.long description: Specify the group from which water production rate (recycling) or total production rate (voidage replacement) will be taken to calculate a production-dependent water injection target specified for another group.

WRADIUS.long description: Assign well radius where boundary conditions are to be applied for the axisymmetric radial grid. The desired model can be either the plasticity model or plasticity with well boundary unloading.

WRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WRECYMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which water is re-injected under a group recycling target.

WRST.long description: *WRST controls the frequency of writing restart records to the output restart file. *REWIND controls the rewinding of the restart file just before writing a new restart record.

WSLMAX.long description: *ADSCST, *WSLMAX and *RFMAX control the modelling of the adsorption of the solid asphaltene phase, which is entrained in the oil phase, onto the reservoir rock. *SOLIDMODEL must have been used to invoke the asphaltene model.

WSRF.long description: *WSRF controls how frequently well and/or grid information is written to the output Simulation Results File.

WTINCR.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

WTMULT.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

XCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
XCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

XDR.long description: *OUTSRF identifies whatinformation is written to the Simulation Results file.

XFLOW-MODEL.long description: *XFLOW-MODEL is used to identify the method used to model well backflow and crossflow in a specified set of wells.

YAQU-RATE-CUTOFF.long description: These keywords are used to define derivative types and mole fraction cut-off for the geochemical reactions.

YCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
YCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

YLDSTRESS.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

YOUNGM.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

YOUNGMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

YOUNGMP.long description: These keywords are used to enter the Palmer-Mansoori model or Palmer-Higgs model parameters. The Palmer-Mansoori model is an isotropic model that accounts for change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability due to change in net overburden stress and matrix shrinkage/swelling while the Palmer-Higgs model predicts anisotropic change in fracture porosity and absolute permeability for the same reason. Matrix shrinkage or swelling occurs as a result of desorption or adsorption of gaseous species.

ZCORN.description: Corner Point Depths for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
ZCORN.long description: *ZCORN signals input of an array of corner point depths for corner point grids.

ZCRIT.long description: These keywords are used to specify the properties of the user components. *SG identifies specific gravity (dimensionless) *TB identifies the average normal boiling point (deg C | deg F) *MW identifies the molecular weight (g/gmol | g/gmol) *AC identifies the acentric factor (dimensionless) *PCRIT identifies the critical pressure (atm | atm) *VCRIT identifies the critical volume (m3/k-mol | m3/k-mol) *TCRIT identifies the critical temperature (deg K | deg K) *ZCRIT identifies the critical compressibility factor (dimensionless) *PCHOR identifies the parachor (dimensionless) *HCFLAG identifies whether the user component is a hydrocarbon component (see below)

ZDEPTH.long description: *ZDEPTH indicates the variation of composition with depth.

ZGAS.description: Oil Zone and Gas Cap Compositions (Conditional)
ZGAS.long description: *ZOIL introduces input of oil zone compositions (one composition vector for each initialization region in the reservoir). *ZGAS introduces input of gas cap compositions.

ZGLOBAL.long description: All of these keywords are required for the *USER_INPUT initialization method. *PRES indicates the input of reservoir pressures (kPa | psi). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction). *ZGLOBALC indicates input of initial grid block global composition on a component-by-component basis. *ZGLOBAL indicates input of initial grid block global composition. The entered numbers will be normalized to sum to unity internally. *ZGLOBALC is preferred. *ZGLOBAL or *ZGLOBALC may also be used with *BLOCK_CENTER as well as *DEPTH_AVE initializations.

ZGLOBALC.long description: All of these keywords are required for the *USER_INPUT initialization method. *PRES indicates the input of reservoir pressures (kPa | psi). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction). *ZGLOBALC indicates input of initial grid block global composition on a component-by-component basis. *ZGLOBAL indicates input of initial grid block global composition. The entered numbers will be normalized to sum to unity internally. *ZGLOBALC is preferred. *ZGLOBAL or *ZGLOBALC may also be used with *BLOCK_CENTER as well as *DEPTH_AVE initializations.

ZOIL.description: Oil Zone and Gas Cap Compositions (Conditional)
ZOIL.long description: *ZOIL introduces input of oil zone compositions (one composition vector for each initialization region in the reservoir). *ZGAS introduces input of gas cap compositions.

3PTSCALING.long description: Enabling the three-point scaling options for saturation endpoints.

3PTSCALING_KRG.long description: Enabling the three-point scaling options for saturation endpoints.

3PTSCALING_KROW.long description: Enabling the three-point scaling options for saturation endpoints.

3PTSCALING_KRW.long description: Enabling the three-point scaling options for saturation endpoints.

ACT-DEFAULT.long description: Set global default remedial action on violation of well operating constraints.

ADGCSTV.long description: These keywords specify the Langmuir Isotherm parameters used to model the adsorption/desorption of gas to/from rock. This feature can be used to model simple adsorption effects in shale gas and CBM problems.

ADGMAXV.long description: These keywords specify the Langmuir Isotherm parameters used to model the adsorption/desorption of gas to/from rock. This feature can be used to model simple adsorption effects in shale gas and CBM problems.

ADGPCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the Langmuir Isotherm parameters used to model the adsorption/desorption of gas to/from rock. This feature can be used to model simple adsorption effects in shale gas and CBM problems.

ADS_WATERZONE.description: Gas Adsorption for Water Filled Blocks (Optional)
ADS_WATERZONE.long description: *ADS_WATERZONE determines whether the grid block gas saturation is to be used in the equation calculating the amount of adsorbed onto reservoir rock at a particular pressure. Adsorption is modeled using equations based on the Langmuir model (See *ADGMAXV).

AIM.long description: *AIM controls the adaptive implicit switching option.

AIMSET.description: Setting Grid Blocks to Implicit or Explicit (Optional)
AIMSET.long description: *AIMSET initializes grid blocks to implicit or explicit formulations.

AIMWELL.description: Setting Well Blocks and Neighbours to Implicit (Optional)
AIMWELL.long description: *AIMWELL is used to set blocks near wells to an implicit formulation.

ALL.description: Values that Vary for Most or All Grid Blocks
ALL.long description: *ALL is used to indicate that values vary in most or all the grid blocks. The number of values expected is the number of grid blocks in the grid, including all null or zero-porosity blocks.

ALLELEM.description: Assigning Grid Properties to All Elements
ALLELEM.long description: Assign data to all elements of grid blocks.

ALTER.description: Alter Primary Well Operating Constraint Value (Optional)
ALTER.long description: *ALTER allows modification of only the primary operating constraint value specified wells. The primary operating constraint is the FIRST constraint entered for the well using the *OPERATE keyword.

ALTER-HIST.description: Alter Observed Flow Rates for History-Matching (Optional)
ALTER-HIST.long description: *ALTER-HIST allows modification of the observed flow rates for wells running in the special history-matching mode.

AMG-COARSEN.long description: *AMG-COARSEN selects the aggressiveness of the coarsening process used during the AMG setup phase for solver *PARASOL under *COMBINATIVE mode.

AMG-EPS.long description: *AMG-EPS is the residual threshold stopping criterion used by AMG.

AMG-ITERMAX.long description: *AMG-ITERMAX specifies the maximum number of AMG cycles to be performed per solver iteration.

AMG-KRYLOV.long description: *AMG-KRYLOV specifies the accelerator (Krylov method) of multiple AMG cycles.

AMG-SETUP-FREQ.long description: *AMG-SETUP-FREQ selects the frequency of a full setup of AMG for solver *PARASOL under *COMBINATIVE mode.

AMG-SMOOTHER.long description: *AMG-SMOOTHER defines the number and type of smoothing sweeps used for AMG.

API.long description: *API indicates input of initial light oil volume fraction at surface conditions (fraction).

APIGRAD.description: Oil PVT Tables for API Model (Optional)
APIGRAD.long description: *APIGRAD indicates the start of an oil *PVT table. The first *APIGRAD card for a PVT region must follow immediately after the *PVTAPI table for that region. The stc_oil_dens of the first *APIGRAD table in a PVT region is the density of the heavy oil component. The stc_oil_dens of the last *APIGRAD table in a PVT region is the density of the light component.

APIMINSO.description: Specification of Minimum Initial Oil Saturation for API Tracking (Optional)
APIMINSO.long description: *APIMINSO allows the user to alter the default minimum oil saturation in each block for the API tracking option when using *DEPTH_AVE initialization.

APIT.description: Initial Light Oil API Volume Fraction vs. Depth (Conditional)
APIT.long description: *APIT indicates the input of Initial light oil volume fraction (Surface Conditions) in tabular format as a function of depth (fraction).

APIVISO.description: Oil PVT Tables for API Model (Optional)
APIVISO.long description: *APIGRAD indicates the start of an oil *PVT table. The first *APIGRAD card for a PVT region must follow immediately after the *PVTAPI table for that region. The stc_oil_dens of the first *APIGRAD table in a PVT region is the density of the heavy oil component. The stc_oil_dens of the last *APIGRAD table in a PVT region is the density of the light component.

APPOR-METHOD.description: Apportionment Method for Meeting Group Targets (Optional)
APPOR-METHOD.long description: Specify the apportionment method that distributes the production or injection rates among contributing wells or groups to meet group targets defined by *GCONP or *GCONI.

AQCOMP.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQFLUX.description: Aquifer Boundary Flux or Aquifer Boundary Pressure (Conditional)
AQFLUX.long description: Define aquifer boundary flux or aquifer boundary pressure vs. time in table form.

AQFUNC.long description: *AQFUNC indicates input of a dimensionless pressure influence function as a table.

AQFUNC-EXT.long description: Specify the dimensionless time at which the analytical extrapolation starts for the internal pressure influence function.

AQLEAK.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQMETHOD.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPINIT.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPRES.description: Aquifer Boundary Flux or Aquifer Boundary Pressure (Conditional)
AQPRES.long description: Define aquifer boundary flux or aquifer boundary pressure vs. time in table form.

AQPROP.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQPROP-FET.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQSALT.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQUIFER.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AQVISC.long description: Define aquifer model for reservoir boundary water influx calculations.

AREALPINCH-TOL.long description: *AREALPINCH-TOL controls the minimal block size in I and J directions required to initiate an automatic areal pinched-out connection.

AUTODRILL.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

AUTOTUNE.long description: Enables adaptive algorithms for time-step size selection and adjusts numerical parameters to improve the numerical performance.

BACKTO.long description: Restore the overall behavior of simulations prior to a released version (inclusive).

BBTENSH.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

BCDOMAIN.long description: Specify pressure boundary between geomechanics and non-geomechanics grid domains.

BCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

BEGIN_DFN.long description: *BEGIN_DFN allows the input of discrete fracture network data to be modelled explicitly in reservoir simulation.

BG.long description: *BG assigns values or tasks to a group of blocks.

BGUST.description: Condensate Model - Undersaturated Eg, Bg, Zg Table
BGUST.long description: *EGUST, *BGUST or *ZGUST indicates the input of a gas expansion factor, gas formation volume factor or gas super compressibility table for condensate undersaturated gas.

BHPDEFAULT.long description: Assign default bottom-hole pressure constraint values for wells.

BHPDEPTH.description: User-Specified Reference Depth for Well BHP (Optional)
BHPDEPTH.long description: Specify a well’s reference depth (location of bottom hole pressure) that is different from the depth of the well’s reference layer. See also *BHPGRAD.

BHPGRAD.description: User-Specified Pressure Gradient For Reference Depth for Well BHP (Optional)
BHPGRAD.long description: Specify a pressure gradient to compute the pressure difference between a well’s reference completion and its reference depth. See also *BHPDEPTH.

BHPHEADINIT.description: Simultaneous BHP and Well Head Iteration (Optional)
BHPHEADINIT.long description: *BHPHEADINIT specifies that certain wells are to have the bottom-hole pressure set to meet the well's rate or WHP target and simultaneously have the wellbore pressure differences between completions (heads) computed iteratively to achieve consistency between completion pressures and the computed heads. See also keyword *HEADITER. It is recommended that the default *WELLINIT *ITER option is used when specifying *BHPHEADINIT *COMBINED.

BINARY_DATA.long description: Keyword to indicate that grid-array data is stored in binary or simulation input (SIP) compressed form.

BIOTSCOEF.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

BIOTSCOEFI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BIOTSCOEFJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BIOTSCOEFK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

BKRGCL.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKRGRL.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKROCRW.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKROCW.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKROGCG.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKROGCRG.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKRWIRO.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BKRWRO.long description: Specify endpoint values of the relative permeabilities for each grid.

BLOCKDFL.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

BLOCKS.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

BOT.description: Bo Above the Bubble Point as a Function of Pressure (Optional)
BOT.long description: *BOT indicates the input of an Bo table that is a function of both pressure (P) and bubble point pressure (Pb).

BOTAPI.description: Bo above the Bubble Point as a Function of Pressure and STC Oil Density for API Tracking (Optional)
BOTAPI.long description: *BOTAPI indicates the input of a Bo table that is a function of pressure (P), bubble point pressure (Pb) and STC oil density in an API tracking model.

BRANCH.long description: *BRANCH defines the original points in a branch, which can later be extended using *BR-EXTEND.

BSGCON.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSGCRIT.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSIZE.long description: Specify the method for calculation of corner-point grid block size.

BSLCON.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSOIRG.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSOIRW.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSORG.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSORW.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSWCON.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BSWCRIT.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

BWI.long description: *BWI indicates the input of the water formation volume factor (for a PVT region). *CW indicates the input of water compressibility (for a PVT region). *REFPW indicates the input of reference pressure (for a PVT region).

CACHE_ALIGN.long description: *CACHE_ALIGN enables or disables cache alignment for parallel processing runs.

CALIB_POR.long description: Improve accuracy of porosity coupling option *GCOUPLING 2.

CASEID.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

CCPOR.long description: *CCPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility value that will be used in a *CROCKTYPE region of the reservoir defined on the *CTYPE card. *CPRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the corresponding rock compressibility under the keyword *CCPOR.

CEFF-STRESS.long description: These keywords define the mean total stress table.

CHECKONLY.long description: *CHECKONLY indicates that the well data is to be checked for format errors, but the simulation will not be run. Also, please note that on the command line "-checkonly" enables this option without requiring the *CHECKONLY Card. In addition using the command line version of checkonly disables License Management for the "CHECKONLY" run. This allows the user to run a model and check data simultaneously using a single IMEX License.

CHECKRB.long description: Choose when to abandon using Red-Black Ordering for a PARASOL class (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

CKNJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CKSJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CKSPACING.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CLUMPSETTING.long description: Assign a control setting or flow restriction parameter to the named control lumps. The flow restriction parameter is used as a multiplication factor in adjusting the value of the well index for all the layers belonging to a given control lump.

CO.long description: *CO indicates input of oil compressibility (for a PVT region). (Alternate method for inputting oil compressibility)

COHESEXPNT.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

COHESHARD.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

COHESION.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

COHESIONMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

COMB-DRS.long description: *COMB-DRS selects the dynamic row-sum preconditioner for the solver *PARASOL in *COMBINATIVE mode.

COMBINATIVE.long description: *COMBINATIVE selects combinative 2-stage preconditioning for parallel solver *PARASOL. (In order to use this option, a special licensing feature must be active).

COMMENT.long description: *COMMENT changes the two character sequence that denotes the beginning of a comment.

CON.long description: *CON indicates that a constant value is entered for all array elements. The value may be entered on the same line or the next line.

CONTACT_PBT_BEHAVIOR.description: Specification of Initialization Behavior when Contacts Lie Outside PBT Table Depths
CONTACT_PBT_BEHAVIOR.long description: *CONTACT_PBT_BEHAVIOR controls how the simulator handles the situation when an initialization region's WOC or GOC is outside of the depth range specified by the upper and lower depths of an initialization region's *PBT table.

CONVERGE.long description: *CONVERGE is used to specify the convergence criteria for Newton's Method when solving the non-linear conservation equations in the simulator.

CONVERT-TO-CORNER-POINT.description: Convert Cartesian Grid to Corner Point (Optional)
CONVERT-TO-CORNER-POINT.long description: Internally convert a Cartesian grid type to corner point type.

COORD.description: Line-Based Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
COORD.long description: *COORD signals input of an array of "x"- and "y"- coordinate corner point location information for corner point grids.

CORNERS.description: Complete Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
CORNERS.long description: *CORNERS signals input of a complete array of corner point locations for corner point grids.

CORNER-TOL.long description: *CORNER-TOL controls the minimal spacing required to separate corner points. *CORNER-TOL  cptol *PARTOL-TOL  partol

COT.description: Oil Compressibility as a Function of Pressure (Optional)
COT.long description: *COT indicates the input of an oil compressibility table that is a function of both pressure (P) and bubble point pressure (Pb).

COVB-STRESS.description: Overburden Table and Effective Overburden Pressure (Optional)
COVB-STRESS.long description: *COVBTAB defines the rock overburden pressure as a function of depth, and switches the definition of pressure columns in the compaction / dilation tables. *COVB-STRESS directs the first column in compaction / dilation tables to be interpreted as entries of effective overburden pressures.

COVBTAB.description: Overburden Table and Effective Overburden Pressure (Optional)
COVBTAB.long description: *COVBTAB defines the rock overburden pressure as a function of depth, and switches the definition of pressure columns in the compaction / dilation tables. *COVB-STRESS directs the first column in compaction / dilation tables to be interpreted as entries of effective overburden pressures.

CP-FLUID.long description: *CP-FLUID indicates the start of the fluid mass specific heat table.

CPOR.long description: *CPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility. *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility. *TRPOR signals the input of reference temperature for the rock thermal expansion. *CTPOR signals the input of rock thermal expansion coefficient.

CP-ROCK.long description: To define the thermal rock heat capacity and the total heat conductivity.

CPRPOR.long description: *CCPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility value that will be used in a *CROCKTYPE region of the reservoir defined on the *CTYPE card. *CPRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the corresponding rock compressibility under the keyword *CCPOR.

CRAKSET.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CRAKTYPE.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

CRNCON_24N.description: Use 24N Representation for Corner Point Grid (Conditional)
CRNCON_24N.long description: *CRNCON_24N signals a request for treating corner point grid into a 24N system internally instead of the default node-based representation.

CROCKTAB.long description: *CROCKTAB defines the main compaction path (mandatory). *CROCKTABH defines the hysteresis path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX or *CROCKTABT defines the second compaction dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively.

CROCKTABC.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABD.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABE.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABH.long description: *CROCKTAB defines the main compaction path (mandatory). *CROCKTABH defines the hysteresis path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX or *CROCKTABT defines the second compaction dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively.

CROCKTABR.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABS.long description: These keywords define the mean total stress table.

CROCKTABT.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABU.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABW.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTABX.long description: *CROCKTABE defines the main elastic path (mandatory). *CROCKTABD defines the main plastic/dilation path. *CROCKTABU defines the unloading path(s). *CROCKTABC defines the recompaction path(s). *CROCKTABR defines the reloading path(s). *CROCKTABW, *CROCKTABX, or *CROCKTABT defines the second dilation dependency on incremental water saturation, cumulative water flux or temperature, respectively. Please refer to the full details under *CROCKTAB.

CROCKTYPE.long description: This keyword is used when more than a single rock type is assigned in different regions of a reservoir or when a table of porosity and permeability multipliers vs. pressure is required.

CRTSEMILOG.description: Semi-Logarithmic Treatment of Rock Compaction-Dilation Tables (Optional)
CRTSEMILOG.long description: The *CRTSEMILOG keyword directs pre-processing of compaction-dilation tables semi-logarithmically in the corresponding *CROCKTYPE's present in the data file.

CTPOR.long description: *CPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility. *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility. *TRPOR signals the input of reference temperature for the rock thermal expansion. *CTPOR signals the input of rock thermal expansion coefficient.

CTYPE.long description: *CTYPE assigns compressibility/compaction/dilation rock types to reservoir grid blocks.

CVFANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

CVO.long description: *CVO signals the input of the pressure dependence of oil viscosity (for a PVT region).

CVW.long description: *VWI signals the input of water viscosity (for a PVT region). *CVW signals the input of cvw (for a PVT region).

CW.long description: *BWI indicates the input of the water formation volume factor (for a PVT region). *CW indicates the input of water compressibility (for a PVT region). *REFPW indicates the input of reference pressure (for a PVT region).

CYCPRT_END.description: Select Cycling Group Cycle Part to Start and End Cycling Group Control (Optional)
CYCPRT_END.long description: Select the cycle starting part and the cycle ending part.

CYCPRT_START.description: Select Cycling Group Cycle Part to Start and End Cycling Group Control (Optional)
CYCPRT_START.long description: Select the cycle starting part and the cycle ending part.

DAMP_PCGW_TRGAS.description: Reduced Vertical Extent of Capillary Pressure Cycle in Hysteresis (Conditional)
DAMP_PCGW_TRGAS.long description: Allows linear reduction of the height of the capillary pressure, Pcow, Pcog or Pcgw cycles when the reversal point of drainage approaches the critical saturation of the trapping phase so as to make a "damped" hysteresis cycle.

DAMP_PCOG_TRGAS.description: Reduced Vertical Extent of Capillary Pressure Cycle in Hysteresis (Conditional)
DAMP_PCOG_TRGAS.long description: Allows linear reduction of the height of the capillary pressure, Pcow, Pcog or Pcgw cycles when the reversal point of drainage approaches the critical saturation of the trapping phase so as to make a "damped" hysteresis cycle.

DAMP_PCOW_TROIL.description: Reduced Vertical Extent of Capillary Pressure Cycle in Hysteresis (Conditional)
DAMP_PCOW_TROIL.long description: Allows linear reduction of the height of the capillary pressure, Pcow, Pcog or Pcgw cycles when the reversal point of drainage approaches the critical saturation of the trapping phase so as to make a "damped" hysteresis cycle.

DATE.long description: *DATE indicates that the well change will occur at a specified date.

DATUMDEPTH.long description: *DATUMDEPTH specifies the datum depth for pressure printout corrected to datum for each initialization region. A *DATUMDEPTH keyword should be entered for each initialization region. The first *DATUMDEPTH applies to initialization region 1, the second to initialization region 2 …and so on.

DCPOR.long description: *CPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility. *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility. *TRPOR signals the input of reference temperature for the rock thermal expansion. *CTPOR signals the input of rock thermal expansion coefficient.

DEBUG.long description: Identify what debug information is written to the output file.

DENSEAWAT.long description: Stock tank density table for seawater (brine) as a function of salt concentration.

DENSITY.long description: *DENSITY indicates the input of a density (for a PVT region). *GRAVITY indicates the input of a gravity (for a PVT region).

DEPLETION.description: Depletion Option in Rock Compaction-DILATION Model (Optional)
DEPLETION.long description: The *DEPLETION option makes the input reference porosity (*POR) the actual input porosity and makes the porosity a function of pressure depletion rather than pressure.

DEPTH.long description: *DEPTH indicates input of a reservoir depth for a single grid block.

DEPTH-TOP.long description: *DEPTH-TOP indicates input of depths to the top of each grid block in the reservoir.

DFRICANGLE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

DGOC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil or Water-Gas Contact (Conditional)
DGOC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DHS-PDMETHOD.long description: *DHS-PDMETHOD specifies a pressure drop method for down-hole separators (DHS); i.e., the pressure drop between the inlet and all outlets.

DHS-TABLE.long description: *DHS-TABLE specifies a separation table for downhole separators.

DI.long description: *DI assigns grid block sizes in the I direction. For radial grid type, this is in the radial direction.

DIFLIB.description: Oil and Gas Differential Liberation Table (Optional)
DIFLIB.long description: *DIFLIB indicates start of the oil and gas differential liberation table.

DIFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DILANGLE.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

DILFACTOR.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

DIM.long description: Specify a dimensioning variable with a value.

DIM_DEPTH_TABLE.long description: *DIM_DEPTH_TABLE specifies how many points to use when creating a properties vs. depth table during *VERTICAL *DEPTH_AVE initialization where the depth table is generated to provide the profiles of pressure, phase densities and capillary pressures, etc. versus depth.

DIP.long description: *DIP specifies the input of dip angles.

DISPI.long description: Input of polymer dispersion coefficients for the I, J and K directions.

DISPJ.long description: Input of polymer dispersion coefficients for the I, J and K directions.

DISPK.long description: Input of polymer dispersion coefficients for the I, J and K directions.

DISPLACTOL.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

DISTORTED-BLOCK.long description: *DISTORTED-BLOCK specifies the action when block geometry is invalid.

DJ.long description: *DJ assigns grid block sizes in the J direction. For radial grid type this is in the angular direction.

DJFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DK.long description: *DK assigns grid block sizes in the K direction. For radial grid type this is in the axial direction.

DKFRAC.long description: *DIFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the I direction. *DJFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the J direction. *DKFRAC indicates the input of fracture spacing in the K direction.

DLOADBC.long description: Specify distributed loads along an edge of a finite element.

DLOADBC2D.long description: Specify distributed loads along an edge of a finite element.

DLOADBC3D.long description: Specify distributed load on a surface of a 3D finite element.

DLOADIJK.long description: Specify distributed load on a surface of a 3D finite element.

DPBDT.description: Maximum Rate of Increase of Solution Gas Ratio or Bubble Point Pressure (Optional)
DPBDT.long description: *DRSDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of solution gas ratio (for a PVT region). *DPBDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of bubble point pressure (for a PVT region). *DRSDT and *DPBDT limits are not applied to reductions of solution gas ratio or bubble point pressure (respectively).

DPDWDT.description: Maximum Rate of Increase of Oil Content or Dew Point Pressure (Optional)
DPDWDT.long description: *DRVDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of oil content (for a PVT region). *DPDWDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of dew point pressure (for a PVT region). *DRVDT and *DPDWDT limits are not applied to reductions of oil content or dew point pressure (respectively).

DPLANES.long description: Enable parallel equation and residual (Jacobian) building using domain decomposition.

DRCTABLE.long description: Stress-dependent dilation-recompaction table lookup is used to determine permeability multipliers or transmissibility multipliers.

DRILLMXW.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLMXW.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRILLQ.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLQ.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRILLT.description: Priority List for Automatic Drilling of Wells (Optional)
DRILLT.long description: *DRILLQ selects the algorithm for automatic opening of wells or the specification of the order of automatic drilling of wells. *DRILLT specifies a time delay between successive well drilling operations. *DRILLMXW specifies the maximum number of wells drilled simultaneously.

DRSDT.description: Maximum Rate of Increase of Solution Gas Ratio or Bubble Point Pressure (Optional)
DRSDT.long description: *DRSDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of solution gas ratio (for a PVT region). *DPBDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of bubble point pressure (for a PVT region). *DRSDT and *DPBDT limits are not applied to reductions of solution gas ratio or bubble point pressure (respectively).

DRVDT.description: Maximum Rate of Increase of Oil Content or Dew Point Pressure (Optional)
DRVDT.long description: *DRVDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of oil content (for a PVT region). *DPDWDT signals the input of the maximum rate of increase of dew point pressure (for a PVT region). *DRVDT and *DPDWDT limits are not applied to reductions of oil content or dew point pressure (respectively).

DTMAX.long description: *DTMAX identifies the maximum time-step size. *DTMIN identifies the minimum time-step size.

DTMIN.long description: *DTMAX identifies the maximum time-step size. *DTMIN identifies the minimum time-step size.

DTOP.description: Depth to the Tops of Grid Blocks (Conditional)
DTOP.long description: *DTOP specifies depth to the centre of the top face of each grid block in the top layer of the grid.

DTWAUTO.long description: *DTWELL identifies the first time-step size to be used immediately after the current well change. *DTWAUTO specifies how this time-step size is to be reinstated at any simulation time step in response to a significant well action.

DTWELL.long description: *DTWELL identifies the first time-step size to be used immediately after the current well change. *DTWAUTO specifies how this time-step size is to be reinstated at any simulation time step in response to a significant well action.

DTYPE.long description: Enable parallel equation and residual (Jacobian) building using domain decomposition.

DUALPERM.long description: *DUALPERM enables the dual permeability option (dual porosity augmented with inter-block matrix flow).

DUALPOR.long description: *DUALPOR indicates the use of the dual porosity option.

DWGC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil or Water-Gas Contact (Conditional)
DWGC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DWGC_MAP.description: Depth Map of Water-Oil or Water-Gas Contact (Optional)
DWGC_MAP.long description: The *DWOC_MAP and *DWGC_MAP keywords define the water contact distribution of the entire reservoir. These keywords can be used to model reservoirs with tilted water contact. Please also see the tutorial ‘Simulating a Tilted Water-Oil/Water-Gas Contact’.

DWNHSEP.long description: *DWNHSEP specifies the properties of a downhole separator. A separator has an inlet tubing string and three outlet tubing strings which take separated fluid either to the surface (possibly through a pump or compressor) or through a pump or compressor and a packer to reinjection perforations.

DWOC.description: Depth to Water-Oil, Gas-Oil or Water-Gas Contact (Conditional)
DWOC.long description: *DWOC indicates input of water-oil contact depth. *DGOC indicates input of gas-oil contact depth. *DWGC indicates input of water-gas contact depth.

DWOC_MAP.description: Depth Map of Water-Oil or Water-Gas Contact (Optional)
DWOC_MAP.long description: The *DWOC_MAP and *DWGC_MAP keywords define the water contact distribution of the entire reservoir. These keywords can be used to model reservoirs with tilted water contact. Please also see the tutorial ‘Simulating a Tilted Water-Oil/Water-Gas Contact’.

DYNAGRID.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-IGN-DIR.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-TINT.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-TSINT.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-WLN-A.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

DYNAGRID-WLN-V.long description: Create or remove amalgamated grid cells and refinements statically, dynamically under simulator control or as a preconditioning step.

ECOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

EGUST.description: Condensate Model - Undersaturated Eg, Bg, Zg Table
EGUST.long description: *EGUST, *BGUST or *ZGUST indicates the input of a gas expansion factor, gas formation volume factor or gas super compressibility table for condensate undersaturated gas.

ELASTMOD.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

ELASTMODI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

ELASTMODJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

ELASTMODK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

END_TRIGGER.description: Allow for a Set of Keywords to be Processed When a Specified Condition (Trigger) is Satisfied (Optional)
END_TRIGGER.long description: Specify certain actions which are implemented when one or more specific conditions are satisfied during the simulation.

EPSCUTOFF.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

EPSPC.long description: These keywords signal entry of the hysteresis parameters. *EPSPC Denotes the entry of epspc. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-water capillary pressure. *EPSPCG Denotes the entry of epspcg. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-gas capillary pressure.

EPSPCG.long description: These keywords signal entry of the hysteresis parameters. *EPSPC Denotes the entry of epspc. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-water capillary pressure. *EPSPCG Denotes the entry of epspcg. This determines the transition between the imbibition and drainage curves for oil-gas capillary pressure.

EQUALSI.description: J and K Direction Data from I Direction
EQUALSI.long description: *EQUALSI indicates that values in the J and K directions are the same as those in the I direction, or that the values given for the I direction may be modified by division, multiplication, etc.

EQUILIBRATE.long description: *MODELSHUT allows fluid equilibration in a shut-in well via crossflow between layers.

EXPN1.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

EXPN2.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FAULT.long description: *FAULT indicates the input of designations for grid blocks whose flow connections are to take into account their exact position in the reservoir with respect to their lateral neighbours. Each *FAULT keyword is expected to describe a group of grid blocks that together form a geological fault block.

FAULTARRAY.long description: *FAULTARRAY signals the input of an array of binary flags which controls whether individual block faces are connected using standard connections or fault connections.

FGMRES.long description: *FGMRES selects the flexible variant of the Generalized Minimum Residual method (GMRES) acceleration for *PARASOL.

FI_ALIGN.long description: *FI_ALIGN is used to enable or disable fully implicit alignment.

FILENAME.long description: Specify names for input and output files.

FILENAMES.long description: Specify names for input and output files.

FLUX_ISECTOR.long description: Specify flux sectors via sector number and grid array.

FLUX_SECTORNAMES.long description: Specify flux sectors via sector number and grid array.

FLXB-ACTIVE.long description: Specify the active flux boundaries for the reduced run.

FLXB-DEF.long description: Specify flux boundaries via flux boundary names, numbers and assign to grid array.

FLXB-IN.long description: *FLXB-OUT specifies the name of flux boundary output file in the full-field run. *FLXB-IN specifies the name of flux boundary input file in the reduced run.

FLXB-NAMES.long description: Specify flux boundaries via flux boundary names, numbers and assign to grid array.

FLXB-OUT.long description: *FLXB-OUT specifies the name of flux boundary output file in the full-field run. *FLXB-IN specifies the name of flux boundary input file in the reduced run.

FLXB-TYPE.long description: Specify boundary condition type for the flux boundary file generated by the full-field run.

FORCE_MAXCHK.long description: *FORCE_MAXCHK is used to override the default maximum change timestep repeating strategy.

FORCETOL.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

FRACANGLE.long description: Specify direction of fracture when the fracture permeability option *GPERMBB is used.

FRACTURE.long description: *FRACTURE is used immediately after a grid property keyword in a dual porosity system to indicate that a fracture property is being input.

FRANGSOFT.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

FRATIO.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FRICANGLE.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

FRICANGMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

FRICANGMN.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FRICANGMX.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FRICHARDEN.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

FRWIDTHCOR.description: Fracture Velocity Width Correction for Polymer-Water Mixture Viscosity (Optional)
FRWIDTHCOR.long description: Allows the input of block by block correction factors for the modification of the velocity used to interpolate in the *PMIX *VELTABLE table or other polymer shearing model.

FYOUNGAF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

FZ.long description: *FZ and *NFZ specify assignment of an input property to a type of fracture zone.

GAMMA.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GAPPOR.long description: Specify the method of apportioning a group target among contributing wells or subgroups. Currently *AUTODRILL is the only method supported.

GASTRAP.long description: These keywords assign the oil trapping relationship in oil-water system or gas trapping relationship in liquid-gas or gas-water system. The relationship determines the residual saturation of imbibition of the trapping phase from its historically-maximum-attained saturation.

GASZONE.description: Specification of Method for Computing Oil Saturations in Gas Zone
GASZONE.long description: *GASZONE specifies whether a residual oil saturation is to be set initially in the uppermost part of the reservoir where the difference in the oil and gas phase pressures exceed the largest tabulated value the oil-gas capillary pressure. This keyword is exactly equivalent to the previous *GASCAP, which is no longer accepted by IMEX.

GAUSSPNT.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

GBCPFACT.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GBCUFACT.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GCAPD.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPLOC.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMAT.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMOD.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPMODEL.long description: Using cap model for an elasto-plastic constitutive model.

GCAPR.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPTEN.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCAPW.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCINCRMT.long description: Define coefficients for a cap model #1 as described in keyword *GCAPMODEL.

GCIOFF.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCIOFF.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCION.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCION.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCON-AQUIFER.long description: Include total aquifer influx in group controls for maintaining field or sector pressure.

GCONCYCLE.description: Allow Group Cycling to be Turned On/Off (Optional)
GCONCYCLE.long description: Turn on or off group cycling control specified earlier with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONCYCLE_END.description: Allow a Cycling Group to be Defined (Optional)
GCONCYCLE_END.long description: Specify data for EOR/IOR processes which rely on alternating production and/or injection cycles. Generally multiple cycles are required and each cycle consists of a number of well-defined parts. Examples include water alternating gas injection (WAG) and cyclic steam injection. A number of criteria are available to control the duration of each cycle part.

GCONCYCLE_START.description: Allow a Cycling Group to be Defined (Optional)
GCONCYCLE_START.long description: Specify data for EOR/IOR processes which rely on alternating production and/or injection cycles. Generally multiple cycles are required and each cycle consists of a number of well-defined parts. Examples include water alternating gas injection (WAG) and cyclic steam injection. A number of criteria are available to control the duration of each cycle part.

GCONCYCR_END.description: Allow Cycling Group Data to be Revised (Optional)
GCONCYCR_END.long description: Revise data specified earlier in the simulation with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONCYCR_START.description: Allow Cycling Group Data to be Revised (Optional)
GCONCYCR_START.long description: Revise data specified earlier in the simulation with *GCONCYCLE_START.

GCONI.long description: *GCONI is used to specify group injection controls.

GCONIINCR.description: Group Injection Constraint Multipliers or Increments (Optional)
GCONIINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group injection target.

GCONIMULT.description: Group Injection Constraint Multipliers or Increments (Optional)
GCONIMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group injection target.

GCONM.long description: Specify monitored group production constraints that can trigger closing of wells and individual completion layers. Production targets are met by using one of the available apportionment methods specified by *APPOR-METHOD.

GCONP.long description: *GCONP is used to specify group production controls.

GCONPINCR.description: Group Production Constraint Multiplier or Increment (Optional)
GCONPINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group production target.

GCONPMULT.description: Group Production Constraint Multiplier or Increment (Optional)
GCONPMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified group production target.

GCOORD.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GCORNERS.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GCOUPLING.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

GCPOFF.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCPOFF.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCPON.description: Flag for Specifying Groups or Wells under or not under Group Apportionment (Optional)
GCPON.long description: Specify whether particular groups or wells will or will not participate in the apportionment of higher-level group production or injection targets.

GCRITICAL.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GCUPDATE.long description: Specify at what frequency or times that coupling updates are done.

GDI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GDJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GDK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GELEVATB.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GELEVATT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GENPLAST.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

GEODEPTH.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GEODOMAIN.long description: Specify grid domains in which geomechanics calculations are performed.

GEOEXTD.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEOGRID.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GEOMETRY.long description: *GEOMETRY specifies well geometric characteristics used for calculating well index internally.

GEOPOSTFREQ.long description: Run Geomechanics in STARS in post-processing mode.

GEOPOSTPRO.long description: Run Geomechanics in STARS in post-processing mode.

GEORBLOCK.long description: Specify the reference block for stress gradient option.

GEXDI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXDJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXDK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMAXI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMAXJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.
