GEXMAXK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXMINK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is extended from host simulator’s grid.

GEXPONENTN.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GFUELFRAC.description: Fuel Consumption Fraction for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GFUELFRAC.long description: Specify a maximum fraction of a group’s surface gas production available for consumption as fuel, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GFUELMAXR.description: Maximum Fuel Consumption Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GFUELMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which the surface gas produced by a group is made available for consumption as fuel, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GJRC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GKRIGING.long description: Enable Kriging method for calculating unknown initial stresses when only few sampling points are avaiable.

GLCONTROL.long description: Specify gas lift controls for a given set of production wells.

GLIFT.long description: Specify lift gas rate for production wells, or specify the method by which the lift gas rate is calculated.

GLOADBC.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis.

GLOADBC3D.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis in 3D.

GLOPT.long description: Specify an option to optimize oil production by automatic allocation of lift gas.

GMCREEP.long description: Assign a creep constitutive model for a type of rock. Creep is defined as the time-dependent strain that happens in a material at constant stress.

GMKMAXR.description: Maximum Make-up Gas Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GMKMAXR.long description: Specify the maximum surface rate of make-up gas injected as part of a group gas recycling target to supplement the recycled fluid.

GMKUPTO.description: Gas Make-up Target for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GMKUPTO.long description: Specify a target of surface gas injection rate for each listed well group. The variable recycled gas will be supplemented by make-up gas to meet each group’s target, subject to other well constraints.

GMONETONE.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GNULL.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GOC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
GOC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, water-oil capillary pressure at the water-oil contact and gas-water capillary pressure at gas-water contact respectively. Values of *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC can be entered for each initialization region.

GOC_SW.description: Specification of Water Saturation Above GOC or Below WOC (Optional)
GOC_SW.long description: *GOC_SW and *WOC_SW allow the user to define the water saturation above the gas oil contact and below the water-oil contact for each initialization region.

GORINT.long description: *GORINT signals the input of initial gas-oil ratio.

GOUTSRF.long description: Enable independent graphics file (SR2) for geomechanics.

GPATM.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GPERMAX.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMCOEF.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMES.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMLC.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEX.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEX_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEY.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEY_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEZ.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNEZ_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTX.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTX_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTY.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTY_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTZ.long description: Specify fracture-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMNTZ_MT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMRES.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

GPERMTS.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPERMVL.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GPHYDDEP.description: Manifold Depth for Calculating Pressure Difference Between Manifold and Surface (Optional)
GPHYDDEP.long description: Specify the manifold depth, which scales the pressure drop linearly relative to the depth specified with the hydraulics table indicated by keyword *GPTABLE.

GPOLY.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GPRODGROUP.description: Gas Producing Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
GPRODGROUP.long description: Specify the group from which gas production rates will be taken to calculate a gas recycling injection target or a voidage replacement by gas target specified for another group or groups using the *GCONI keyword.

GPSCALING.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

GPTABLE.description: Specification of Hydraulics Tables for Calculating Pressure Difference Between Manifold and Surface (Optional)
GPTABLE.long description: Specify the group pressure table (defined by *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1) used to compute the pressure drop between manifold and surface.

GPTOLMUL.long description: Adjust pressure tolerance for computing porosity formulae given in keyword *GCOUPLING.

GRAVITY.long description: *DENSITY indicates the input of a density (for a PVT region). *GRAVITY indicates the input of a gravity (for a PVT region).

GRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GRECYMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which gas is re-injected under a group recycling target that was defined by keyword *GCONI.

GRGASTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GRID.long description: *GRID defines the type of fundamental (main) grid and marks the beginning of the reservoir description.

GRMPRSTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on effective mean stress or minimum principal effective stress.

GROCKTAB.long description: Stress-dependent dilation-recompaction table lookup is used to determine permeability multipliers or transmissibility multipliers.

GROILTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GROTATEI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROTATEJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROTATEK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GROUP.long description: *GROUP is used to identify gathering centres, groups and platforms. This keyword is useful for building a tree structure of groups.

GROUPALQ.long description: Specify the ALQ quantity in interpolations in a hydraulics table entered using the *PTUBE1 table format.

GRPORTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on porosity.

GRPRESTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid pore pressure.

GRSTRESTAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on effective mean stress or minimum principal effective stress.

GRTEMTAB.long description: Specify temperature dependence of geomechanical properties.

GRWATAB.long description: Specify formation geomechanical properties that depend on fluid saturation.

GSALESFRAC.description: Sales Rate Fraction for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GSALESFRAC.long description: Specify a maximum fraction of the surface gas produced by a group (less the amount consumed as fuel) that is available for sale, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GSALESMAXR.description: Maximum Sales Rate for Group Gas Recycling (Optional)
GSALESMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which the surface gas produced by a group is made available for sales, which reduces the amount of gas available for re-injection.

GTRANSLI.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GTRANSLJ.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GTRANSLK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GUIDEI.description: Guide Rates for Groups or Wells
GUIDEI.long description: Specify guide rates to distribute the production or injection rates among groups or wells, to meet the production or injection target.

GUIDEP.description: Guide Rates for Groups or Wells
GUIDEP.long description: Specify guide rates to distribute the production or injection rates among groups or wells, to meet the production or injection target.

GULBULKMOD.long description: Define coefficients for a nonlinear elastic constitutive model #1 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

GULOGINT.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

GXCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GYCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

GZCORN.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

HARDEN.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

HEADITER.long description: *HEADITER specifies that certain wells are to have the wellbore pressure differences between completions (heads) computed iteratively at the beginning of a timestep to achieve consistency between completion pressures and the computed heads. See also the manual page for the related keyword *BHPHEADINIT.

HEAD-METHOD.long description: *HEAD-METHOD is used to identify the head method to be used.

HEAT-LOSS.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define heat loss to the surrounding rock.

HF_IN_NULL.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

HLPROP.long description: These keywords are used in the thermal option to define heat loss to the surrounding rock.

HYDROFRAC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

HYSKRG.long description: This keyword denotes the hysteresis effect on the gas relative permeability is modelled and signals the entry of the hysteresis parameter in liquid-gas system or in gas-water reservoir.

HYSKRO.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of oil-water relative permeability Krow and signal the entry of associated parameters.

HYSKRW.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of water relative permeability in oil-water system or in gas-water reservoir and signal the entry of associated parameters.

IJK.long description: *IJK assigns a constant value of a grid property within the region defined by the minimum and maximum block number in each of the three directions.

IJPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

IKPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

INAC-WELL-SO.long description: Methods to reduce the frequency of solver pointer generation.

INCLUDE.long description: The *INCLUDE keyword indicates that reading of the primary input data set is suspended. Instead, a secondary file will be read.

INCOMP.description: Composition of Injected Water, Gas, and Oil Phases (Conditional)
INCOMP.long description: *INCOMP specifies the compositions of injected oil, water and gas phases.

INCOMPWL.long description: *INCOMPWL sets the global compositions of injected lift-gas for producers or injected streams for gas/solvent injectors used in the wellbore calculations. It can also be used to alter the polymer mass concentration and/or relative salt mass concentration for water injectors.

INITFANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

INITIAL.long description: *INITIAL indicates the beginning of initial condition values.

INJECTOR.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer or injector).

INJ-TEMP.long description: *INJ-TEMP specifies the bottom-hole temperature of injected fluid in the wells.

INT.long description: *INT indicates that the corresponding table entry should be filled by interpolation.

INTCOMP.long description: Define variable for interpolation among multiple relative permeability table sets for a given rock type.

INTERP_ENDS.long description: Specify the method for treating saturation endpoints when interpolating between curves as directed by keyword *KRINTRP.

INTERRUPT.long description: *INTERRUPT indicates that when the user interrupts the simulation run by simultaneously pressing the "CTRL-C" keys or by typing "kill -2" followed by the process identification number (PID), one of the following user specified actions can take place: Continue the simulation run. Finish the current timestep, write a restart record and stop the simulation. Flush buffers, close files and stop the simulation run immediately. Write an impromptu restart and continue. For PC only: Stop cold (immediately and unconditionally). Interactively, this action has to be requested with a Control-Break. Use of this keyword (1-3) prevents corruption of the result files when aborting a simulation run and optionally writes a restart record before stopping. It (4) also allows writing of an impromptu restart record.

INTPOWER.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

INUNIT.long description: *INUNIT specifies the input data units. *OUTUNIT specifies the output data units

ISECTOR.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize regional reservoir activity, via sector number and grid array.

ITERMAX.long description: Specify the maximum allowed number of linear solver iterations.

ITERMAXG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

ITUBE1.long description: *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 specifies a table of tubing-head (or outlet) pressure data tables for a production or injection well (or manifold group). The tabulated variable is the bottom-hole (or inlet) pressure, with tubing-head (or outlet) pressure and several independent variables such as surface rates or rate ratios. *PTUBE1 can also be used to input the well-head temperature table.

ITYPE.long description: *ITYPE introduces an array of integers specifying to which initialization region a given grid block or set of grid blocks belong. Any of the array-reading options may be used.

IVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the I Direction
IVAR.long description: *IVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the I direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

IWELLBORE.long description: *IWELLBORE specifies that surface to reservoir wellbore pressure drop will be computed for an injector, either from a tubing data model or a hydraulics table.

JACDOMS.long description: Enable parallel equation and residual (Jacobian) building using domain decomposition.

JACPAR.long description: Enable parallel equation and residual (Jacobian) building using domain decomposition.

JDUMPG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

JFGMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFGMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

JFUNC.long description: Activates the Leverett J Function option. This option allows the user to replace water-oil and/or oil-gas capillary pressures entered with Leverett J Functions. When the *GASWATER model or *GASWATER_WITH_CONDENSATE model is used, the entered water-gas capillary pressure is replaced by a water-gas J Function.

JFW_SHIFT.description: Water Oil-Capillary Pressure (J Function) Shift for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFW_SHIFT.long description: These keywords specify the amount that the Water-oil capillary pressure or water-oil J Function curve is shifted up or down. This keyword can be used to account for the effects of a tilted water-oil contact (See Simulating a Tilted Water-Oil/Water-Gas Contact in the Tutorial section).

JFWMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
JFWMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

JKPJ.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

JVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the J Direction
JVAR.long description: *JVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the J direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

KAVMF.description: Direct Input of Shape Factor and Transfer Permeability Arrays (Optional)
KAVMF.long description: Keywords *SIGMAMF and *KAVMF allow direct input of the block shape factor and average transfer permeability arrays, respectively, for each grid block to be used in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

KDIR.long description: *KDIR specifies the orientation of the grid’s K direction relative to gravity.

KILLOUGH_MOD_KRWCO.long description: Assign the hysteresis method of water relative permeability in oil-water system or in gas-water reservoir and signal the entry of associated parameters.

KRINTRP.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolating parameter.

KROIL.long description: *KROIL introduces subkeywords which indicate how Kro is evaluated. The options are: Stone's first model; Stone's second model as modified by Aziz and Settari; the linear isoperm method; and the segregated method. For Stone's models the Krow and Krog values may be looked up as functions either of Sw and Sg, respectively, or of 1 - So and 1 - Swcon - So.

KROMAX_STRICT.description: Ensure the Maximum Krow and Maximum Krog Equal (Optional)
KROMAX_STRICT.long description: This keyword is to ensure the maximum relative oil permeability in oil-water and oil-gas systems are equal in both table and block end-points.

KRPERF.description: Relative Permeability Data for Well Completions (Optional)
KRPERF.long description: *KRPERF specifies the relative permeability table set numbers and end points for individual well completions.

KRWEXTRAP.description: Extrapolation of Krw Outside of the SWT Table to 1.0 (Optional)
KRWEXTRAP.long description: This keyword enables the linear extrapolation of water relative permeability from the last water saturation in the oil-water table to a saturation of 1.0 and a value of Krw of 1.0.

KVAR.description: Array Input of Values that Vary in the K Direction
KVAR.long description: *KVAR is used to indicate values that vary in the K direction, but which are constant in the other two directions.

LAYERCLUMP.long description: Define a control lump, which is a set of layers (perforations, completions) with a name and computed rate, cumulative, and stream ratio values. To each control lump there is also an associated setting value.

LAYER-CTRL.long description: Modify layer status or well indices for individual completions.

LAYERGRAD.long description: Specify pressure gradients between adjacent completions within a wellbore. This keyword is useful to model pumped-off producing wells.

LAYERHFP.description: Data for Hydraulic Fracture Proxy (HFP) Model (Conditional)
LAYERHFP.long description: *LAYERHFP allows the user to supply geometric and non Darcy information specifying productivity indices which act as proxies for vertical fractures (assuming pseudo radial flow) on a layer by layer basis.

LAYERIJK.description: Simplified Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERIJK.long description: *LAYERIJK allows a simplified specification of a deviated wellbore by overriding the *GEOMETRY direction for each well completion layer.

LAYERLUMP_ACTR.description: Selection of Instantaneous Versus Actual Rates (Optional)
LAYERLUMP_ACTR.long description: Select actual or on-time averaged rates and ratios based on the rates in all calculations involving lumps. The alternative (default) is to use instantaneous rates in layer lump calculations.

LAYERRLUMP.long description: Define a report lump which is a set of well layers, where stream rates, cumulatives and production rate ratios are calculated and on which triggers can be based. A report lump is more flexible than a control lump (*LAYERCLUMP).

LAYERXYZ.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LAYERXYZ-METHOD.description: Geometric Data for Deviated Well Completions (Conditional)
LAYERXYZ-METHOD.long description: *LAYERXYZ allows the user to supply geometric information specifying deviated perforations - where the wellbore direction is not parallel to one of the local coordinate axes. *LAYERXYZ-METHOD allows the user to switch the interpolation schemes for radius and permeability calculation along the deviated wellbore.

LEASE.long description: *LEASE defines a lease plane which is used to summarize various regional flows.

LIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

MAGNIFYDI.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDJ.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MAGNIFYDK.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

MANIFOLD.description: Defining Group Production or Injection as Going Through a Manifold (Optional)
MANIFOLD.long description: Specify that group production or injection of a stream goes through a manifold, that is, the group’s wells have the same pressure at the upper end of the tubing.

MATINV.long description: Specify algorithms for block diagonal sub-matrix inversion.

MATRIX.long description: *MATRIX is used immediately after a grid property keyword to indicate that a matrix property is being input.

MAX_SUM.long description: *MAX_SUM turns on or off the max sum output.

MAXCHANGE.description: Normal Variation in Variables per Timestep (Optional)
MAXCHANGE.long description: *NORM identifies the typical changes in the basic variables over a timestep. *MAXCHANGE identifies whether a timestep is cut if the maximum change in pressure or saturation is greater than that specified by *MAXCHANGE.

MAXCLK.long description: Specify the maximum CPU seconds or elapsed seconds for the simulation run.

MAXCPU.long description: Specify the maximum CPU seconds or elapsed seconds for the simulation run.

MAXDATE.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MAXERROR.long description: *MAXERROR specifies the maximum number of error messages before the simulation terminates.

MAXSTEPS.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MAXTIME.long description: *MAXSTEPS is used to specify the maximum number of timesteps for the simulation run. *MAXTIME (*MAXDATE) is used to specify the maximum simulation time (date).

MCCMODEL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCETHA.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCHARDF.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOCR.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

MCOMINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCONNG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MCPREHD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCRCSL.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSIM.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MCSWINDX.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

MDICLU_PG.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MINC.long description: *MINC indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the multiple-interacting-continua (MINC) approach.

MINCYC.long description: *MINCYC is used to specify the minimum number of Newtonian cycles when using the *DRSDT, *DPBDT, *DRVDT, *DPDWDT options.

MINSS.long description: *MINSS signals input of minimum solvent saturation.

MOD.long description: *MOD indicates the modification of a cell-based grid array.

MODEL.long description: *MODEL signals the input of the fluid component model to use for the simulation.

MODELSHUT.long description: *MODELSHUT allows fluid equilibration in a shut-in well via crossflow between layers.

MONITOR.long description: Specify a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

MPLNE.long description: Over-ride default dimension estimates obtained from the preliminary data scan.

MRC-RESET.description: Resetting Well Operating Constraint after Value Change (Optional)
MRC-RESET.long description: Specify whether a well should be set to its Most Restrictive Constraint after a change in the value of an operating constraint via *OPERATE, *ALTER, or *TARGET.

MTS-BIOTCOEF.long description: Specify reservoir rock strength properties for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MTS-ELASTMOD.long description: Specify reservoir rock strength properties for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MTS-INITMES.long description: Specify reservoir rock initial mean total (or effective) stress for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MTS-INITMTS.long description: Specify reservoir rock initial mean total (or effective) stress for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MTS-LOADBC.long description: Defines input of array of surface loads for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MTS-POISSRATIO.long description: Specify reservoir rock strength properties for the mean total stress calculations in *CROCKTABS.

MXCNRPT.long description: Specifies maximum number of continue-repeats allowed in each timestep.

NB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NCOUPLING.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

NCUTS.long description: *NCUTS controls the number of time-step size cuts allowed in a single timestep.

NDARCYCOR.long description: Allows the input of block by block correction factors for the non-Darcy β factor calculated as described in the background section for the *NONDARCY keyword.

NE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NETGROSS.long description: *NETGROSS indicates input of an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NETPAY.long description: *NETPAY indicates input of an array of net pays which are to be converted internally to an array of net-to-gross multipliers.

NEWTONCYC.long description: *NEWTONCYC is used to specify the maximum number of Newtonian cycles.

NFZ.long description: *FZ and *NFZ specify assignment of an input property to a type of fracture zone.

NFZG-ALIGN.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

NINCS.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NITERGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NLINEAR.long description: Assign a nonlinear constitutive model for a type of rock.

NNODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOCOUPERM.long description: Control porosity and permeability coupling from deformation to fluid flow.

NODE4.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE8.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODE9.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

NODES.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEX.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEY.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NODEZ.long description: Specify the location and usage of each node of a corner point grid.

NOINTERMF.long description: *NOINTERMF indicates that the inter-block matrix-fracture connection will not be established when a fracture block is null but its collocated matrix block is non-null in a dual-continua model.

NOLIST.long description: *LIST specifies listing the input data file, from this point forward, to the output print file. *NOLIST specifies not listing the input data file to the output print file, starting immediately after the current line.

NOLISTLIM.description: Controlling Data File Listing Using NOLISTLIM (Optional)
NOLISTLIM.long description: *NOLISTLIM specifies that the default 20 lines of keyword echoing under the *LIST keyword be extended so that all values of the keyword are echoed regardless of the number of lines required to do so. This can create large files if used, but allows the user to view all of the data.

NONDARCY.long description: *NONDARCY signals the use of the non-Darcy reservoir flow option.

NORM.description: Normal Variation in Variables per Timestep (Optional)
NORM.long description: *NORM identifies the typical changes in the basic variables over a timestep. *MAXCHANGE identifies whether a timestep is cut if the maximum change in pressure or saturation is greater than that specified by *MAXCHANGE.

NORTH.long description: Specify the maximum number of orthogonalizations (GMRES steps) to be performed by the iterative solution method before resetting.

NORTHG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

NREGIONS.long description: *NREGIONS introduces the integer nreg which specifies the number of initialization regions into which the reservoir has been divided.

NTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NTCOMP_VAL.long description: Indicate interpolation set number along with its value of interpolating parameter.

NTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

NULL.long description: *NULL indicates the input of an array of null block indicators.

NULL-PERF.long description: *NULL-PERF specifies how perforations in inactive (null or pinched out) grid blocks are to be handled.

NUMERICAL.long description: *NUMERICAL identifies the beginning of all numerical methods control keywords.

NWHYFS.description: Set Number of Points for WHP Root Search (Optional)
NWHYFS.long description: *NWHYFS allows the user to set the number of points used to determine whether a value of the BHP exists which yields the target well head pressure (WHP). This number defaults to 9 and it is not anticipated that the user would normally alter this value. However in certain cases in which a well operating on an implicit WHP constraint suddenly shuts for no apparent reason, invoking *NWHYFS for the well with a value exceeding 9 (11 for example) may allow the well to continue. Larger values of this integer may cause run times to increase.

OILTRAP.long description: These keywords assign the oil trapping relationship in oil-water system or gas trapping relationship in liquid-gas or gas-water system. The relationship determines the residual saturation of imbibition of the trapping phase from its historically-maximum-attained saturation.

OILVISC-T.long description: *OILVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of oil viscosity. *WATVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of water viscosity. *VISC-REF specifies the reference conditions for the viscosity-temperature relationship.

OMEGA_OST.long description: *OMEGA_OST indicates the input of an extended Omega (oil-solvent mixing parameter) table. This table allows the user to define two separate types of Omega, one to be used in the oil-solvent density mixing rule (omega_den) and one to be used in the oil-solvent viscosity mixing rule (omega_vis). Sorm may also be altered in this table using the sormadd column. Finally, it is possible to use the *OMEGA_OST table to define tables that are functions of both pressure (P) and bubble point pressure (Pb).

OMEGA_PW.long description: Blank lines may be used to separate sections of a data file, and generally make the data file more readable.

OMEGASG.long description: *OMEGASG signals the input of gas and solvent mixing parameter.

ON-TIME.long description: *ON-TIME specifies the fraction of time during which a well or group operates.

OPEN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

OPERATE.long description: Define the well operating constraints and the remedial action to be taken when a constraint is violated.

OPERATE-HIST.description: Operating Constraints in History Matching Mode (Optional)
OPERATE-HIST.long description: *OPERATE-HIST indicates that well operating constraints defined by *OPERATE are under the special history-matching mode and the constraint values entered for surface phase rates serve as the observed flow rates.

ORTHOGG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

OUTBOARD.long description: Provide a generic data passing interface for any outboard (third-party) software to update a CMG simulator's recurrent data.

OUTDIARY.long description: *OUTDIARY controls some of the information written to the output-diary-file.

OUTPRN.long description: *OUTPRN identifies what information is written to the output file.

OUTSRF.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

OUTUNIT.long description: *INUNIT specifies the input data units. *OUTUNIT specifies the output data units

PACKERS.long description: The *PACKERS keyword specifies the locations of packers in a wellbore branch.

PADPOR_REF.long description: *PADSORP signals start of polymer adsorption table. *PADPOR_REF specifies the reference porosity used for adsorption level conversion.

PADSORP.long description: *PADSORP signals start of polymer adsorption table. *PADPOR_REF specifies the reference porosity used for adsorption level conversion.

PARTOL-TOL.long description: *CORNER-TOL controls the minimal spacing required to separate corner points. *CORNER-TOL  cptol *PARTOL-TOL  partol

PAYDEPTH.long description: Specify depth to the centre of the net pay for each grid block in the reservoir.

PB.long description: *PB indicates the input of bubble point pressure (kPa | psi | kPa | kg/cm2) in array format.

PBS.long description: *PBS indicates input of solvent bubble point pressure (kPa | psi | kPa | kg/cm2).

PBT.description: Initial Bubble Point Pressure vs. Depth (Conditional)
PBT.long description: *PBT indicates the input of bubble point pressure in tabular format as a function of depth.

PCGIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PCGMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PCGMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCGMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PCG-PCOND.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCG-SCALE.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PCOGI_SCALE.long description: Specify saturation scaling method for reading the boundary imbibition curve in capillary pressure hysteresis. It affects the couverture of formed scanning curves.

PCON-MANIFOLD.long description: To better honor a group’s manifold or surface pressure constraint, translate it to a tubing-head pressure constraint that is assigned to all that group’s wells.

PCOW_SHIFT.description: Water Oil-Capillary Pressure (J Function) Shift for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCOW_SHIFT.long description: These keywords specify the amount that the Water-oil capillary pressure or water-oil J Function curve is shifted up or down. This keyword can be used to account for the effects of a tilted water-oil contact (See Simulating a Tilted Water-Oil/Water-Gas Contact in the Tutorial section).

PCOWI_SCALE.long description: Specify saturation scaling method for reading the boundary imbibition curve in capillary pressure hysteresis. It affects the couverture of formed scanning curves.

PCSCALE_2PT.long description: This keyword activates two-end-point capillary pressure scaling for both oil-water and oil-gas capillary pressure.

PCWIMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWIMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PCWMAX.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWMAX.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PCWMIN.description: Endpoint Capillary Pressure Values for Each Grid Block (Optional)
PCWMIN.long description: These keywords specify the endpoint values of the capillary pressure of each grid block. The table curves associated to the block is scaled based on these endpoints.

PDD.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDD_DATA.long description: *PDD specifies the property distribution data for planar fractures. *PDD_DATA specify assignment of an input PDD to a fracture zone.

PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PDEGAA.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGAAG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PDEGAB.long description: Choose the factorization degree within and between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks).

PDEGABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PDEGRBB.description: Increase PDEGAA and PDEGAB for Blocks on Class Boundaries (Optional)
PDEGRBB.long description: Locally increase degree of factorization on the boundary of classes for REDBLACK to mimic what is done for NATURAL ordering.

PDEW.long description: *PDEW indicates the input of dew point pressure (kPa | psi | kPa | kg/cm2) in array format.

PDEWT.description: Initial Dew Point Pressure vs. Depth (Conditional)
PDEWT.long description: *PDEWT indicates the input of dew point pressure in tabular format as a function of depth.

PDRAIN-METHOD.long description: *PDRAIN-METHOD controls the method used to calculate an average spatial pressure near a well to approximate its drainage pressure when calculating well productivity index (PI). When using "*OUTSRF *WELL *PDRAIN", the average pressure () is made up of weighted averages of well layer block pressures and neighbouring block pressures (areal not vertical neighbours). is a proxy for the pressure at the drainage radius in the calculation of the steady-state productivity index of each well. The user has the option of choosing either the well layer transmissibility (see *PERF, *GEOMETRY keywords) or the grid block pore volume for weighting the spatial average.

PEAKANGLE.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PEAKCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

PERF.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERF-MD.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERFSCAN.long description: Methods to reduce the frequency of solver pointer generation.

PERFV.long description: *PERF specifies the location of the well completion grid blocks, well indices or parameters for well index calculations. *PERFV is a short form of *PERF for vertical wells, where the horizontal locations have been specified by the *VERT subkeyword of the *WELL keyword. *PERF-MD specifies the location of the well completion intervals in terms of measured depth, well indices or parameters for well index calculations.

PERMI.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMJ.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMK.long description: *PERMI indicates input of an array of I direction permeabilities. *PERMJ indicates input of an array of J direction permeabilities. *PERMK indicates input of an array of K direction permeabilities.

PERMODULUS.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

PF-ISETTING.description: Flow Multiplier for Wellbore Branch Perforated Interval
PF-ISETTING.long description: *PF-ISETTING defines flow multipliers (factors) for wellbore branch perforated intervals.

PGDILA.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the STARS *DILATION option.

PGPACT.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the STARS *DILATION option.

PGPDMAX.long description: Use a pseudo dilation model to mimic the STARS *DILATION option.

PHS_SEG_MODL.long description: This keyword modifies the behavior of the *TRANSFER 1 (in the Reservoir Description section), complete phase segregation model.

PINCHOUTARRAY.long description: *PINCHOUTARRAY defines pinch outs using an array input format.

PINCHOUT-TOL.long description: *PINCHOUT-TOL controls the minimal thickness required to initiate an automatic pinched out connection (see also *PINCHOUTARRAY).

PINCHVGAP.long description: Controls the vertical connectivity between blocks separated by pinched out blocks in a corner point grid.

PIVOT.long description: Specify the diagonal sub-matrix inversion pivot stabilization.

PIVOTG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PLNR_REFINE.long description: Create a local grid tailored toward a planar hydraulic fracture.

PLNRFRAC.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLNRFRAC_TEMPLATE.long description: Specify a template of data for the planar fracture model and apply it in multiple locations.

PLOADBC.long description: Specify external loads on any nodal points of a finite element.

PLOADBC3D.long description: Specify external load on any nodal points of a 3D finite element.

PLSTRAINY.long description: Specify that strains will be calculated by a series of planes normal to the Y (J) direction.

PMIX.long description: *PMIX indicates the viscosity mixing model for the polymer solution is being defined. *VSMIXFUNC defines optionally the exponent function for the nonlinear mixing rule.

PMIX-TABLE.long description: *PMIX-TABLE indicates the viscosity mixing rule for polymer solution using a general 4-D tabular form.

PNPROSL.description: Number of PARASOL Classes for GMRES (Optional)
PNPROSL.long description: Choose the number and scaling of GMRES vector operation classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) used in the scaling and GMRES iteration.

PNTHRDS.long description: Specify the number of parallel processing threads to use in the simulation.

POISSONMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

POISSRATIO.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

POISSRATIOIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POISSRATIOJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

POLYCONC.long description: *POLYCONC indicates input of initial polymer concentration (kg/m3 | lb/bbl | g/cm3).

POLY-DEGR.long description: Specifies reaction order and frequency factor, or alternatively polymer half-life time for polymer degradation.

POLY-DEGR-HL.long description: Specifies reaction order and frequency factor, or alternatively polymer half-life time for polymer degradation.

POLY-DEGR-HL-T.long description: Specifies reaction order and frequency factor, or alternatively polymer half-life time for polymer degradation.

POLYROCK.long description: *POLYROCK signals the input of rock type based polymer-rock adsorption properties.

POLYRRF-T.description: Thermal Multiplier to Polymer Residual Resistance Factor (Optional)
POLYRRF-T.long description: *POLYRRF-T signals the input of thermal multipliers to the polymer residual resistance factor.

POROSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PORVOL.long description: Specify grid cell porosity indirectly via pore volume.

PPATTERN.long description: Specify the basic partitioning of the reservoir into non-connected regions and separators that makes possible the parallelization of the linear solution.

PPATTERNG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PPERM.long description: *PPERM signals the start of table of absolute permeability dependent polymer rock adsorption. TABLE: *PPERM (*OLD) perm max_ad res_ad p_pore rrf       :       :       :       :    :

PRECABG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PRECC.long description: Use *PRECC to specify the convergence tolerance for the linear equation solver.

PRECCG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

PREFCONC.long description: *PREFCONC signals the input of reference polymer concentration.

PREFRAC.long description: Specify initiation and propagation of a hydraulic fracture in *GEOGRID. Information related to fracture is passed back to a reservoir simulator.

PRES.long description: *PRES indicates the input of reservoir pressures (kPa | psi | kPa | kg/cm2).

PRES-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
PRES-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

PRESCBC.long description: Prescribe displacement-type boundary conditions on nodal points of a finite element.

PRESCBC3D.long description: Prescribed displacement-type boundary conditions on a nodal point of a 3D finite element.

PRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

PREST.long description: *PREST indicates the input of pressure (oil phase) in tabular format as a function of depth.

PRINTGEO.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

PRIOR-FORM.long description: *PRIOR-FORM defines the priority formulae and numerical control parameters for the priority ranking apportionment method or the internal guide rate method set by *APPOR-METHOD *PRIOR / *INGUIDE to meet group targets. It is aimed to produce a desired stream while minimizing the production of other/nuisance streams. It can also be used to meet an injection target by which only the most "injectable" wells operate.

PRODUCER.long description: Specify a well’s type (producer or injector).

PROPP-ADVMULT.long description: These keywords specify the advection and/or settling flux multipliers tables.

PROPP-DEF.long description: This keyword defines the name and properties of a type of proppant particles.

PROPP-INJCONC.long description: This keyword specifies the concentration of a proppant in an injection well.

PROPP-STLMULT.long description: These keywords specify the advection and/or settling flux multipliers tables.

PRPOR.long description: *CPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility. *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility. *TRPOR signals the input of reference temperature for the rock thermal expansion. *CTPOR signals the input of rock thermal expansion coefficient.

PRS-ITERMAX.long description: *PRS-ITERMAX specifies the maximum number of ILU pressure solve iterations to be performed per full linear solver iteration (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAA.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAA.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PDEGAB.description: Factorization Degree within or between PARASOL Classes (Optional)
PRS-PDEGAB.long description: Specify the ILU factorization degree within or between PARASOL classes (a class is defined as a disjoint set of blocks) for the ILU pressure solver (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PRS-PRECC.description: Convergence Precision for ILU Pressure Solver (Optional)
PRS-PRECC.long description: *PRS-PRECC specifies the convergence tolerance for the ILU pressure solve (*COMBINATIVE *ILU).

PSPLIT.long description: *PSPLIT turns on or off the limited production split output.

PTHRESH-FAULT.long description: Introduces threshold pressures for flow across an interface of two adjacent initialization regions (*PTHRESH-IREGN); or across a fault plane (*PTHRESH-FAULT).

PTHRESHI.long description: Defines pressure gradients on interblock flow boundaries below which flow is not initiated.

PTHRESH-IREGN.long description: Introduces threshold pressures for flow across an interface of two adjacent initialization regions (*PTHRESH-IREGN); or across a fault plane (*PTHRESH-FAULT).

PTHRESHJ.long description: Defines pressure gradients on interblock flow boundaries below which flow is not initiated.

PTHRESHK.long description: Defines pressure gradients on interblock flow boundaries below which flow is not initiated.

PT-ISETTING.long description: *PT-ISETTING allows the user to enter flow settings (fractions) for perforated tubing intervals.

PT-PDMETHOD.description: Radial Pressure Drop for Perforated Tubing Calculation Method
PT-PDMETHOD.long description: *PT-PDMETHOD specifies a pressure drop computation method that will be available for computing pressure drops as fluid flows from the wellbore to the tubing string through a perforated interval (assuming radial flow along the cross-section of tubing string at each point).

PT-PDPOINTS.description: Switch Points for Perforated Tubing Radial Drop Method
PT-PDPOINTS.long description: *PT-PDPOINTS enters switch points for perforated tubing radial pressure drop methods.

PTSCALING_KRG.long description: Enabling the three-point scaling options for saturation endpoints.

PTUBE1.long description: *PTUBE1 or *ITUBE1 specifies a table of tubing-head (or outlet) pressure data tables for a production or injection well (or manifold group). The tabulated variable is the bottom-hole (or inlet) pressure, with tubing-head (or outlet) pressure and several independent variables such as surface rates or rate ratios. *PTUBE1 can also be used to input the well-head temperature table.

PTUBE-FIXFRAC.long description: Specify globally the hydraulic table lookup method for calculating the tubing-head pressure of producers.

PTUBE-GEN.long description: *PTUBE-GEN defines controlling parameters for generating the hydraulic table (*PTUBE1 / *ITUBE1).

PTYPE.long description: *PTYPE indicates the start of input of PVT region types. A *PVT table set and if specified, a bubble point pressure vs. depth table is assigned to each grid block (see *PVT and *PBT).

PUMP-CURVE.long description: *PUMP-CURVE provides a means for defining manufacturer pump performance curves for a single pump module.

PVCUTFR.long description: *PVCUTFR controls the level at which a fracture cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTOFF.long description: *PVCUTOFF controls the level at which a cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVCUTRG-FR.description: Pore Volume Cut-Off Threshold for RG (Optional)
PVCUTRG-FR.long description: *PVCUTRG controls the level at which a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero. *PVCUTRG-FR controls the level at which a fracture block of a refined cell’s pore volume is small enough to be considered zero.

PVISC.long description: *PVISC signals the input of reference polymer viscosity and its dependence on temperature via *PVISC-T in a thermal run.

PVISCSALT.long description: *PVISCSALT defines the effect of salinity on polymer viscosity in the aqueous phase.

PVISC-T.long description: *PVISC signals the input of reference polymer viscosity and its dependence on temperature via *PVISC-T in a thermal run.

PVT.long description: *PVT indicates start of the oil and gas *PVT table.

PVTAPI.description: Gas PVT Table for API Model (Optional)
PVTAPI.long description: *PVTAPI indicates start of PVT information for a PVT region and also indicates start of gas *PVT table. The *APIGRAD oil *PVT tables must follow the *PVTAPI gas table for each PVT region.

PVTCOND.description: Condensate - Oil and Gas PVT Table (Optional)
PVTCOND.long description: *PVTCOND indicates start of the oil and gas condensate *PVT table.

PVTG.description: Gas PVT Table for GASWATER Model (Optional)
PVTG.long description: *PVTG indicates start of PVT information for a PVT region and also indicates start of gas *PVTG table. TABLE: *PVTG  (*EG | *BG | *ZG)    set_number       p eg | bg | zg visg (srftn)       :           :    :    :

PVTS.long description: *PVTS indicates the start of the solvent *PVT table.

PVTSEAWAT.long description: *PVTSEAWAT indicates start of PVT information for seawater (brine).

PVTVO.description: Volatile - Oil and Gas PVT Table (Optional)
PVTVO.long description: *PVTVO indicates start of the oil and gas *PVTVO table.

PWELLBORE.long description: *PWELLBORE specifies that reservoir-to-surface pressure drops will be calculated for the indicated producing wells.

PWELMIN.long description: Specify the minimum wellbore pressure during hydraulic head calculation.

RANGE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

RANGECHECK.long description: *RANGECHECK controls the data range check feature.

RCONBK.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONBT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONFT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONLF.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONRT.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

RCONTP.long description: Use and specify geomechanics grid that is independent of the host simulator’s grid.

REFCURR.long description: The *REFCURR option updates the reference porosity, pressure or permeability to the current values when the rock compaction / dilation model is defined recurrently.

REFDEPTH.long description: *REFDEPTH indicates input of reference depth. *REFPRES indicates input of reference pressure.

REFINE.long description: *REFINE specifies that a block is replaced by a locally refined grid.

REFPRES.long description: *REFDEPTH indicates input of reference depth. *REFPRES indicates input of reference pressure.

REFPST.description: Reference Pressure for Gas-Oil Capillary Pressure (Optional)
REFPST.long description: *REFPST indicates the input of a reference pressure for the gas-oil (liquid) capillary pressure input.

REFPW.long description: *BWI indicates the input of the water formation volume factor (for a PVT region). *CW indicates the input of water compressibility (for a PVT region). *REFPW indicates the input of reference pressure (for a PVT region).

REGIONMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers between specified regions.

RELOCATE.long description: This keyword is used to specify new location for iSegWell entities.

REPORTING-GROUP.long description: *REPORTING-GROUP allows the definition of a group with arbitrary well membership and weighting factors, for reporting purposes only.

RESDATE.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restart run.

RESDUCOHES.long description: Use the Generalized Plasticty constitutive model which allows cohesion, friction angle and dilation angle to change with effective plastic strain.

RESTART.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restart run.

RESTART_SR2.long description: Specify which Simulation Results file set contains the simulator restart information.

RESTIME.long description: *RESTART, *RESTIME or *RESDATE indicates that this is a restart run.

RESWATCON.long description: *SEAWATCON signals the input of the reference injection seawater salt concentration. *RESWATCON signals the input of the initial reservoir water salt concentration.

REWIND.long description: *WRST and *REWIND control the frequency of writing and rewinding restart records in the output restart file.

RG.long description: *RG is used to assign values of an array to refined grid blocks.

RIGIDNULL.long description: Assign fixed boundary to nodes around a null block.

RIGIDTOP.long description: Constrain vertical movement on the cap rock of a reservoir.

RM-LAYERCLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a control lump.

RM-LAYERRLUMP.long description: Remove a layer from the membership of a report lump.

RM-PACKERS.long description: The keyword *RM-PACKERS is used to remove packers.

RM-PF-INTVLS.long description: *RM-PF-INTVLS removes perforated intervals from a wellbore branch.

RM-SGRPFINCLUMP.long description: The *RM-SGRPFINCLUMP removes perforation intervals from a control lump.

RM-SGRPFINRLUMP.description: Remove iSegWell Perfs from Report Lump
RM-SGRPFINRLUMP.long description: The *RM-SGRPFINRLUMP removes perforation intervals from a report lump.

RM-TOPENS.long description: Use *RM-TOPENS to remove tubing string openings.

RM-TSEQPT.long description: *RM-TSEQPT removes tubing string equipment based on the equipment measured depth and type.

RM-TSTRING.long description: Use *RM-TSTRING to remove a tubing string.

ROCKDEN.long description: These keywords specify the Langmuir Isotherm parameters used to model the adsorption/desorption of gas to/from rock. This feature can be used to model simple adsorption effects in shale gas and CBM problems.

ROCKFLUID.long description: *ROCKFLUID indicates the start of the rock-fluid data.

ROCKJOINT.long description: A mass of jointed rock is treated as anisotropy, as opposed to the isotropy of an intact rock.

RPLTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RPT.long description: *RPT indicates that this set of relative permeability curves will be defined by table entries.

RPWTABD.long description: Define relative permeabilities for the dilated region.

RST.description: Initial Solution Gas Ratio vs. Depth (Conditional)
RST.long description: *RST indicates the input of solution gas ratio in tabular format as a function of depth.

RTYPE.long description: *RTYPE indicates the start of input of rock types. A relative permeability curve set is assigned to each grid block (see *RPT).

RUN.long description: *RUN identifies the beginning of all well and recurrent data keywords.

RVT.long description: *RVT indicates the input of oil content in tabular format as a function of depth.

SA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SALTCONC.long description: *SALTCONC indicates input of initial reservoir salt concentration (kg/m3 | lb/STB | g/cm3).

SBETA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SBG.description: Assign Data to Structured Block Groups
SBG.long description: *SBG assigns values or tasks to a group of blocks defined by *SBLOCKGROUP.

SCAL_EXPERIMENT.description: Model Experiment of Special Core Analysis
SCAL_EXPERIMENT.long description: This keyword indicates the dataset is to model the Special Core Analysis (SCAL) experiment.

SCAL_RPM.description: Assign Turning Speed for Centrifuge SCAL Experiment
SCAL_RPM.long description: This keyword assigns the turning speed of the centrifuge SCAL experiment.

SCLDMG.long description: *SCLDMG indicates the start of a seawater option scale damage table. It allows the user to enter scale well damage as a function of scale deposited per perforation length for individual scale damage set numbers. These sets can then be applied to individual wells and/or well layers using *SCLTBL-WELL and *SCLTBL-LAYER as described in the Well and Recurrent Data section.

SCLDPS.long description: *SCLDPS indicates the start of a Salt option scale deposition table. It allows the user to enter scale deposition as a function of relative salt concentration for individual scale deposition set numbers. These sets can then be applied to individual wells and/or well layers using *SCLTBL-WELL and *SCLTBL-LAYER as described in the Well and Recurrent Data section.

SCLRMV-LAYER.long description: *SCLRMV-LAYER removes a fraction of the accumulated deposited scale from multiple specified perforations of a single well.

SCLRMV-WELL.long description: *SCLRMV-WELL removes a fraction of the accumulated deposited scale from a well.

SCLTBL-LAYER.long description: *SCLTBL-LAYER assigns deposition and damage tables (defined in the Rock Fluid Properties section to multiple specified layers of a single well.

SCLTBL-WELL.long description: *SCLTBL-WELL assigns deposition and damage tables (defined in the Rock Fluid Properties section to wells.

SCONNECT.long description: *SCONNECT allows the definition of flow connections between blocks that would not otherwise be generated by the simulator. Also, *SCONNECT allows existing flow connections to be overridden.

SD_REINF.long description: *SD_REINF works with *TRANSD to modify the Inter-Subdomain connection (defined by *TRANSD > 0.0) to represent reinfiltration.

SDEGREE.long description: Specify the maximum degree of fill terms used in the linear solver’s factorization.

SDEGREEG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SEAWATCON.long description: *SEAWATCON signals the input of the reference injection seawater salt concentration. *RESWATCON signals the input of the initial reservoir water salt concentration.

SECTOR.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize output of regional reservoir activity.

SECTORARRAY.long description: Specify reporting sector using a grid-array format.

SECTORNAMES.long description: Specify reporting sectors to summarize regional reservoir activity, via sector number and grid array.

SETHA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SETPI.long description: Overwrite a well’s phase productivity/injectivity, or multiply it by a factor.

SGAMMA.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SGDIM.description: Set Dimensioning Parameters for SGW Module
SGDIM.long description: The *SGDIM provides a means for setting dimensioning parameters for the SGW module.

SGINFO.long description: The *SGINFO provides a means for specifying the output level from the SGW module.

SGMONACDEAC.long description: *SGMONACDEAC activates or deactivates an iSegWell monitor.

SGMONITOR.long description: *SGMONITOR defines iSegWell monitor tests and actions.

SGMON-TSPT.long description: The *SGMON-TSPT defines the monitoring points in tubing strings.

SGMON-TSSET.long description: The *SGMON-TSSET defines the set of equipment that will be acted upon by a monitor.

SGMON-WBPT.long description: *SGMON-WBPT defines a monitoring point in a wellbore branch.

SGREFJCT.long description: *SGREFJCT specifies junctions arising from a wellbore or tubing string monitor point as the BHP reference junctions for named intelligent segmented wells. This keyword can also re-establish the default choice of a reference junction. The BHP reference junction is the location in the well where BHP is calculated. BHP defined on a simulator well’s *OPERATE keyword refers to this location.

SGRMAX.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

SGRPFINCLUMP.description: Create a Set of iSegWell Perforation Points
SGRPFINCLUMP.long description: The *SGRPFINCLUMP creates a set (control lump) of iSegWell perforation points by specifying member branch names and measured depth intervals. For further information, refer to keyword *LAYERCLUMP.

SGRPFINRLUMP.description: Create or Add Intervals to Report Lump
SGRPFINRLUMP.long description: The *SGRPFINRLUMP creates a set (report lump) of iSegWell perforation points by specifying member branch names and measured depth intervals. For report lumps, stream rates, cumulatives, and production rate ratios are calculated. Users can design triggers based on these quantities. In report lumps, an interval can have a zero or positive membership factor. Any given interval can be a member of arbitrarily many distinct report lumps. For further information, refer to keyword *LAYERRLUMP.

SGT.long description: *SLT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on liquid saturation. *SGT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on gas saturation. In addition *SLT(*SGT) controls the use of a wide variety of relative permeability regression and optimization functions. In its most basic form (to define beginning of table).

SGTI.long description: Indicate the start of the gas imbibition relative permeability table dependent on liquid or gas saturation.

SGWASSIGN.long description: *SGWASSIGN directs a simulator well to use the specified iSegWell structure (specifically surface conduits defined by *BRANCH or *TSTRING) to calculate its properties (rates, for example). The simulator well is assigned a type, constraint list, and so on, just as if it were a conventional well. This line also informs the simulator that the named simulator well is being treated as an iSegWell.

SHAPE.long description: Specify which shape factor formulation to use in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SHEAR_FAC.long description: Convert polymer solution Darcy velocities to equivalent porous media shear rates.

SHEARMOD.long description: The Modified Cam Clay (MCC) constitutive model captures the behavior of soft geomaterials such as soil or sand.

SHEARMODIJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODIK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARMODJK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

SHEARTHICK.long description: These keywords define the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer in the water phase at the reference polymer concentration.

SHEARTHIN.long description: These keywords define the effect of shear rate on the viscosity of polymer in the water phase at the reference polymer concentration.

SHPERMAX.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHPERMRES.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

SHUTIN.long description: *SHUTIN shuts in a well unconditionally. *OPEN opens a previously shut-in well. *AUTODRILL specifies that an undrilled (shut-in) well will be drilled (opened) automatically to meet the group-based target rates.

SIGMAMF.description: Direct Input of Shape Factor and Transfer Permeability Arrays (Optional)
SIGMAMF.long description: Keywords *SIGMAMF and *KAVMF allow direct input of the block shape factor and average transfer permeability arrays, respectively, for each grid block to be used in calculating matrix-fracture flow for the natural fracture grid options.

SIP_DATA.long description: Keyword to indicate that grid-array data is stored in binary or simulation input (SIP) compressed form.

SITERPG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SKAPA1.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKAPA2.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SKIN-TUNER.long description: *SKIN-TUNER calculates and applies a separate well index multiplier to wells so that the user-specified bottom-hole pressure and surface rate will match under the current reservoir and wellbore conditions.

SLT.long description: *SLT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on liquid saturation. *SGT indicates the start of a liquid-gas relative permeability table dependent on gas saturation. In addition *SLT(*SGT) controls the use of a wide variety of relative permeability regression and optimization functions. In its most basic form (to define beginning of table).

SLTI.long description: Indicate the start of the gas imbibition relative permeability table dependent on liquid or gas saturation.

SM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SMKMAXR.description: Maximum Make-up Solvent Rate for Group Solvent Recycling (Optional)
SMKMAXR.long description: *SMKMAXR is used to specify the maximum surface rate of make-up solvent injected as part of a group solvent recycling target to supplement the recycled fluid. This information can also be specified after the recycling fraction on the *RECYCLE *SOLVENT line after *GCONI. The two methods of entering the make-up rate can over-write each other. Solvent recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword. The numbers entered under *SMKMAXR have no effect unless a group solvent recycling injection target is currently in force.

SMKUPTO.description: Solvent Make-up Target for Group Solvent Recycling (Optional)
SMKUPTO.long description: *SMKUPTO is used to specify a total group surface solvent injection rate which make-up solvent, in general up to a certain maximum rate, will supplement the recycled solvent to meet. In other words, the solvent rate specified for injection is the rate on the *SMKUPTO keyword. The rate of make-up solvent actually injected may be reduced by the rate of solvent being recycled and also may account for the maximum make-up solvent rate specified on the *SMKMAXR keyword. The rate specified on the *SMKUPTO keyword This will also be referred to as the "make_up_to" rate. The maximum solvent make-up rate can be specified either with the *SMKMAXR keyword or on the *RECYCLE *SOLVENT line following *GCONI. The total solvent injection rate can be entered only with *SMKUPTO. The rates entered here have an effect only if a solvent recycling injection target is in force. Solvent recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword. The total injection rate specified here differs from a group STS target in that the target entered here is not be met if the make-up solvent must exceed a specified maximum rate in order to meet the total rate.

SN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SNG.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SO.long description: *SO indicates input of initial oil saturation (fraction). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction).

SOLFAIL.long description: *SOLFAIL is used to override the default behavior when the solver fails to converge.

SOLSTALL.long description: *SOLSTALL is used to override the default behavior when the solver stalls.

SOLVER.long description: Choose which linear equation solver to use: AIMSOL or PARASOL.

SOLVERG.long description: Specify the matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SONEQ.description: Non Equilibrium Water and Oil Saturation Used with Gravity-Capillary Equilibrium Initialization (Conditional)
SONEQ.long description: *SWNEQ and/or *SONEQ indicates input of non equilibrium initial saturation overrides to be used with gravity-capillary equilibrium initialization.

SORDER.long description: Specify the ordering of equations in the ILU factorization.
