SORDERG.long description: Control the AIMSOL/PARASOL/PCG matrix solver for the geomechanics equations.

SORMAX.long description: Specify endpoints of the relative permeabilities tables of each grid block.

SPATM.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

SPECGRAV.long description: Specify direction and magnitude of body forces on a per-plane basis.

SPRODGROUP.description: Solvent Producing Group for Group Recycling (Optional)
SPRODGROUP.long description: *SPRODGROUP is used to specify the group from which solvent production rates or total production rates will be taken to calculate a solvent recycling injection target or voidage replacement by solvent target specified for another group or groups using the *GCONI keyword.

SR2ASCII.description: ASCII Form of Simulation Result File (Optional)
SR2ASCII.long description: *SR2ASCII indicates that an ASCII/textual copy of the main simulation results file will be created in addition to the binary file. The extension for this file is .asc

SR2PREC.long description: *SR2PREC flags the precision with which floating point data is written to the binary simulation result file. Use *SINGLE for 4 bytes and *DOUBLE for 8 bytes. *SINGLE is not available with *XDR *OFF. Use of *SINGLE will cause the result of a restart run to vary slightly from the same timesteps of the first run, due to the fact that the lower order digits of the starting values have been truncated, unless the default *RESTART_SR2 *SEPARATE remains.

SRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Solvent Recycling (Optional)
SRECYMAXR.long description: *SRECYMAXR is used to specify a maximum rate at which solvent is re-injected under a group recycling target. Solvent recycling injection targets are specified for groups using the *GCONI keyword. The numbers entered under *SRECYMAXR have no effect unless a group solvent recycling injection target is currently in force.

SRFORMAT.long description: Specify the file format for passing simulation results to CMG viewing software.

SRFTNG.long description: Defines Surface tensions to be used in the J Function Option.

SRFTNW.long description: Defines Surface tensions to be used in the J Function Option.

SSMODEL.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STEN.long description: The Single Surface Failure constitutive model captures the main behaviors of geomaterials under complex states of stress.

STRESI.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESS_RETURN.long description: Override default control parameters for plastic deformation option.

STRESS3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSGRAD.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSGRAD3D.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSH.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 2D plane strain approach.

STRESSHIJ.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHIK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSHJK.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

STRESSTOL.long description: Specify parameters that control iterative coupling to the fluid-flow solution.

SUBDOMAIN.long description: *SUBDOMAIN indicates the use of a dual porosity model using the subdomain method.

SVISC.long description: *SVISC signals the input of the reference Seawater viscosity.

SW.long description: *SO indicates input of initial oil saturation (fraction). *SW indicates input of initial water saturation (fraction).

SW_SORMT.description: Pseudo-Miscible Option Controlled Irreducible Oil Saturation Table (Optional)
SW_SORMT.long description: This table allows water saturation versus irreducible oil saturation input in pseudo-miscible displacement option.

SWGT.long description: *SWGT indicates the start of the gas-water relative permeability table. The table is designed only for gas-water model. In addition,*SWGT controls the use of a wide variety of relative permeability regression and optimization functions. In its most basic form (to define the beginning of a table):

SWGTI.long description: *SWGTI indicates the start of the gas-water imbibition relative permeability table.

SWINIT.description: Water Saturation Input Used with Gravity-Capillary Initialization (Conditional)
SWINIT.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB restricts the capillary pressure adjustment for mobile water only.

SWINIT_ADJMOB.description: Water Saturation Input Used with Gravity-Capillary Initialization (Conditional)
SWINIT_ADJMOB.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB restricts the capillary pressure adjustment for mobile water only.

SWINIT_CONTROL.description: Water Saturation Input Used with Gravity-Capillary Initialization (Conditional)
SWINIT_CONTROL.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB restricts the capillary pressure adjustment for mobile water only.

SWINIT_CPADJST.description: Water Saturation Input Used with Gravity-Capillary Initialization (Conditional)
SWINIT_CPADJST.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB restricts the capillary pressure adjustment for mobile water only.

SWINIT_NOCRIT.description: Water Saturation Input Used with Gravity-Capillary Initialization (Conditional)
SWINIT_NOCRIT.long description: *SWINIT specifies the initial water saturation while maintaining gravity-capillary equilibrium generated by a vertical equilibrium option. *SWINIT_CPADJST identifies the selected method for maintaining no-flow condition. *SWINIT_CONTROL provides options for controlling the capillary pressure adjustment and deviation from equilibrium saturation. *SWINIT_NOCRIT allows the assignment of mobile water saturation to blocks in the gas zone. *SWINIT_ADJMOB restricts the capillary pressure adjustment for mobile water only.

SWNEQ.description: Non Equilibrium Water and Oil Saturation Used with Gravity-Capillary Equilibrium Initialization (Conditional)
SWNEQ.long description: *SWNEQ and/or *SONEQ indicates input of non equilibrium initial saturation overrides to be used with gravity-capillary equilibrium initialization.

SWT.long description: *SWT indicates the start of the water-oil relative permeability table. In addition *SWT controls the use of a wide variety of relative permeability regression and optimization functions. In its most basic form (to define the beginning of a table):

SWTI.long description: *SWTI indicates the start of the water-oil imbibition relative permeability table.

TARGET.long description: *TARGET allows modification of any previously specified well constraint value or the specification of a new constraint type and value for well(s).

TBLBAS_3PTKR.description: Rock-Fluid Table-Based Three-point Relative Permeability Scaling (Optional)
TBLBAS_3PTKR.long description: This keyword switches the special treatment of three-point Kr scaling into table-based instead of the default block-based.

TE-EXTEND.long description: This keyword extends the end of existing tubing string to new location along its owner branch.

TEMP-AT-FENODE.description: Pressure and Temperature at Finite Element Node
TEMP-AT-FENODE.long description: Transfer pore pressure or temperature from grid block centers to finite element node to compute an equivalent force.

TEMPER.long description: Input of initial reservoir temperature as a grid block array (*TEMPER), or as a function of depth in tabular format (*TEMPVD).

TEMPVD.long description: Input of initial reservoir temperature as a grid block array (*TEMPER), or as a function of depth in tabular format (*TEMPVD).

TE-PDMETHOD.description: Pressure Drop Computational Methods (Tubing String End)
TE-PDMETHOD.long description: *TE-PDMETHOD specifies the set of pressure drop computation methods available for computing pressure drops as fluid flows through a tubing string end.

THCOND.long description: To define the thermal rock heat capacity and the total heat conductivity.

THERMAL.long description: To enable the thermal option to allow modelling, for example, the temperature effects of cold or hot water injection.

THEXPCOEFI.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFJ.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

THEXPCOEFK.long description: Define mechanical properties of an anisotropic rock.

TIME.long description: *TIME indicates that the well change will occur at a specified time.

TITLE1.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TITLE2.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TITLE3.long description: Identify the project and individual run cases with titles and comments.

TKRGCL.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKRGRL.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKROCRW.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKROCW.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKROGCG.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKROGCRG.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKRWIRO.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TKRWRO.long description: These keywords specify the relative permeability endpoint values of the relative permeability curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are vertically scaled based on these endpoints.

TO-PDMETHOD.description: Pressure Drop Computation Method (Tubing String Opening)
TO-PDMETHOD.long description: *TO-PDMETHOD specifies a pressure drop computation method available for computing pressure drops as fluid flows through a tubing string opening.

TOPENS.long description: *TOPENS adds tubing string openings (other than tubing ends, which are specified with the *TSTRING keyword, and openings through perforated tubing intervals, which are entered using *PT-INTVLS).

TRACER.long description: *TRACER indicates the start of Tracer Data section.

TRANLI.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLJ.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANLK.description: Transmissibility Multipliers for Lower Indexed-Block Faces (Optional)
TRANLK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers for faces contacting lower indexed blocks.

TRANSD.long description: *TRANSD enables vertical inter-block matrix-fracture flow in *DUALPERM model, or vertical inter-block matrix-matrix flow in *SUBDOMAIN or *MINC model, and indicates input of an array of transmissibility multipliers to be applied on these connections.

TRANSF.long description: Adjusts transmissibilities on a fault basis.

TRANSFER.long description: *TRANSFER indicates the type of matrix-fracture model for treating different phases in dual-porosity or dual-permeability reservoirs.

TRANSI.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSJ.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSK.long description: Specify transmissibility multipliers in the positive I, J and K directions.

TRANSLATE.description: Changing the Keywords by Using Translate Rules (Optional)
TRANSLATE.long description: *TRANSLATE changes or translates your own favorite keyword into a CMG simulator recognizable keyword.

TRANSMF.long description: *TRANSMF specifies transmissibility multiplier for fluid flow between matrix and fracture.

TRANSMULT.long description: Specify action to take for successive transmissibility multipliers.

TRANVI.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVJ.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVK.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRANVMOD.long description: Specify transmissibility values in the various positive directions.

TRCR-ADSCOEF.long description: *TRCR-ADSCOEF specifies the adsorption coefficient data for the associated tracer.

TRCR-ADSRDEN.long description: *TRCR-ADSRDEN specifies the average rock densities for adsorption rock regions.

TRCR-ADSROCK.long description: *TRCR-ADSROCK indicates the number of tracer adsorption rock regions.

TRCR-ADSRTYP.long description: *TRCR-ADSRTYP assigns adsorption rock regions to reservoir grid blocks.

TRCR-AQUIFER.long description: *TRCR-AQUIFER assigns a tracer to a previously defined analytical aquifer.

TRCR-DEF.long description: *TRCR-DEF defines the tracers and their associated reference phases.

TRCR-DIFCOEF.long description: *TRCR-DIFCOEF specifies the molecular diffusion coefficients in water, oil, and gas phases for tracer(s). *TRCR-TORTU specifies the tortuosity parameter for the porous medium.

TRCR-DTFAC.long description: These keywords specify numerical solution controls to solve tracer equations.

TRCR-DTMAX.long description: These keywords specify numerical solution controls to solve tracer equations.

TRCR-DTMIN.long description: These keywords specify numerical solution controls to solve tracer equations.

TRCR-FIMPL.long description: These keywords specify numerical solution controls to solve tracer equations.

TRCR-INICONCG.long description: These keywords specify block initial tracer concentrations of phases in the reservoir.

TRCR-INICONCO.long description: These keywords specify block initial tracer concentrations of phases in the reservoir.

TRCR-INICONCP.long description: These keywords specify block initial tracer concentrations of phases in the reservoir.

TRCR-INICONCS.long description: These keywords specify block initial tracer concentrations of phases in the reservoir.

TRCR-INICONCW.long description: These keywords specify block initial tracer concentrations of phases in the reservoir.

TRCR-INJCONC.long description: *TRCR-INJCONC specifies the concentration of a tracer in an injection well.

TRCR-INJECTORS.long description: *TRCR-INJECTORS assigns one tracer for each injection well with the specified injection phase. *TRCR-INJECTORS-STAGE assigns one tracer for each injection well at each injection stage with the specified injection phase.

TRCR-INJECTORS-STAGE.long description: *TRCR-INJECTORS assigns one tracer for each injection well with the specified injection phase. *TRCR-INJECTORS-STAGE assigns one tracer for each injection well at each injection stage with the specified injection phase.

TRCR-LIMFNC.long description: These keywords specify the numerical scheme used to evaluate the tracer convective fluxes at the block interfaces.

TRCR-LNGDSPC.long description: These keywords specify longitudinal and transverse dispersivities for velocity-dependent dispersion calculation for all tracers.

TRCR-NUMSCHM.long description: These keywords specify the numerical scheme used to evaluate the tracer convective fluxes at the block interfaces.

TRCR-OUTPUT.long description: *TRCR-OUTPUT specifies the tracer output type to be written into the main results files.

TRCR-PARCCOR.long description: *TRCR-PARCCOR specifies the coefficients for liquid-gas partitioning coefficient correlation.

TRCR-PARCTBL.long description: *TRCR-PARCTBL assigns partitioning coefficients in table form.

TRCR-SECTOR.long description: *TRCR-SECTOR assigns a tracer to a previously defined sector by *SECTORNAMES or *SECTORARRAY.

TRCR-TRNDSPC.long description: These keywords specify longitudinal and transverse dispersivities for velocity-dependent dispersion calculation for all tracers.

TRCR-UNITBASE.long description: *TRCR-UNITBASE specifies the unit for tracer properties.

TRES.long description: *TRES indicates the input of reservoir temperature.

TRGVAR.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRGVARS.long description: Formulate mathematical expressions which can be used as part of a trigger condition or within the trigger keyword block, to assign specific values to well or group operating conditions. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVAR has its value updated every time step. A trigger variable specified with *TRGVARS has its value updated only when the *TRGVARS keyword is read.

TRIGGER.description: Allow for a Set of Keywords to be Processed When a Specified Condition (Trigger) is Satisfied (Optional)
TRIGGER.long description: Specify certain actions which are implemented when one or more specific conditions are satisfied during the simulation.

TRPOR.long description: *CPOR signals the input of a rock compressibility. *PRPOR signals the input of a reference pressure for the rock compressibility. *DCPOR signals the input of pressure dependency of the rock compressibility. *TRPOR signals the input of reference temperature for the rock thermal expansion. *CTPOR signals the input of rock thermal expansion coefficient.

TS-EQONOFF.long description: *TS-EQONOFF switches a piece of tubing string equipment (or opening) on or off.

TS-EQPMETHOD.description: Specify Method for Calculating Pressure Drop Through Tubing String Equipment
TS-EQPMETHOD.long description: *TS-EQPMETHOD defines methods for calculating the pressure drop through tubing string equipment.

TS-EQPT.description: Location of Equipment in Tubing Strings
TS-EQPT.long description: *TS-EQPT specifies the locations of equipment in tubing strings.

TS-EQSETTING.description: Flow Setting for Piece of Tubing Equipment or Tubing Opening
TS-EQSETTING.long description: *TS-EQSETTING switches a piece of tubing string equipment (or opening) on or off.

TSGCON.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSGCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSLCON.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TS-LGFRACS.long description: *TS-LGFRACS provides a means of specifying the fraction of the injected gas that will be handled by each tubing string opening when gas lift receives the non-well treatment.

TS-LIFTGAS.description: Gas Lift Treatment in Tubing String
TS-LIFTGAS.long description: *TS-LIFTGAS provides a means of specifying the treatment that gas lift will receive in a given tubing string.

TSOIRG.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSOIRW.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSORG.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSORW.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TS-PDMETHOD.description: Specify Method for Computing Pressure Drop for Flow in Tubing String
TS-PDMETHOD.long description: *TS-PDMETHOD specifies the pressure drop computation methods available for computing pressure drops as fluid flows along a segment of a tubing string.

TS-PDPOINTS.description: Specify Pressure Drop Formula for Tubing String
TS-PDPOINTS.long description: *TS-PDPOINTS specifies intervals where a specific pressure drop (PD) formula holds in a tubing string. This is accomplished by entering points where the PD formula changes from one method to another, since no point in the string can be left without a specified formula.

TS-RISER.description: Define Links Included in Riser (Tubing String)
TS-RISER.long description: *TS-RISER defines the links which are included in the riser (which we define as the final part of the flow path before it reaches the surface) and which is the part of the well over which the well head pressure (WHP) calculations are made when using *PWELLBORE / *IWELLBORE *MODEL or *TABLE.

TSTRING.long description: *TSTRING specifies tubing string original points and, for ends, whether they are *OPEN or *CLOSED. *OPEN tubing ends function as tubing string openings.

TSWCON.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TSWCRIT.long description: These keywords specify the saturation endpoints of relative permeability and capillary pressure curves entered via keywords *SWT/*SLT/*SGT. These curves are horizontally scaled (overridden) based on these endpoints.

TWELLBORE.long description: *TWELLBORE specifies that wellbore temperature calculations will be done for a producer with the assigned method.

UBA.long description: Specify address for any block in the grid.

UNLOADSTR.long description: Assign total stress to be unloaded at the well boundary.

URBCOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URECOEF.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN1.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

UREXPN2.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTB.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

URNTE.long description: Define coefficients for a hyperelastic constitutive model #2 as described in the keyword *NLINEAR.

USER_INPUT.description: User Input or Vertical Equilibrium Selection (Required)
USER_INPUT.long description: *USER_INPUT and *VERTICAL control the type of reservoir initialization calculation.

USHEARST.long description: Compute fracture permeability or change fracture threshold of the Barton-Bandis model when fracturing occurs due to shear stress.

USTRESCUR.long description: Specify matrix-block permeability multiplier depending upon geomechanical response.

UTSTRESS.long description: Assign the initial stress distribution for 3D finite elements.

VAMOD.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VATYPE.long description: Describes modification to grid block volumes and face areas.

VERTICAL.description: User Input or Vertical Equilibrium Selection (Required)
VERTICAL.long description: *USER_INPUT and *VERTICAL control the type of reservoir initialization calculation.

VGUST.description: Condensate Model - Undersaturated Gas Viscosity Table
VGUST.long description: *VGUST indicates the input of a gas viscosity table for condensate undersaturated gas

VISC-REF.long description: *OILVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of oil viscosity. *WATVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of water viscosity. *VISC-REF specifies the reference conditions for the viscosity-temperature relationship.

VISFLOWR.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISINIT.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPARA.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISPOWER.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSCHEME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISSTEP.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VISTIME.long description: Define coefficients for creep models *GMCREEP 1 (Drucker-Prager yield surface) and *GMCREEP 2 (Mises yield surface).

VOLMOD.long description: *VOLMOD indicates input of an array of bulk volume modifiers.

VOT.description: Oil Viscosity Above the Bubble Point as a Function of Pressure (Optional)
VOT.long description: *VOT indicates the input of an oil viscosity (Vo) table that is a function of both pressure (P) and bubble point pressure (Pb).

VOTAPI.description: Oil Viscosity above the Bubble Point as a Function of Pressure and STC Oil Density for API Tracking (Optional)
VOTAPI.long description: *VOTAPI indicates the input of an oil viscosity table that is a function of pressure (P), bubble point pressure (Pb) and STC oil density in an API tracking model.

VRI_GROUP.description: Injection Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
VRI_GROUP.long description: Specify the injection group from which gas/water/voidage injection rates will be taken to calculate a production recycling or voidage replacement target for a given group or groups. The actual recycling or voidage replacement target is specified using keyword *GCONP.

VSMIXFUNC.long description: *PMIX indicates the viscosity mixing model for the polymer solution is being defined. *VSMIXFUNC defines optionally the exponent function for the nonlinear mixing rule.

VWI.long description: *VWI signals the input of water viscosity (for a PVT region). *CVW signals the input of cvw (for a PVT region).

WATER_FIX.description: Formulation Modification for Blocks with No Hydrocarbon
WATER_FIX.long description: *WATER_FIX is used to override the default behavior in the simulator of handling bubble point pressure changes in water filled blocks.

WATVISC-T.long description: *OILVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of oil viscosity. *WATVISC-T specifies the temperature dependence of water viscosity. *VISC-REF specifies the reference conditions for the viscosity-temperature relationship.

WB-BLOCKBDYS.long description: For an iSegWell branch, *WB-BLOCKBDYS specifies the locations where the branch enters a grid block (lower md value) and then exits the grid block (higher md value). Each line in *WB-BLOCKBDYS includes the user block addresses (UBA), spatial coordinates (x, y, z), and measured depth of both the entry to and exit from a specific block. A branch can pass through any block more than once. Note: Refer to Appendix I for information about using Builder to convert trajectory information into iSegWell keywords, including *WB-BLOCKBDYS.

WB-PDMETHOD.long description: *WB-PDMETHOD specifies a method available for calculating the well index used to determine flow from the reservoir into the wellbore branch.

WB-PDPOINTS.description: Wellbore Branch Interval Pressure Drop Formula
WB-PDPOINTS.long description: *WB-PDPOINTS specifies intervals over which a certain pressure drop formula holds in a wellbore branch. This is accomplished by entering points where the pressure drop (PD) formula changes from one method to another, since no point in a branch can be left without a specified pressure-drop formula.

WB-PFINTVLS.long description: *WB-PFINTVLS adds perforated intervals to a wellbore branch.

WBRANCH.long description: *WBRANCH defines multi-lateral well branches using trajectory points.

WB-RISER.description: Define Links Included in Riser (Wellbore Branch)
WB-RISER.long description: *WB-RISER defines the links which are included in the riser (which we define as the final part of the flow path before it reaches the surface) and which is the part of the well over which the well head pressure (WHP) calculations are made when using *PWELLBORE / *IWELLBORE *MODEL or *TABLE.

WBROTATE.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBROTATE.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WBSHIFT.description: Shift and Rotate Well Branch Locations (Optional)
WBSHIFT.long description: *WBSHIFT and *WBROTATE allow location shifting and rotating of the wellbore branches defined by keyword *WBRANCH for wells.

WCURRCN.long description: Force a well to run on its current operating constraint without checking for constraint violation and possible switching.

WELGEO.long description: Specify geometric parameters for internal well index calculation of listed wells. *WELGEO overrides temporarily the global defaults specified by keyword *GEOMETRY.

WELLALQ.long description: Specify an artificial lift quantity (ALQ) value to be used with the tubing-head pressure hydraulics table *PTUBE1.

WELLINIT.description: Set Frequency of Initialization of Bottom-Hole Pressure (Optional)
WELLINIT.long description: *WELLINIT specifies the frequency of reinitializing the bottom hole pressure of a well running on rate, drawdown, or implicitly imposed well head pressure constraints.

WELLINTERACT.long description: The *WELLINTERACT keyword indicates whether the well interaction terms (derivatives of one simulator well’s target value with respect to another simulator well’s BHP) should be included in the simulator Jacobian matrix.

WELLIST.long description: *WELLIST creates and modifies well lists for use by keywords that require a list of wells.

WELLSHEAR.long description: Invoke the application of well shear model for non-Newtonian polymer solution.

WELLSITE.long description: *WELLSITE specifies the wellsite name. The wellsite is the highest unit in the CMG iSegWell hierarchy. Wellsites are independent of each other.

WGC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
WGC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, water-oil capillary pressure at the water-oil contact and gas-water capillary pressure at gas-water contact respectively. Values of *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC can be entered for each initialization region.

WIMETHOD.description: Method for Calculating Well Index for Flow from Reservoir into Wellbore
WIMETHOD.long description: *WIMETHOD specifies a method available for calculating the well index used to determine flow from the reservoir into the wellbore branch.

WIPOINTS.long description: *WIPOINTS specifies intervals where a specific perforation rule (well index formula) holds in a branch (wellbore). This is accomplished by entering points where the well index formula changes from one method to another, so no point in the branch is left without a specified formula.

WIRANGE.long description: *WIRANGE specifies the range of the constant geometric part of the well indices (WI) and takes proper actions if the well indices are out of the range.

WLISTOPEN.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTOPEN.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WLISTSHUT.description: Shut and Reopen a List of Wells (Optional)
WLISTSHUT.long description: *WLISTSHUT and *WLISTOPEN provide a means to shut temporarily a large list of wells and later re-open them without disturbing the pattern of shut and auto-drillable wells.

WMKMAXR.description: Maximum Water Make-up Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKMAXR.long description: Specify the maximum surface rate of make-up water injected as part of a group water recycling target to supplement the recycled water.

WMKUPTO.description: Water Make-up Target for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WMKUPTO.long description: Specify a total group water injection rate for each listed well group. The variable recycled water will be supplemented by make-up water to meet each group’s target, subject to other well constraints.

WMMSG.long description: Control the destination for output of Well Management (WM) messages for individual wells, groups, and other input-output messages generated from processing of recurrent section of the data file.

WMONITOR.description: Append Monitored Constraints to Listed Wells (Optional)
WMONITOR.long description: Append a well constraint (with remedial action) that is actively monitored but is not a candidate for sustained well operation.

WOC_PC.description: Specification of Capillary Pressure Values at Contacts (Optional)
WOC_PC.long description: *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC introduce the value of the oil-gas capillary pressure at the gas-oil contact, water-oil capillary pressure at the water-oil contact and gas-water capillary pressure at gas-water contact respectively. Values of *GOC_PC, *WOC_PC and *WGC_PC can be entered for each initialization region.

WOC_SW.description: Specification of Water Saturation Above GOC or Below WOC (Optional)
WOC_SW.long description: *GOC_SW and *WOC_SW allow the user to define the water saturation above the gas oil contact and below the water-oil contact for each initialization region.

WORKOVER-DATA.description: Data for Workover Action for Wells (Optional)
WORKOVER-DATA.long description: *WORKOVER-DATA introduces the input of parameters which control the *WORKOVER action taken when a producing well violates a minimum rate monitored constraint which has *WORKOVER specified as the action to be taken in the event that the constraint is violated. The *WORKOVER action is specified using the *MONITOR keyword. The workover parameters which can be entered using *WORKOVER-DATA can also be entered after the *WORKOVER action subkeyword of the *MONITOR keyword; *WORKOVER-DATA is somewhat more convenient to use and is meant to supplant parameter entry after *WORKOVER, which however is still supported.

WPLYFAC.long description: Specify the viscosity adjustment factor for polymer/water mixtures in wells.

WPRN.long description: *WPRN controls the frequency of writing data to the output file.

WPRODGROUP.description: Water Producing Group for Group Recycling/Voidage Replacement (Optional)
WPRODGROUP.long description: Specify the group from which water production rate (recycling) or total production rate (voidage replacement) will be taken to calculate a production-dependent water injection target specified for another group.

WRADIUS.long description: Assign well radius where boundary conditions are to be applied for the axisymmetric radial grid. The desired model can be either the plasticity model or plasticity with well boundary unloading.

WRECYMAXR.description: Maximum Re-injection Rate for Group Water Recycling (Optional)
WRECYMAXR.long description: Specify a maximum rate at which water is re-injected under a group recycling target.

WRST.long description: *WRST and *REWIND control the frequency of writing and rewinding restart records in the output restart file.

WSRF.long description: Control the frequency of dumping information flagged by *OUTSRF to the simulation result output files.

WTINCR.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTINCR.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

WTMULT.description: Alter Well Constraint Value via a Multiplier or an Increment (Optional)
WTMULT.long description: Apply a multiplying factor or an increment to any previously specified well constraint value.

XCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
XCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

XDR.long description: *OUTSRF identifies what information is written to the Simulation Results File.

XFLOW-MODEL.long description: *XFLOW-MODEL is used to identify the method used to model well backflow and crossflow in a specified set of wells.

YCORN.description: Lateral Corner Point Locations for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
YCORN.long description: *XCORN signals input of an array of corner point "x"-coordinate locations for corner point grids. *YCORN signals input of an array of corner point "y"-coordinate locations for corner point grids.

YLDSTRESS.long description: Define strength properties of the formation.

YOUNGMAP.long description: Specify properties for each grid cell separately, when the degree of non-uniformity would cause the number of rock types to be inconvenient.

ZCORN.description: Corner Point Depths for Corner Point Grids (Conditional)
ZCORN.long description: *ZCORN signals input of an array of corner point depths for corner point grids.

ZGUST.description: Condensate Model - Undersaturated Eg, Bg, Zg Table
ZGUST.long description: *EGUST, *BGUST or *ZGUST indicates the input of a gas expansion factor, gas formation volume factor or gas super compressibility table for condensate undersaturated gas.
